MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE! This location needs a Sangria Sunday like the Arcadia location, but I can get over it because I love them so much. Everything is delicious. The worst thing about leaving Arizona was leaving Postino behind as well.

In love with this place! This restaurant has been about 80 different things before they bought it and so happy they did! Finally, something to do in downtown Gilbert . Service is always fantastic and of course the food, drink, and atmosphere are fabulous. I've been about 10 times and it's never a bad experience.
Fun place for dinner if your not in a hurry. The staff is a little aloof for my taste. Definitely a pretentious crowd, but not horrible. The food is better than I expected.

Tapas, this is the way I like to eat.  A little bit of everything.
Great atmosphere, great food selection and quality.  
I had my first date with my soon to be fiance at the Kierland location.
The BEST bruschetta hands down!!! I like all their salad as well. Very tasty! Excellent hang out with family and friends.

Walked over here just now from Joyride,  Which we had to leave because the mood and vibe were akin to being laid back while watching the rest of the room spin out on speed!! Much better vibe and mood for this night . Bartenders are Laid back, not pretentious yet observant.  Ordered a nine iron and several bruschetta. The Brie, fig & Apple is delicious and the prosciutto & marscopone is heavenly!!!  Great ambience. We left at midnight and didn't feel rushed at all. There were still a few patrons chilling out.

One of my favorite places in the east valley. I always get the bruschetta, it is to die for. Can't say enough about it.  I also like the cr√©me brulee and the chocolate bouchon. Yum! 

However, I almost gave it a 4 star, because I asked the waiter what their twitter handle was and he said he didn't know what twitter was. Really? Trying so hard to be too cool for school.

But the ambiance and food made up for it.

Postino's is always a go-to spot when looking for a casual and fun night out. The bruschetta board it a staple as well as their panini's. Great wine list and everything is incredibly reasonable.

To top it off the service is always phenomenal. I wish I had the names of the workers who were closing on Thursday, July 2nd....we stopped in for just a couple glasses of wine before we decided we wanted to stay out a bit longer and went to Champions. There were three of us girls, we left Champions and started to be followed by two men...we were scared. We saw Postino's closing and asked if we could come in for our safety. They immediately let us in and the male workers went out and told the two men to get lost. Then they offered to walk us all to our cars. Couldn't have been more thankful!!!!

Position's is amazing!  The food is always on point, the Butcher Block & Bruschetta are always on the must have list when we visit!  It's a tad warm to be on the patio in the Arizona summer, but we always make do because the food and drink are so fabulous!  Always great service and the food is always always amazing!

Great atmosphere and a perfect patio when the weather permits! Come before five and get $5 glasses of wine and pitchers (2 pints) of draft beer!!

The wine list is always changing and the bruschetta is fantastic. I always finish up with the creme br√ªl√©e, certainly one of my guilty pleasures and theirs is delicious (from someone who lived in France).
Love it! Friendly bartenders, great ambiance and very refreshing to find in Gilbert!

Loved this place. Food was delicious and portions were just right. Good music and great atmosphere. The service overall was awesome they were all very attentive! I would definitely recommend this place. I love the fig and apple bruschetta.
Every single thing on their menu is  phenomenal. We love the bruschetta and pub board. With $5 wine and beer pitchers every day from 11-5 you can't go wrong!

Great little hipster wine bar in the heart of downtown Gilbert. Wine and fancy snacks are their fort√©. We had several kinds of bruschetta that were all light and tasty but didn't blow me away as it was average bread topped with average ingredients. The staff is very friendly but service was also average. We had a good time and got what we expected. The atmosphere was the best part, everyone's drinking wine so of course they're happy! Will probably have to get a full meal elsewhere but I would definitely come again if I had an occasion.

Always love Postino.  Whether  for happy hour with colleagues or after dinner out with friends.  It is always enjoyable.  The only reason it is not 5 stars is that there is always a wait (which is not bad) but there is plenty of room out back and could be more seating.  Otherwise, a 5 star experience every time.
Happy birthday to myself enjoying Bruschetta and vino tinto. Great ambiance and wonderful Food.

This place is horrible and the service actually disgusted me. I went there this last weekend; it was packed of course which is fine; however, everybody was running around in a chaotic manner as if they all were on day 1 of opening. Postino in Arcadia is a great place but Postino East has a lot to still improve on.  The male server on the lawn insisted we all be on the same check because we met a few friends there but I don't see why we would have to even do that as all other restaurants/bars don't require this. Then our table was finally ready after an hour wait. Once I informed them we only needed a table for 4 instead of 6 they then made us wait another 15 minutes even though the table was already cleaned for 6. So after not moving any tables the manager tells u we can take another table once it's cleaned.  The manager seemed irritated and rude just telling us to go back to the lawn and she would get us once the table was ready. My bruschetta came out 45 minutes later; even after the other 3 people had already received their meals. No idea as to why bruschetta would take longer to prepare??? Our server was also impatient and ill mannered. She kept asking where we got our glasses of wine and whether or not we paid for them already. I don't know why she felt the need to ask us this SAME question 3 times; each time she came over to the table?? Maybe she should've been more concerned with the crappy service she was providing and the fact the bruschetta was taking 45 minutes. I was considering having a bridal shower here and there's no way I will ever consider that again. I would hate to invite a bunch of guests to this place for them to be treated poorly by the ridiculously absurd customer service this place seems to enforce. I was really disappointed and will probably never go back again.  It's quite hard to explain the poor service. Go ahead and check it out for yourself but don't say I didn't warn u!!!
Frickin awesome!! Wine was amazing & the food choices were great!! Definitely would go back.
Glad to have a comfy wine bar on the East side. I love Postino, and would eat there every day if they served their Roasted Red Pepper & Gouda soup more regularly.

Always a long wait, but we were lucky and snagged seats at the bar. The bartenders were very friendly and all seemed to be working as a team to take care of bar top guests. The food and wine were delicious as always. They did change a great Chris Stapleton song about twenty seconds in for something more main stream! But I won't take a star away for that. Just don't let it happen again!

I conducted some interviews here for Avon and the management put me at a place where I could plug my computer in.   I thought that was wonderful.  The food was excellent and though I don't drink, the atmosphere was lively and packed. youravon.com/kmeyer2352

High energy, love the music, great food, great service by our server "Kristin." We have just relocated back to the east valley and found this jewel! Who knew?!! This is surely to become one of our favorites :):)

We went here for Sunday brunch (9-1).  It's a really open air restaurant. The front 'door' of the restaurant opens widely and there are long couches opening out onto the covered patio.  It was easy to imagine sitting there with friends sharing wine and appetizers.  The patio goes around the sides and towards the back there is a little grassy area that I imagine is pretty packed at Happy Hour.  The menu, food presentation, and d√©cor really make it feel like eating at a European bistro.

We sat on the side of the patio.  The road noise was a little bothersome - next time I would sit farther back on the patio.  (Note, we arrived at 8:50 so the restaurant was pretty empty and quiet at first - that may have made the road noise more noticeable.)  We were also right under a speaker -- some other reviewers have commented about the music being too loud.  I would imagine with our table location at peak time, conversation might have been tough.

Hubby had the bruschetta ($13.50) - Brie & Apples with Fig Spread, Ricotta with Dates & Pistachios, Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomatoes.  The bread was outstanding and the flavors really blended nicely.  He liked all of them, but his favorite was the ricotta with dates & pistachios - wouldn't have thought to put this combination together but it was outstanding.  

I had the roast beef Panini with ciabatta and romaine salad for the side.  The ciabatta was toasted which helped blend all the flavors.  It was very good.  I try to keep my carbs low so for the second half of the sandwich, I took the top of the bread off and ate it like a bruschetta. The romaine had feta cheese and very light sprinkling of seeds.  Not sure if there was a dressing but if so it was very, very light.

Had the cr√®me brulee for dessert.  Haven't had cr√®me brulee that good in Phoenix metro area since Elaine's closed.  Lots of vanilla bean flavor with a properly light and crispy carmelized top.  Mmm.

I had water and hubby had iced tea (although he didn't drink it because he doesn't care for fruit-flavored teas).  Bill came to $35.  They appear to run multiple specials where drinks are cheaper ($5 glass of wine).  I'm not a beer drinker but they seemed to have quite an eclectic selection of beer.

We live in Gilbert and the options for non-chain restaurants are pretty limited, so I think we'll be back.

This place has an awesome atmosphere. The food is incredibly modern, and delicious. They give generous portions on all their meals and appetizers; and reasonable wine and beer prices. I went with a large group of people, and we ordered a wide variety of food. Was easy and fun to share with the group. I would highly recommend ordering a large variety and sharing. Also, my girlfriend and I split a sandwich. They are HUGE, easily more than enough to share with someone. 

They seemed to have a lot of goat cheese on their appetizers, it would have been a little more exciting if they had a bigger spread of cheeses on their butchers board.  Which would be appreciated to pair with all of the wine they have here. 

And thanks Chelsea for the awesome service!

I love this place. Everyone is so friendly, but my favorite is Kenley. He is awesome. He always gives you the best deals and gives you the best tips!
The 5$ wine by the glass/pitchers of beer before 5 and the bruschetta are my favorite things there! With the bruschetta, don't be afraid to get creative!! You can ask for thin slices of bread or the fig spread on the prosciutto bruschetta, instead of the figs themselves (makes it easier to eat for sure). Every time I go here it is consistently good!! Definitely worth a trip to downtown Gilbert!!

Love coming here and always consider it a treat when I do! Good for a date night or catching up with friends.  I've had every bruschetta and each one was delicious. I've also tried some sandwiches and salads. If it's your first time, you definitely need to get the bruschetta.  It does get busy on their bruschetta + wine combo nights so I recommend getting there early or just plan on waiting a while. So glad they moved to the east valley!

My favorite spot in the Phoenix area! Delicious wine and bruschetta! The service is a bit rude and flippant at times-hit or miss really, but they're just trying to look like cool (wannabe) hipsters. I'll let them be. Great place though!
Great wine selection, delicious salads and paninis! Wait staff are so very attentive!

Finally went to Postinos after many people telling me how good it is. I went in with high exceptions and i was let down. Our food was overpriced and honestly not that good.  We ate on the patio and the misters were leaking on us, my friends pants where completely soaked, the service was ok but nothing special. There is really nothing for me at postinos, hope your experience is better

About damn time.

Anybody who's been to Postino Arcadia or Postino Central knows what to expect from a Postino restaurant:  great wine selection, incredible food, and a modern but relaxed atmosphere.

Postino East hits it out of the park as to each.  We went on opening day at 5:00, and managed to snag a table inside (it was COLD outside that day).  Service was snappy, especially considering it was the first day and super crowded.  My wife ordered a couple of bellini's and I had a "personal pitcher" (couple of pints) of Hop Knot IPA.  The kids split a mixed plate of turkey, apples, grapes and bread, along with fresh made lemonade.

I had a half Raspberry Chicken salad and a half of the Turkey Panini, and my wife had the same sandwich.  Food was excellent all around.  The Turkey Panini comes on your choice of ciabatta or foccacia bread, and has a wonderful pesto sauce on it.  It's really good.

We didn't even order the bruschetta, which we've had at Postino Central and which can't be beat.  Next time, for sure.

For our next visit we'll probably go between 11:00 and 5:00 pm, because there are $5 wines and personal pitchers of beer, every day of the week during those times.  We'll also hit it after movies, as it's open until Midnight every day of the week except Sunday (when it is still open until 11:00!)

They did a great job with the redesign.  The place is not large, but is a decent size, and has a nice modern wine-bar feel to it.  It's very comfortable.

Welcome to the east valley, Postino.  Please stay a while!

Menu needs more variety.  Food was pretty good but not noteworthy.  Service average as it was busy so we were always trying to flag down our server.  Noisy so a good place to bring kids as it's hard to hear anyone at your table anyway. Nice location and ambience is fun.
good place to hangout with friends and enjoy bruschetta :) great selection of wine too

I am loving Postino these days.  I am so, so happy that this in Gilbert.  This has become our favorite date night spot, particularly because of the $20 bottle and board deal on Monday and Tuesday nights.  $20 for a bottle of wine a bruschetta board?  Amazing deal.  They have a great patio, although I think it is going to be too hot to enjoy it in the near future.  

The atmosphere is fun and lively, and they play great music.  The bruschetta and other food is great.  They also serve brunch on the weekend mornings and that is tasty as well.  I do wish that they changed up their brunch and wine menu a little more often though.

Overall, totally fun place to go for a drink and some appetizers.

Amazing birthday dinner with my son! Yummy grilled cheese paired with the to-die-for roasted red pepper gouda soup! Super sensitive to my food allergies. Vegetarian friendly place. Awesome service and cozy, classy, chic atmosphere! Would definitely recommend this place to any individual or group!

Postino is a modern restaurant and wine bar in a bustling area, which is nice that other things are walkable! Theres a huge free parking lot behind the building too, which is a plus! 
There's a vast wine selection, bottles for sale to take home, and even beer for non-wine drinkers. I love love loved the Riesling they had available. The menu is soups, salads, and sandwiches with some nibbley type foods to choose from as well. Definitely some low-cal options for those watching their figures. 
I recommend the cheese board, BUT they brought it with our food rather than beforehand like an appetizer should be, which was awkward. The service was SLOWWWWWWW, like unbelievably slow. However, everything we tried was tasty. 
The price range was higher tier for what's offered food wise, in my opinion, but the wine prices seemed standard.

Love this place! Mostly because I love bread and olive oil. I've been here twice and both times was really happy with the food and service. The atmosphere of the place is very open air, laid back, hang out, and eat slowly. The first time I came we got a board and there were two spreads I could eat, one was a fruity jam spread. It was really good. The second time I came a ordered a veggie sandwich and just got it without cheese. The server was great and when I told her I was vegan and had some food allergies she kept coming back with suggestions and modifications for things I could eat. She told me which breads I could have and put in a substitute sauce instead of a creamy sauce on the sandwich. Really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. Try to come in the evenings or in cooler weather so we can sit on the patio or by a window. Love the layout and how there's couches and it's very loungey. Great spot! :)

Love the bruschetta, always have a difficult time picking only 4. Last time has the smoked salmon bruschetta, my wife had the tomato jam, and the requisite pistachio and date bruschetta we always get. This location is very quaint ina nice space. Had to wait a bit on a Fridat at 2:00pm, but the service was excellent. Great happy hour for glasses of wine.

I do not understand all the hype and high reviews. I have several friends that have raved about this place since they opened and I have personally seen the long wait lines to get in. DO NOT come here for the food, you will leave hungry and disappointed. It is a WINE bar with fancy-schmancy "snacks." Service was good. Served quickly. Probably to get us out quickly. Music was loud. Front patio not as enjoyable due to all the car noise on the street. Again, I do not understand  the popularity of this restaurant. I will not be returning. P.S. I'm hungry.

I don't know why I have never left a review for one of my favorite places! my husband and I enjoy going here on our date nights... food is delicious ,great beer and wine ,staff is always so friendly and helpful, I have never ever had anything on the menu that is bad always delicious and flavorful... my husband loves the prosciutto and jam panini it sounds weird but it's really good!  they also have great outdoors seating and on certain days of the week live music....

I've been hearing about this place since it opened. I must have missed something cause...it wasnt that great. The atmosphere was nice. The employees were nice. The wine and beer selection were nice....but when I go to a place with an Italian name like Postino's, I expect them to have an amazing Italian sandwich. The sandwich that I got was not amazing, not great, not good, not nice. Probably the worst Italian sandwich I've ever had. The little side salad that they served with it was money, but the sando needs some work. The meat was funky, the foccicia was oily and the spicy relish on it just tasted off. I'll go back again to give them another shot definitely need to order something else.

I ordered bruschetta to go the other day to share. I got a variety with: Salmon w pesto,
Apple w Brie & fig spread,
Prosciutto w dried fig & mascarpone , and 
Bacon w tomato & arugula 

The salmon with pesto was my favorite. The capers did them well to give it that little bit of acidity. 

The apple w brie fig spread I was hoping to be super refreshing but my apples tasted like garlic and lemon vs a nice sweet tart Apple to break into the richness of the Brie. 

Prosciutto with fig and the bacon w tomato arugula: maybe I had an off day and someone heavily salted the bread.. Both were so salty around the edges every bite hurt and my tongue shriveled. I didn't experience that I suppose with the other two because it wasn't being eaten with salty toppings. 

The arugula and tomato ate through the bread and I had a soggy mess. For those types I might even suggest requesting putting the toppings on the side to be constructed later. 

Minor disappointment - I don't remember it tasting like this when I dine in at their other restaurant. I'll have to give them a try sitting in. I know I know shame on me for being busy and ordering to go. Anyone have to go tips for this?

What an outstanding opening party today... on St. Patty's day, none the less!
They opened for a select group of visitors from 2-6pm today and it included wine/beer and bruschetta for a cost of $25.  What a way to start off in the neighborhood!

I noted an excellent staff - friendly, prompt, and definitely well prepared for the onset of traffic that has been long awaiting the opening of this place.  Even when there were gobs of people in line for food and drink, they were kind, smiley and very up-beat.

The food was, as always, outstanding.  Great bruschetta variety and an impressive display of wines.

I'm excited this opened up in our neighborhood and I can't wait to come here again!
The best bruschetta! Great time, every time!  This is a good place for a date or even a special event.  Plan to wait in line but it is worth it!
A fun, modern atmosphere with a wide array of wines. The bruschetta board was spot on. Next time we will visit for a full meal.

My sister-in-laws haven't stopped talking about how we needed to try Postinos.  It turns out they couldn't have been more right.  We got to the restaurant just shy of 5:00 with the Happy Hour soon ending.  We ordered 2 bottles of wine at the Happy Hour price which served our party of 5 well for the rest of the evening.  We sat outside in a very nice booth.  The hostess rolled an outdoor heater over close enough to the table to take the rare chill out of the air, but not so close to be too hot.  We ordered 3 rounds of the bruschetta (at 4 toppings per round).  The traditional mozzarella and basil was as good as it is anywhere (how can you mess up this combo?).  What was pleasantly surprising were the many other bruschetta combinations.  The burrata, bacon, arugula, and tomatoes combo was a repeat order and we probably should have ordered 2 at a time.  It was hard to feed all 5 with 4 sections of bruschetta.  The salami and pesto was also a favorite and ordered twice.  We will definitely be going back.

My sister-in-law had been telling me about this place for a few years but we'd never gotten around to trying it. Over Thanksgiving weekend we finally made it there with her and her husband. I wish we'd tried it sooner! We had a really great time and the food was delicious.

We came right at the tail end of happy hour so we got the individual beer pitcher special. Five bucks for a pitcher? I'd be a total alcoholic if I lived in Gilbert. The beer selection is pretty good and those individual pitchers are not tiny. They also have a really great wine selection. My sister-in-law and I had the Sangiovese and we both loved it.

At her recommendation, my husband and I got a bruschetta board. You get to pick four of their unique bruschettas and they're served on a cutting board. We liked all of the ones we tried but I think my favorite was the one with pistachios and figs...or maybe they were dates. I can't exactly recall. Did I mention how cheap the beer was? LoL I was tempted to order another board and try more varieties but the panini looked too good to pass up. It was really good and they split the order for my husband and I with no additional charge. 

The atmosphere was really nice. We sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful fall weather. Even though the patio was packed it didn't feel crowded. Everyone has their own space. If we didn't have plans with our parents-in-law later that evening I could've eaten and drunk another round of everything. This place is at the top of my list the next time I visit my family in Arizona!

I hate to give such a terrible review for a restaurant I love, but the food and wine just can't make up for the horrible service we received tonight. We sat at the outside bar, and he first bartender, Patrick, was wonderful. Attentive, pleasant, and made sure we didn't go more than a few minutes without acknowledgement (and he was busy!). Unfortunately, 30 minutes into our stay, he was tasked with other items and Steve took over. We went about 30 minutes with no acknowledgement whatsoever. We had empty glasses and tried repeatedly to gain his attention, but he apparently thought it was more important to hit on a girl at the other side of the bar than pay attention to his customers. Even when our friend joined us, he didn't take notice - another server stepped in and asked us if we needed anything. Overall it was quite a disappointing experience, especially from somewhere we frequent and have grown to enjoy. I'm sure I will be back, but I will avoid the bar if Steve is working.

Postinos really has a few things nailed down well:

- Price: I think it is Monday and Tuesday that you can get a bottle of wine and a board of bruschetta for $20 !!!.  The wine is not panther piss either and actually quite good so I challenge you to beat that deal.

- Style:  No matter where you are seated, you feel the great vibe and it's a great place to chill with a group of friends.

- Diversity:  Great bar area, lounge area, outdoor area, grass (fake) area with adirondack style chairs, and street view.  

- Quality:  The food is always pretty darn good.  I tend to drink more than I eat here and also never get disappointed by the beer selection.  My wife loves their "house" reds too.

On the down side some of the areas can feel a little cramped.  Some of the tables in the middle of the dining room feel right on top of others.  It is also always busy which though fun can be a bummer if you are trying to find a spot.  You almost have to have a plan of attack on a weekend to get some good digs.

If you haven't been, I'd suggest hitting it on off times or mid week and I'm certain you will enjoy it.  If Yelp supported half stars this would surely get a 4.5.  

Great to see another quality anchor for the DT Gilbert scene.

I must admit, I'm a massive fan of Postino Arcadia and Phx... Years ago, when I heard they were building a (Cue dramatic and skeptical voice) Giiiiiiiiiiiiiiiilbert location I turned up my nose. Fast forward a few years, I own a house down the road and am ECSTATIC to be eating and drinking my words at one of the best spots in Gilbert. I was worried that the unique charm and atmosphere wouldn't translate. I'll be honest, I still prefer Arcadia/Phx but am happy to say that they did a great job of transplanting this gem.

I can't get enough of this place. I frequent almost once a week. The drinks, food, atmosphere so phenomenal. Very trendy but relaxed. Their happy hour is great and late night happy hour on Monday and Tuesday I have yet to try. Sometimes there is quite a wait but I can understand why for being one of the only places of its kind in the Gilbert area. Definitely have to try their bruschetta board. I've tried all of them and they all are very good though our faves are the Brie and apple, burrata bacon, and tomato jam. Totally obsessed with their pub board as their warm salty pretzels are killer. Love love love this place!

We were so excited when we first heard that Postino's had opened closer to where we live ... It's definitely a great hangout spot! We've been there a couple of times now & have had the Bruschetta, the Grilled Cheese, & the Pub Board. I'd say that out of all the offerings, their bruschetta is definitely the best! The Brie & Apples with Fig Spread, the Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, and the Ricotta with Dates & Pistachios are my favorites. The Pub Board & Grilled cheese were quite good (especially since the Grilled Cheese came with a variety of dipping sauces & the Pub Board was pretty large), but they weren't as good as the bruschetta. If you're a wine drinker,  $5 for a glass is a pretty good deal. The only thing is that the wait times are normally really long, especially if you go in the evening and because most people enjoy sitting & drinking wine while chatting with their party, the wait times they tell you are normally not very accurate.

I got lunch here with based on my coworkers suggestion. The panini itself was good, the issue was how I had asked for the cheese on the side because my wife is allergic to dairy and I was sharing it for her. When I picked it up to go they assured me the order was complete, I get home and what do you know, the cheese is completely melted on the sandwich. I called in to let them know they messed it up, and they're just like, oh, I'll let the chefs know. There was no apology or a rain check for a corrected sandwich. It's getting harder to find competent service where they can get it right the first time. 

Edit: Stuff happens, but food allergies are important. Joe's Farm Grill has an excellent approach to handling allergies. All the grills are cleaned and the employees change gloves when making special orders. 

TL;DR
The food is great there, make sure the order is complete before leaving.

Loooove Postinos . 

If you live in the Gilbert area you know there are not that many places around and Postinos is quite the swanky spot. 

Great deals. Great for daytime drinking and eating. Close to all other places. Easy to walk around and great happy hour deals. You simply can't go wrong 

The bruschetta is amazing. Then again so is everything else. 

Will be back many more times.

Well the food is good. The wine is good our server totally ignored us. Took our order and brought the check. The other staff members were there to help us as we flagged them down - for wine, for the missing meal for our child, for drink refills, for everything. Our guy "JT" was busy chatting up a couple of ladies for 14 minutes while we waited to get someone's attention to order wine.  Unacceptable. 

We tipped because of the staff and let the young lady who identified as manger know how we were treated.  

We'll return but if this guy is still employed and we're seated with him, we'll either leave or request an alternate server. 

Like the place though...very much!

Postino East is a great place to eat gluten free Bruschetta.  There are wine bottles everywhere.  The atmosphere here is lively and festive .  It is wide open with the inside flowing to the outside (the garage doors are always open).  This is such a wonderful place to be on this beautiful day in Gilbert Arizona.  Julie did a great job at the bar.

Another great find for gluten free options!! We had the grilled cheese appetizer which they made gluten free and it was out of this world!! The best gluten free grilled cheese we have ever had! Nothing in the menu is bad. Such a cute atmosphere!! We love having date nights here!
Postino East is one of my favorite places to eat. The atmosphere is welcoming, and the quality of food is always amazing.

Went for a Sunday brunch - we were seated outside and The atmosphere and service were great. The food was good but not great. The bottle of champagne and carafe of orange juice for mimosas was way too expensive ($30).
This place is delicious!!!! The boards, the bread, the Beer!! Oh and my waitress was Beth and she's the Best! Look at all the B's!!!!! I highly recommend this place and even better the patio.

I'm visiting from Utah and some friends told me this was their favorite spot. On our way walking up to the restaurant, my heel on my boot decided to break off. Laughing it off, we were seated at the couches and tried ourselves to attempt to get the shoe on. Within seconds, the manager appears at our table with superglue and comes over to aid me. Seriously? Incredible. After minutes of attempting to glue it back on, we chalked it up for a loss. After 20 minutes, he comes back with a power drill and says "let's try this again". He then attempted AGAIN to fix my shoe. I have never experienced better customer service than this place. This guy was incredible. Regardless of the food (which was the best artichoke dip and best bruschetta I've ever had) I rate it 5 stars from his kindness.

I have to say there is not much than can go wrong with a restaurant the specializes in wine, cheese and all things Italian.  Went on a Saturday night while a holiday fair was being had so getting to the location was a bitch.  Parking is pretty atrocious on a regular Saturday night let alone when an event is being held.  The service is efficient and friendly nothing out of the ordinary.  Food and wine is why you come here and why I keep going back. Thank goodness for the other locations which have better parking.

Try the bruschetta, my favorite was the goat cheese and pepper. The service was good and the place has a very trendy feel to it. The menu is limited but the good was good. It was loud and the music could be turned down a bit to be able to carry a conversation.  The outdoor area is really nice.

I love this place. 
It is a very cool set up - glass garage door, outside patio couch seating, great music. 
FINALLY  a cool place in Gilbert! 
My fiance and I have gone here a few times, and have yet to be disappointed. 
We've done a wine night, and light dinner/drinks. Both were great.
The bruschetta = amazingness. 
I would definitely recommend stopping in for a night out.

This is my absolute FAVORITE place to eat! It's expensive but so worth it! I love the people who work there, super hipster but it's cute! The cucumber honey lemonade and spicy mozzarella chicken sandwich keeps me comin back!
Incredible value for happy hour.  Reasonably priced beer and wine and some great sandwiches.  Couple that with some of the friendliest wait staff in the area, and you have a winner.

The bruschetta/wine deal for $20 is fantastic.  My favorite brushettas are the apple and the salmon. Unfortunately when I went, my group had to sit under the outdoor misters, which were on full blast.  By the end of the night our clothes felt damp.  I also wish Postinos would take reservations.

I've been here for dinner, brunch, and happy hour. I couldn't love a wine bar more than I do this one!....especially for Gilbert! Was there last night and although we waited a good hour to be seated it was WELL worth it. I got the bruschetta of course and so far I've yet to have a bruschetta there that didn't please me. They've got a great selection of wine (not beer though and honestly who wants beer at a wine bar anyway?). We got comfy seating very intimate, I would want a date to take me here for sure! The server was very attentive and I really believed her when she had eaten the menu items she was very knowledgable. If you want a great breakfast this place is the way to go seriously tasterific and the mimosas are abfab. Highly recommend this joint be prepared to wait on the weekends but enjoy a wine while you do because they have a server to assist.

Brunch. Came here because I was given a free brunch entree due to Arcadia's location reaching 1000 yelp reviews. As usual this place is packed. We were told a 45 minute wait but ended up only waiting 20 minutes! With a simple text we were notified our table was ready. While waiting outside they have a server to take drink orders which is an effective way to earn more business. Great job!

Weather was cool and crisp but got a table inside. At least the door walls were wide open. We immediately ordered from the brunch menu. I laid eyes on the Farm Scramble (which reminded me of Essence Bakery's French Scramble).  See below. This one had roasted Yukon potatoes meshed with onions, Gruyere cheese, cheddar white cheese, herbs. Quite tasty! I was not full from this so I luckily ordered an apricot scone. This was a nice treat. 

We also ordered the Morning Staple: 2 eggs cooked to your liking, bacon, walnut toast and roasted potatoes. When this plate came out the potatoes were lightly sprinkled over the eggs as garnishment. This might satisfy a petite woman but not so for a hungry man. Prepare yourself for another order of something else. After paying the bill only did we realize that we didn't get the bacon!! - the most wanted piece!! How did we miss that?! To our surprise the server came to us as we were walking away from the table and offered us a free bruschetta board for next time! Totally unexpected but cool! 

Stars taken away due to: no stirring spoon for coffee. Portion was just a little too petite. The missed bacon was made up for. 

On a side note: 
(Just because this was too similar I had to do a Comparison).

Farm: Roasted potatoes. Scrambled Eggs. Onions. Gruyere cheese. Herbs. White cheddar. Side salad greens and cherry tomatoes. Petite portion. $9.75. Delicious. 

French: Slow cooked scrambled eggs. Chives. Dijon Mustard. Cream. Parmesan Cheese With Homemade Buttered Toast & Jam. Decent portion.  $6.75. Add $2 for bacon or sausage.  Delicious. 

Overall: Although both are delicious the Better value would be the French Scramble.

I'm not a wine person. Sure, I'll hammer a whole box of Franzia around a campfire (true story) but I know little-to-nothing about wine. I'm the type of guy who orders white wine with steak. All I know is that if I am going to get wine and attempt to act like I know what I'm doing then I prefer rose, white, and red... in that order.

With that said, Postino is a place for people who enjoy the finer items of wine. This is a place where I could see aficionados discussing vineyards, swirling their glasses (in the correct glass for that particular wine), and making sure that their wine "compliments" their food selection. This would be the equivalent of bearded men wearing plaid talking about who brews their craft beer, what type of hops it has, and beating their chest about who has the best brewery setup in their closet at home. Don't get me wrong - both of these dances are fine in my book... I'm just giving you the vibe I get with Postinos (honestly, I'm exaggerating. The place is pretty normal).

The food here is pretty good. And, when in Rome, do as the Romans do - the wine was pretty good too.

If you like wine, this is probably a stop you should make in the lovely downtown Gilbert.
Wow.  Great atmosphere fun place  would like to come back here again service is good and friendly fun times. Happy hour could be a little longer til six maybe but great price on the glass of wine

Really cool spot for happy hour or just to relax after work. The staff is amazing Jason at the bar was more then helpful. One of the best places I've been to since moving to Az about a month ago and definitely will be returning. Great wine and good vibes.
Pretty cool place. The happy hour special was great. $5 dollar wines and $5 beer pitchers. And 4 different bruschetta's for $10.

Normally 5 stars at other locations but seems this one is a little bit less than.  Normally not the case but today tomatoes were not fresh on the bruschetta and he fruit flies, flies and bugs would leave us alone.  Bugs - okay doors are open, but fruit flies are result of bar issues.  Staff are still fantastic!

As a fan of Postino in Arcadia I was really disappointed with my Postino experience in Gilbert.  We had a group of 7 and on a Friday night we knew that we wouldn't be easily accommodated.  With that said, the Postino in Arcadia is always more than willing to help large or small groups to feel comfortable even when they're slammed.

We arrived at 9pm, and the hostess told us that we could go to the first come first serve lawn area and have drinks.  This was fine with us, except the large lawn area probably has about 10 chairs total.  We decided to work with it, ordered 2 bottles of wine and 4 by the glass.  One end of the lawn had no chairs yet a heating lamp, while the other side had chairs and no lamp.  We asked the server if we could move the lamp once we finally were able to sit down, and he refused.  We also noticed a stack of chairs that weren't be used, and they said that we couldn't use them.  Very unaccommodating.  

I must say that the wine selection is great, but when the service sucks whats the point?

This place is so LOVED by everyone of our clients that we decided to have a contest and give away two $25.00 Gift cards for Valentines Day the results were Great!!  I highly recommend everyone check it out on Monday and Tuesday after 8pm for a Great Deal $20.00 bottle of wine and bruschetta tray. Great friendly service and atmosphere.  My wife and I enjoy riding our bikes to Postinos on Monday nights what a great evening. We always take our out of town friends and they look forward to their next visit.  Be sure to have a designated driver. Just saying!!

What's not to love? Delicious drinks and a really friendly hip wait or was the first thing I liked about this place.  There is lots of staff around and any were willing to be helpful by clearing our plates,  and making sure our glasses stayed full.  The bruschetta is LITERALLY something I craved for a week after I ate there and as I type this I'd like to get back.  We tried 4 different kinds,  one with butternut squash and pumpkin that I couldn't eat fast enough.  We ate outside and it was absolutely beautiful but even the inside would have been nice because it too has a cool atmosphere.  

Last note,  their happy hour is awesome and they have a few differ the specials during the week as well.

We had a lovely lunch on their patio. We each had a glass of rose (great prices on glasses of wine before 5:00) and split an order of bruschetta. You get 4 bruschetta's per order and the selections were all excellent. It was enough for the two of us to have a light lunch. Service was excellent. Actually, the gentleman that served our wine was very easy on the eyes! I will return...

Absolutely amazing!! Happy hour is until 5 everyday, with five dollar glasses of wine. The bruschetta is a must have, my fave was the warm artichoke. Atmosphere was exceptional, very open floor plan and modern decor.

If it's possible, my love for Postino has only increased. I decided to throw a baby shower for my friend here, and it turned out beautifully. I never had a problem with my calls being returned, and the managers I spoke to were extremely helpful and friendly.

We had our shower at the front of the restaurant which utilized both indoor and outdoor couches. We had the space for 2 hours plus they let us come in early to decorate.

Pricing is wonderful for a larger party. If you have the party inside the restaurant like we did, regular menu pricing applies. You could have it out on the lawn using the catering menu pricing which is an even better deal .I also love that they don't charge for bringing in a cake. You can order cookies through their sister restaurant Churn which is a great dessert option.

I fed a party of ten 4 bruschetta boards, a cheese board, bottle of wine, and "mass-mosa" (bottle of champagne + OJ carafe) for ~$10 a person plus tip. I pre-ordered some paninis too but ended up cancelling them at the last minute, and our waitress was very nice about it.

Overall, it was a fun, beautiful day, and our baby shower went very smoothly. I would host another party here in a heartbeat.

Walked in on a Saturday night and was quickly told by which looked like a waiter that they were closed. It was only 10:15 so I'm not sure why the man said they were closed.
Never going back, a place like that doesn't deserve my business.

I love this place. My man and I sit at the bar and drink wine and beer and eat bruschetta. I don't always love the soup but I never dislike it. Tomatoes and mozzarella are a hit. Italian picnic salad is awesome. Even the grilled cheese rocks. Bartenders are always friendly especially the dude with the headband and the other tall guy who's name I always forget.

Wow. That music. They've clearly spent some time understanding acoustics, maybe they hired out an audio engineering? You can hear the proper stereo effects even when you haven't even stepped foot on the premises yet. THAT'S good design.

The wine selection is here is appropriate and the cheese boards are to die for. You MUST get a board, I recommend The Bounty, which their website currently describes as: "Grilled cauliflower, asparagus, and a variety of vegetables served with Guindilla peppers, spicy Marcona almonds, herb cucumber cream dipping sauce and smoked almond hummus"

Seating is plentiful, and service is kind. Come here often!

We've been to Postino East for brunch before, but this was our first time at dinner. I wanted to order a light meal and the Tuna Nicoise was a perfect choice. I couldn't have been more happy. An abundance of tuna, fresh greens, hard boiled egg, gold potatoes, crispy green beans and an assortment of olives was absolutely delicious. I selected a red blend wine to complement my meal. Service was attentive and the lively atmosphere wasn't too loud to distract from dinner table conversation. I enjoyed our brunches at Postino - now dinner. We'll have to come back again and try out their wide variety of bruschetta.

Another great restaurant in downtown Gilbert.  Their food and drinks are great and my only semi-complaint is sometimes it seems like you don't get quite enough food for the price.  Otherwise highly recommended!

I don't know why people love this place so much. The waits are always long. The food is average (bruschetta is so soggy! Ugh!). The location is premier so I can see the appeal of that. 
I did have a great holiday party there one year with good service (still bad food!). But other times service has been slow. 
Overall, low rating from me. Two stars is because they do have a decent happy hour.

I don't know how it took me this time to write a review! We love this Postinos location! My husband baby and I come here at least once a week for brunch. The staff is so great and the hostesses always remember us and are so sweet! Love them! I do wish they would bring back the tomato jam bruschetta but great that it's occasionally a seasonal. Stay amazing Postinos! :)

To be honest - the lady next to me is complaining about pretty much everything and is being ridiculous. This obviously isn't her type of restaurant. She just threatened to post on Yelp, so I'm dropping a much deserved 5 star rating to counter act her silliness.
I really like the atmosphere in this place. The wine selection is good and the bruschetta is delicious. I can't wait to go again.
The service here is exceptional. The food is delicious, a lot of flavor in smaller portions which is perfect for social occasions. The set up they have for the dogs is really neat too!

Let me preface this review with what was certainly an unfair beginning bias. I have long been a fan of Fifth and Wine. It was my first wine bars, and still holds a firm grip on my affections, preconceived notions and standards. 

That gotten out of the way, I really enjoyed Postino. They decor was skillfully designed to project casual minimalist and hipster sophisticated simplicity. The place was jam packed at 8 pm on a Wednesday evening, one of the raw spectacles that is such a stark opposition to Payson life that I very often now find myself absorbing the fascinating juxtaposition. But total sidebar aside, the Argentinian Merlot was pristine. It seemed unpretentious in its offering of beers as well. We ordered a bowl of olives that was not even close to being on my radar, but Helena insisted and I am stoked that she did. About half a dozen varieties, and all of them were gorgeous and paired with the bruschetta plate and wine. 

The bruschetta bread was a bit soft and thick for my liking. I prefer the crisper thinner cut on the bread, but totally just my personal preference. Some might prefer the doughy bread texture for their app. We chose our four to include a selection of savory and sweet; classic Margherita, white bean paste with tomatoes (we added pesto), warm artichoke spread, and ricotta with pistachio and date. Not a single one disappointed.

 The waitress was genuinely likable, accommodating and very helpful 

I chose a ciabatta sandwich with a nice brie, fig jam and prosciutto, garnished with arugula. Helena had black bean soup. Both were really well crafted with full complex bold flavors. The food menu was simple but all of it was perfectly matched to the wine. There was a lot of moaning and nodding going on during the meal, which is always a good sign. 

The price points were also a really nice surprise. Very moderate for a good clean well constructed food. We will definitely be returning to travel through the rest of the menu.

I'm a wine and bruschetta lover. Therefore, I naturally love Postinos.The ambiance of this location is great, it has the perfect amount of sunshine on the patio. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Sunday brunch service can be a little slow but overall Postinos is a great brunch spot and they have great offerings on wine by the glass & bottles.

I tried Postino's on a Saturday night for a first date. The restaurant-ish bar was clean and attractive, although not exactly conducive to a first date for me as I prefer a quiet setting so I can hear the conversation.

We selected wines recommended by the server and they were good. The food menu was very limited because, as I understand it, they don't have a 'real' kitchen in which they can prepare regular fare. We started with a meat and cheese tray which was over-flowing with nuts, cheeses and cuts of meat I've never seen, heard of, or tasted before. Some were ok, but one of the meats in particular was absolutely horrible. In all fairness, I'm a picky eater, so perhaps it was just me and not the meat. 

I ordered a chicken panini for my entree. It took a while to get our food and unfortunately, it wasn't worth the wait. I had not had a panini in years and was looking forward to what I remembered being a fantastic, crunchy but gooey mess of chicken and cheese.... sadly, the consistency was more like what I expect tofu would be like. It was mushy through and through. The bread was mushy and the chicken was pasty. It was disappointing to say the least.

Overall, my visit was 'ok'. My date thought it was better than I, she probably would have given it 4 stars.

Love the fun atmosphere and food is awesome!  Very clever way to present an assortment of bruschetta. My mouth is still watering! Cheese boards were great as well! Sandwiches are incredible!  Nothing they serve is bad! A place not to go if you're trying to keep your figure! Ate too much! The they blend their food the way they do and when it all comes together is like heaven. Go early, cuz dinner time it's a zoo!!  

My only complaint was the service... Really slow if the place is busy.  My suggestion is to go before it gets too busy.
A new favorite for us. Great food and atmosphere with reasonable prices. The combo deal for $10 is a winner.
My favorite spot!! The bruschetta boards are incredible. I would eat here daily if I could.

The service here leaves a lot to be desired. I came as part of a large group for a celebration. We tried to make reservations 2 weeks in advance for our group of 10+ but were told they don't take reservations. The day of we tried to at least give them a head's up that a large group was planning to come in and were told that they in fact do take reservations for larger groups, but couldn't provide us with a reservation on the day of. Excellent.
We waited for about an hour and a half for our tables, which was understandable because they were busy and there was a lot of us. The bartender was very nice and brought drinks out to us in the yard, but put everything on one check, and it wasn't an easy process to split.
The food was good, I had the Autostrata and a butcher block appetizer. The block was amazing. Their hummus was out of this world, and should really be featured on its own. The staff was nice, but not entirely attentive. I would have ordered another beer but didn't see our server again until it was time to leave.  The music is loud, but good. 
At the end of the meal we encountered more check splitting issues. It took about a half hour to get straightened out. The issues kind of put a damper on the evening, which was disappointing. 
Over all, the food is good, keep your party small and expect issues when it comes to check splitting.

I did Happy Hour here 3pm on a Friday afternoon. The place was packed. The hostess told me it woud be a 20 minute wait since there were to be 5 in my party and offered me the patio. I kind of rolled my eyes at that one. I mean, August in Arizona on a patio with no misters? Really? Fortunately, I spotted a friend who had spotted a table that was just being cleaned. We nabbed it and the hostess was kind enough to bring another chair without our asking. Nice.

Postino's itself is a small place. I wish it were larger as it is very popular. The music is much too loud for comfortable conversation, as well. 

After a chat with Shawn about the wine/beer list, we ordered. Friend had a merlot thst she relly enjoyed while I had a pinot grigio which disappointed. After viewing my attempts to like it, Shawn approached and offered me a different beverage. However, I was not staying long, so I declined. Ten minutes later, he returned with a bottle of beer I had mentioned was my favorite and whisked away the offending pinot. Is that AMAZING service or what? 

On to the food. Friends tried a bruschetta selection and the mozzarella/tomato/basil appetizer. While I am told the bruschetta was excellent, the mozzarella was bland. If not for the tasty pesto, she likely would not have finished it. 

Another word about the service. Although the place was packed, we were given attention from three servers, one of whom brought multiple orders of the pesto for my friend.That's attentive to the max.

I give Postino East four stars for the stellar service and tasty bruschetta. I will likely be back when the temps cool a bit.

This is my all time favorite place to go for celebrations. I love all of the locations and the atmosphere. Their rotating wine selection is great and who can beat $5 glasses? The bruschetta (all of them) are seriously the best! Pick and combination of bruschettas to try and you will not be disappointed. Don't pass up dessert either - the creme brulee or the salted caramel sundae and both delectable!

I love Postinos! I've only been here for Mondays and Tuesdays $20 bruschetta and wine specials. You get a full bottle of wine and four big pieces of assorted bruschetta. Perfect amount to split between two! Can't go wrong with any of the flavors of bruschetta. There's usually not a wait which surprises me, because it always seems busy.

I had lunch on a Friday. There is a wait, so I recommend reservations. The food was fabulous! I had half a sandwich and salad. Absolutely no complaints with the food. It was busy, so we did have to wait a little while to get our check.

Great atmosphere with indoor outdoor feel. Sit down style restaurant bit more on the fancy side but it is a wine bar after all.

Went for brunch and had BLT with egg and it was mighty tasty. Need to go back and try more.
We loved this place.  Good happy hour....fun place to hang out.  Good drinks and delicious bruschetta boards.  Will definitely return.

Just ok. Came here for Monday happy hour after 8pm. We waited forever to be seated after being 'forgotten'. Then found out they were out of wine glasses. Really, a wine bar who runs outs of wine glasses. The bruschetta bread was hard and just ok. Wine was ok as well, but nothing to write home about. Probably won't be back.

I love their bruschetta! My favorite is the ricotta, date and pistachio. My friend and I had the creme brulee which was very good and she likes the cucumber lemonade. If I liked cucumbers it would've been good, but the cucumber taste was overpowering for me. Another time, I had the apricot scone which was actually made how scones should be, crispy outside, tender inside. It was excellent. we always have good service too.

So so place.  I guess its nice to have in downtown Gilbert but whoever they have expediting their food orders needs to be fired.  My gf and I were the 4th table sat at Lunch and it still took 40 minutes to get 2 half/half sandwich/salad orders.  40 MINUTES!!!! Are you serious?  Can you imagine going to paradise bakery or wildflower and waiting 40 minutes?  The service is good and the waiters and waitresses kept the drinks full and kept apologizing for the wait.  The food is so-so.  My salad had a million onions, but my gf's was just right.  The panini's were nothing to write home about.  I guess I would go back if a bunch of friends wanted to go and hang out for the wine but I wouldn't go back again for a quick lunch.

No self respecting New Yorker (as I am) would continue to allow the "NYC Grilled Cheese" on the menu here without calling it out! Just call it "Grilled Cheese" and leave us out of it because it's not good! No NY diner would serve this!  The bruschetta was good though. The prosciutto is the best and if the bread was toasted slightly it would have been perfect!

squint your eyes and push out your lips first and then read the next sentence in a super pompous jerk voice....."ill take your finest pinot and goat cheese bruschetta board".......you have just impersonated 73% of the people that go here. the other 27% are super indie looking kids with original septum piercings and very cool Indian feather tattoos on their shoulder blades. The wait staff are super chill and cool about everything. The beer is aight and I am a man so I don't drink wine. That last comment just fired up the majority of Postinos patrons.....im outta here!
This place is awesome i like the look of the restaurant. The waiters are so friendly as well. I love their tuna nicoise salad and their sandwiches. So eager to try their soup on my next visit

Probably the best place in down town Gilbert. this place is really what brought the cool modern vibe to DTG and has kept with the new restaurant boom that has happened recently. It is always busy so expect a wait but the wait is well worth it. Amazing food. Great drinks. Awesome atmosphere. They have great deals through out the week. Their brunch is one of the best brunches I have ever been to. Their french toast is my absolute favorite!
This is one of my year long cravings. Their bruschetta is the best. Good prices love the atmosphere.

Waiting two hours just to get two chairs without a table? No thanks..I'll come back in a few months when the shiny wears off a bit. We had high hopes based on the PHX location, but if you're making we wait two hours to get seated, you should let me know ahead of time that we could end p without an actual table when we get seated. The antipasti at the bar was good, but I'll come back and give a more thorough evaluating. Until then, Liberty Market still wins in service without having actual table service.

I'm going to make this nice, short, and sweet.

Jesse was our server, he did a fantastic job. Duncan, among 2 or 3 others helped ensure our evening was as expected, dropping in, removing dishes off our table. Justin, the manager, whom we spoke to last night about the superb service, they all are incredible. I can't speak highly enough of these three gentlemen and the service they provided.

It was my first time here, at the recommendation of my date. We had the bruschetta board, bottle of wine ($20 for both on Monday's and Tuesday's after 8pm) and we shared panini. It was spectacular. Never had bruschetta before, not sure what to expect but we have concluded that Postino's is going to be our Monday or Tuesday evening go-to each week.

I wish I could award these guys a 6th star, they really did a great job at ensuring we were happy.

Downtown Gilbert is so family friendly it can make the most diehard single guy gag. That is why it was surprising to see all the happy gilbert folks dishing out scottsdale prices for their bread covered in toppings. The food, while overpriced and smallish portions to share, is pretty decent and decent looking. I only managed to share a cheese board on the first half of an eventual failed two-tier date. The board had three cheeses of your choice and the hard cheddar was the best pick out of the brie and another one that looked like cottage cheese. The rest of the board had six small pieces of bread (half toasted, half not), a bunch of mixed nuts and good apriot jam and regular dried apricot. Not sure of the happy hour deals on food, but if you can get it half off the $15, it would be a deal.
   Basically, the place gets a good review because we were there between 11 and 5pm and all glasses of wine were five bucks. Now, that is a deal and a good way to make out with your date soon after.
Awesome selection of wine. Delicious bruchetta! I like the environment and it being settled in downtown Gilbert. Hit  or miss with  service hence the 4 stars.

First time here and it was excellent. They have gluten free bread so my girlfriend got to experience bruschetta for the first time in years!!!! Hour wait for inside seating but immediate seating outside and even though the temp was 108, the misting system kept it a cool 90 and i didn't even break a sweat. Service was also great, we will definitely be back.

I really enjoyed Postino in Gilbert. The food was amazing and the wine selection is fantastic. The menu is limited to appetizers, salads, and panini's. The quality of the food is amazing! These cheese and tomato dish is to die for! The wait times can be a little lengthy, however they do have cocktail and appetizer service on the patio while you wait. I will definitely be going back!

I had a great time! We ordered the cheese plate and it was amazing with huge chunks of cheese, the only thing I didn't like is we didn't have enough bread for all of the cheese! I should have asked but I also would expect the waiter to notice that we were out with lots of cheese left, and it's not cheese you can just eat with your  fingers. I love that there were fresh grapes on the platter and a bunch of munchies like almonds, dried cranberries and apricots. Water was always full too so that's a plus. My aunt and cousin ordered the sparkling sauvignon blanc (recommended by me because I thought it might be good) they seemed to enjoy it! 
The only reason I took away one star is because I didn't feel like the service was exceptional, he didn't spend a lot of time with our table and asked quickly if my aunt wanted another glass of wine and she said no so he quickly asked if we wanted the bill. I wish he had asked if we wanted dessert because I completely forgot that I wanted dessert!
I will be back for sure!

I'm a huge fan of this joint.  The wine and the food is really good.  I've recently become more adventurous with my food and this has really come in handy when trying their bruschetta.  I've tried almost all of them and they are all pretty good.  I haven't been for their awesome happy hour on Monday's and Tuesday's but it sounds amazing!

Wow! I never thought I would find a place like this the sleepy little town of Gilbert! Surprisingly they have enough options for someone who doesn't eat pork, beef or seafood to be stuffed when they leave. Their specialty is bruschetta - but not in the traditional sense (although they have one that is a traditional but is not spectacular). I had the white bean, the tomato jelly, the brie and fig and the traditional. I have to say the white bean and the tomato jelly were fantastic! Being a poultry-a-tarian and having no chicken options available, I had to go vegetarian and was limited to 5 options. One board is more than plenty to feed one person and 2 boards are sufficient for 3 people. The wine selection is pretty good as is the beer selection. They have some micro brews so you won't be stuck with a bud or miller lite! Each time I have been here I have had to wait, but it is so worth the wait. The children's' menu is standard, but they all come with a wacky little animal that will keep your little monster occupied for quite a while. Also, they have quirky little things that makes them stand out - for instance there is a bocce ball grassy area that you can sit by and play while you eat and there are these cute little yellowish orange cards in the sugar holder that are specifically for your gum (stop wasting the sugar people!). I hear that there is a special on Tuesday nights that gets you any bottle of wine and bruschetta for $20 - I also hear that the wait is ridiculous so I haven't ventured out there on a Tuesday night yet, but I am thinking that the savings may be worth the wait! All in all a great place to take a small party and enjoy in non traditional bruschettas with fantastic wine and beer!

OK, I like this place. I was pleasantly surprised on my first visit.

I was extremely happy with the happy hour beer specials, but not so impressed with the beer selection. I am a hop-head and I love a good, dank IPA. Their happy hour draft selection was Oskar Blues Pinner and Sierra Nevada Pale Ale: neither of these hit the mark.  I can accept the session ABV's, but it is IPA light in flavor. Despite my pickiness, at $5 for a personal pitcher (about 2.5 pints total) is a killer deal. My wife had $5 glasses of wine, a good value as well.

The half sandwich and salad I had were very good. I could eat the Sunshine Daydream salad all day long. It is the right combo of sweet and savory, crunchy and creamy. The 9 Iron sandwich was adequate, but it simply didn't deliver in flavor and my chicken breast was skimpy compared to the abundance of bread.

The atmosphere is pleasant for all. There was an interesting mix of bikers, hipsters, punks, and the conventional. I found a gaggle of Stepford Wives in the "play" area rather amusing as they were pairing up their 1-3 year old aryan children and telling them that this other pre-motorskilled child was their future life-partner. Ah, the breeding pool of the middle-class Caucasians. The "master plan" of world dominance is still alive and strong while being managed during happy hour wine festivities at the local spot. Is this common in the Phoenix area? I digress...

I can recommend this place for good food, excellent booze happy hour specials, and an interesting mix of people to watch. Check out this place and maybe you too can gander at the vapid locals plotting to take over the world via their offspring. It is amazing what a $5 glass of Pinot can do for the world's population.

Go for the salads. Good salads. You will not find another review in my Yelp profile that proclaims such things.

Great wines and location!! 

This place is awesome for a place to relax and have a nice time with family/friends. HUGE win selection and great appetizers.
Went on a recent date night for bruschetta board & bottle of wine... for 20 bucks.  I miss Mondays and Tuesdays so much.  Please find your way out to Santa Barbara, Postino.  I need you.

The wife likes her bread. She eats a A LOT of bread. Throw some pretty and colorful stuff on top and she goes crazy. This is a good distraction tactic!

$5 mimosas for her and $5 pitchers of beer for me. They also have a decent collection of wine. We always get a $14.75 bruschetta board and we split a salad. Postino's is pretty chill about splitting the salad for you. They also have soups, salads, panini, and dessert.

No matter which location you go to, the atmosphere is always perfect. Take your hunnie here if you want some honey in return. ;)

The service at first was slow we had 3 different servers, however, our 3rd and final server (sorry I forgot his name) was awesome, he was attentive and on top of our table made sure my niece was well taken care of which for me was amazing. I would go back if I could sit in his section again. This was my first visit to this location, food was inconsistent especially on the butchers board. The meat, cheese, olives & the nuts were about the only thing consistent with it. The bruschetta's 2 were good and the other 2 well we didn't even finish them. Like I said this was the 1st time I had something at any of the Postino's that was just ok.

Love this classy restaurant! It's a nice place to come with family, friends, and co workers! The patio setting is very relaxing especially with the live music they have playing one nights. The food is delicious and the wine selection is great! Would recommend to anyone!

I've been here twice now when visiting friends in the Phoenix area. The first time was for their Monday & Tuesday night bruschetta and wine deal, which is a great deal. I won't be in town for that deal this time so today we headed over for a late lunch. My husband, toddler, myself and one of my friends are all gluten free and being able to have their gluten free bruschetta is one of lives luxuries. The bread is crunchy but still chewy and tastes normal, not gluten free. All the bruschetta options are excellent and it's nice that you get 4 options for a board. The service is exceptional and laid back but attentive. We've sat outside both times and unlike other restaurants where you loose service, this wasn't the case. The waiter gave us wine and food suggestions and offered other options if we didn't like what he suggested. He also came back to check up on us frequently but not too much it bugged us. This is one of those places I look forward to visiting and will return on every trip to the area.

YummO!  Went for brunch today with the husband.  Nice change of pace for us. The staff was very helpful and friendly.  They asked if this was our first visit, and since it was we were given the scoop on the menu. So the menu is small but what is there is done well. I had the french toast which was amazing, light fluffy and tasty. My husband ordered the farm scramble and he loved it! Eggs & salad? I wouldn't have guessed that this would make him happy but it did. Overall we are super happy with this place and we will be back!

I'm a big fan! Postino's has the market on Bruschetta... it is scrumptiously delicious! I have tried their salads, sandwiches, desserts and all were excellent. And the Butcher Block was amazing! They also have the market on the best pitcher price for great beer, not just domestics, crafts as well for only $5 until 5pm... what a steal! Also on Monday & Tuesday nights they have a House bottle of vino & an order of Bruschetta for only $20, another great deal. Atmosphere is nice, relaxed and fun. Service has been good, very friendly & knowledgable. It can get very busy and have a long wait but if you plan ahead, you will be eating and drinking in no time at all... Totally worth it!
Bruschetta is fabulous. The apple and brie was my favorite. I chose the pick two option for the meal. The side salad and half panini was plenty of food and had great flavor.  Service was great!

Good food and atmosphere. This location is packed regularly and it can become a bit loud and the wait is long which is why I did not rate it higher. Food is quality and the product is consistent. Great wine selection and the cheese plate is top notch.

My boyfriend tells me we are going to Arizona to visit his friends. I do some Yelping and respond with...if you take me to this wine bar (and a fried chicken place) I found, I will be a happy camper on this trip. He agreed. 

He kept up his end of the bargain, we went to both places I wanted to go. I tried to be good, but i'm not perfect. Postino East, however, is.

We got there around 5:30 and there was no wait. When we left the line was out the door. This place is super cute, and huge! There is a bar, a large dining room, a large outdoor patio, and a large yard with little tables to sit at. Service was perfect the entire time. Food was served very fast. The portions are huge and the prices are very good.

Not knowing how large all the portions were, we ordered three things. Two would have been fine, but we ended up being able to take a good amount of food back to his friend's house for them to eat.

Wine and beer selection were good. You can get a freshly made mimosa or bellini for only $5. All wine is $5 a glass before 5:00 PM, after that none of the wine is more than $12, most of the wine was $9 - $10 a glass. I had one bellini, delicious. I also had a glass of Pinot Grigio from Italy that I enjoyed a lot. BF had a beer of some sort that he liked, so he ordered a second one.

Pub Board - This amazing wooden board is covered in yummy soft, salty pretzels, a spicy mustard, chorizo, an assortment of pickles, aged cheddar, and the best corn nuts I have ever had. Everything was perfect.

Bruschetta - For $14 you can choose four different kinds of bruschetta from a list of twelve. We went with Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, Smoked Salmon with Pesto, Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato, and Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese. The portion is MASSIVE! We ended up taking half of this back to our friends. I did like that each piece of bread is sliced into four small pieces so it is easy to eat and easy to share. All of the selections we made were wonderful, with my favorite being the Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese. The pesto on the salmon bruschetta was amazing. No complaints about any of our choices. 

Nine Iron Panini - The Pub Board and Bruschetta were brought out before the panini, and once we saw how much food we were dealing with, we asked if the panini could be cancelled, but they had already made it. Luckily, they served it on two plates so we could share, so we ended up just sharing one half and taking the other one to our friends. This panini had chicken, bacon, mozzarella, lettuce, tomato and a dijonnaise. We were given a choice of ciabatta or focaccia bread. We went with ciabatta and it was a bit too hard for our taste, focaccia would have been better. The dijionnaise was very strong and was the main thing I tasted in this panini. It was a good sandwich, but my least favorite of the three things we ordered. What I did love though, were the potato chips served on the side. They were huge, crispy, salty, tasted just like Lay's, but not at all greasy! The best chips, ever.

The bill for our four drinks and all the food was about $65. Great deal for how much we had. Postino needs to bring it's perfect little ass out to California. If not, I will happily agree to go visit his friends again...IF we get to eat here :)

Great food, wonderful service, always consistent.  I love their happy hour menu and the staff is always competent.  Aside from the hipster vibe that has swept this particular, once little, farming town, I like this place a lot.
Best bruschetta boards, great wine selection and yummy olives! This place holds a special place in my heart!

I absolutely love Postino - probably more than I should, definitely more than my hips should. My fiance and I went out to celebrate work promotions and my request was simple, bruschetta and wine from Postino, please. We loved the outdoor atmosphere, the fact that for once there was no wait (WHAT?) I know, on Tuesday at 6PM there was no wait. Our server was kind and knowledgeable.

We devoured our bruschetta and I had a nice glass of cab. We tried it with some balsamic, which we haven't done in the past and that was also great. The thing about Postino is that they keep so consistent with good food and drink. They have a great product and they don't let it slip. 

The experience was great and we would love to stop in again (pending no 2-hour wait) to try more of what they have to offer and relax on the patio.

To start off, I'd like to say that we thoroughly loved our busboy, Sean, who was first day out of the kitchen. He was a sweetie. 
We had a 30 minute wait, which was alright, but seating on the 'lawn' was not very good for a group of 5 trying to converse. 
The menu isn't very big, offering few choices. I did, however, like the bruschetta with a gluten free option. 
My opinion is that it is overpriced for the quantity and quality of food and beverages. The bottle of wine we shared was definitely overpriced. 
I will say that the server and busboy were very attentive. I did like the atmosphere as well, although the music could've been turned down, especially if seated inside. 
Would I come back here? Perhaps, especially since the weather is getting really nice, and I like a good patio which they offer here.

WE LOVE THIS PLACE! I went to the original in Phoenix a few years ago and was ecstatic when they brought one to Gilbert. My go-to is the bruschetta, but I also love their mixed greens salad!

My only complaint is that it is extremely loud and therefore I no longer go unless it is early in the day and during the week.

I've been here five times now and I have to say, I was a little reluctant to come here initially but now I'm hooked.  I love the food.  The bruschetta is amazing!  I've been here during the lunch and dinner hours and it's always crowded, but then again it's Gilbert and not much else here.  The only drawback to this place is the crowd and always a wait and it can be loud.  I'm not a wine drinker so I don't know about their wine selection but their beer selection is ok.  They have a few craft beers and the regular domestic garbage like Bud light.

This place is great for all size groups. Cute outdoor space and great location along Gilbert road. Wish the bathroom had a changing table, otherwise you can make do with the dresser they have in the bathroom. I love their bruschetta boards and you can't go wrong with $5 mimosas, or pitcher special before 5pm. Go on Mon/Tue to take advantage of their wine and bruschetta special.
This is my favorite spot on Monday and Tuesdays! The staff is great (especially Austin) and he's also easy on the eyes .  I definitely recommend this place to anybody and everybody!

We are currently sitting here at the bar at Postino's East.  I was on the fence about what to order for breakfast and Jax ordered us up one of the new menu items, Crepes with a Carmel, banana, topping. They aren't super sweet if that's what your worried about.  If your unsure order them I swear you'll love them.
Nice place. Food is good. Lively, a little loud if you are wanting to talk. I liked the raspberry chicken salad and we had a bruschetta platter.

Here it is. Tonight was perfect. The atmosphere. The lighting. The ambiance. And the food was amazing. McKenna was our waitress and made the night better. She wasn't a bother. Was fun.  And there when we needed her. 

Thank you!! We will be back. Ps ask her about the zebra.

One of my most favorite places to go Sunday afternoons. We loved going here because of the live music on Sundays. AJ Odneal is an awesome singer/song writer. She plays a few different instruments and is very talented. The food and drinks are also pretty good. Great for groups. I love this place during AZ spring & winter. They have heat lamps and outdoor seating. You can also take your dog as long as its in the grassy patio area.

We headed out to Postino on Thursday night for one of our girls happy hours. We enjoy trying new places and are always looking for a fun, comfy place with good food and drinks. We loved the design of the place and the garage doors were a great look and in cooler weather I am sure makes for a much nicer experience. We got there a little after 5pm and found all the tables were full. We were expecting a bit bigger place but it was really hot out and no one was sitting on the patio so really wasn't their fault. Although once they turned the misters on people started to sit outside.
