The guy who greeted us at the door was very friendly and said it would be a bit but if we wanted to we could check out the drink menu and order something while we waited. They offered us half a couch and we chose to try that instead of standing. It was an ok place but not really that comfortable for more than two people and made conversation a bit difficult. We told them we still wanted a table and they were great about it. They got us one in about 15 minutes and helped us bring our drinks over. The drink menu was a bit short and the after happy hour prices were a bit high. Two of us ordered wine ($9 and $10 a glass each) and our other friend ordered a beer (much better price) The wine was fine but nothing spectacular. They had a good selection of appetizer and happy hour type foods. We chose the bruschetta. The smoked salmon with pesto was my favorite, i could have eaten a lot more of that. We also got the Bella Postino, artichoke dip and white bean hummus with a variety of breads. The artichoke dip was great but the hummus was very bland. We had a couple different servers and it seemed like every server in the place stopped by our table at one point or another. They were maybe a bit too attentive. Three people asked if we needed another drink within 10 seconds of each other. One server was very concerned that every item we finished with was removed immediately. While I appreciate fast service this was a bit ridiculous. They had a small offering of desserts and one had chocolate covered corn nuts in it. We were intrigued and ordered that one. It was their Salted Caramel Sundae which consists of Vanilla bean ice cream with chocolate covered corn nuts, a pretzel stick and salted caramel. It was AWESOME! and the corn nuts were so tasty. who knew! Overall the prices were a bit high. The atmosphere was cool, the food good, the wine ok and the dessert wonderful. We had a pleasant time but it probably won't make the short list for future outings.

Best beer happy hour around and still a huge fan of their bruschetta and the nine iron sandwich. Wines are also great at $5/glass and there's actually a selection instead of just house red or white. Come on a weekday before 5 to avoid the crowd. Our waitress offered to split the check but messed it up afterward. My order of preference amongst the Postino's is Arcadia, East, then Central.
Great food! Excellent service.  My friends and I get together here at least once a month. You can customize your bruschetta board so everyone can share a board and still get exactly what you want.

Always a good time! Bruschetta is amazing here and always plenty of wine options. Love the little romantic patio, has little twinkly lights hung and heaters when needed. I have had some fantastic servers here, as well as some very unfriendly ones, seems inconsistent with staffing.

I absolutely adore Postinos. I make it a point to stop by each time I'm in town. 

I'm posting today because about a month or so ago, I was having brunch with about 7 or 8 of my girlfriends.  I'm always so impressed with how smoothly everything operates. Seriously, this place is a well oiled machine.Anyway, our servers were so diligent with us and so lovely.  What really made us happy though, is that apparently it took our food a little bit longer to hit our table, so to make up for it the Manager came to our table to apologize and gave us a bunch of coupons. We were so shocked because we didn't even notice lol. Great great service. 

See you soon Postinos

I have visited Postino East twice now and both were very good experiences and consistency.  The atmosphere is great. It can be very noisy on a weekend evening with long waits,  but it's worth the wait. The inside & outside space is great. 

I cannot go here without ordering the bruschetta. I've tried 7 different kinds so far and they're all very delicious. The roasted bell pepper with goat cheese,  the apple & brie and the smoked salmon are wonderful. I am a big fan of charcuterie so the butchers block and the cheese block are the way to go. You won't be disappointed I promise. 

Give it a try. Your tummy will thank you

This is my new favorite restaurant - you can't beat the $5 glasses of wine, and the Bruschetta is so incredible.  My favorites are:  Ricotta with Dates & Pistachios; Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese; and Brie & Apples with Fig Spread.  I have seen reviews commenting on slow/poor service, but I have never experienced it.  My servers have always been quick, accomodating and friendly.  I will make this a regular haunt, well worth the drive from Mesa to Gilbert.
Postino's never disappoints me. Good appetizers, sandwiches, love the varieties bruschetta , and yummy dessert too! Love to go for a girls night out!

My husband and I visited Postino East for the first time last night and we were happily impressed by our experience. Our server was really friendly and upon learning we were first-time visitors, he came back with a couple of samples of soup (both were really good). He also advised us against ordering a bunch of dishes and recommended that we order course by course if we were still hungry after our first selection. We decided to split the bruschetta board (choose 4 types) and it was more than enough for the 2 of us. My Bellini was refreshing, husband's beer was good, and the bruschetta (bruschetti?) were tasty and chock-full of fresh ingredients. For his final tip, our server told us that Monday and Tuesday nights featured a wine and bruschetta special: enjoy 1 bottle of wine and the bruschetta board for $20. We will definitely be back!

Everything about the experience was great (except the wait time, but it was worth it). Every member of the staff was extremely attentive, even while we were still waiting for our table. Everything we tried was amazing. My favorites: prosciutto, fig, and cheese  bruschetta and the creme br√ªl√©e, though I'm sure everything else is great as well. Wish I would have come here sooner!

It is a little pricey, especially if you're going to get drinks, but it's great if you're wanting a special night out or wanting to splurge. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

If I had reviewed Postino's East when they first opened, they would have gotten five stars. Service is slower, music is louder now. I went at 4pm on a stormy Thursday so it was a better-than-expected experience. When I've gone later in the evening, I've experienced a lack of service (like no one filling water, asking if we want more wine or food). More than once I've complained. They give a coupon for a free appetizer; I'd rather have the app I ordered (twice) comped immediately. It's go-to for location only. Glad to see more choices available in the area.
Love the staff, atmosphere, food, wine ALL OF IT!! They have an amazing selection of wine and bruschetta! Will always recommend this place.

Postino East was a ray of sunshine amongst some recent and thoroughly mediocre food adventures.  We started with "The Bounty" as an appetizer, and let me tell you if we had ordered two then we just would have eaten twice as much of it. Fantastic.  We then had two orders of the bruschetta (so 8 types total), which was a great amount for the four of us on a double date.  The food was gourmet, the atmosphere warm and inviting.  This was one of the best dining experiences we'd had in a long while and a great date to boot.  Five stars!!

I had a negative review before but was given an chance to go back and experience Postino's again and I want to say it was a 100% better experience for me. Since that visit too, I went back several times and have been very happy with the service and food and of course the wine. The bartender even was able to give me recommendations on one of the wines and I was very pleased. I will have to go back during a happy hour so it doesn't do as much damage to my bank account because I could drink about 10 glasses of their Moscato and be unfazed!

Great spot for day drinking! 
This is my husband and I's favorite heritage district restaurant. We normally go for lunch. Until 5, wine and pitchers of beer are $5. They are very friendly. And the food is pretty good. My husband and I normally share a butchers block. Other times, he gets the nine iron and I get bruschetta. Even though it is a wine bar, it is still kid friendly. We bring our children and they easily are happy with their meal. This is not a fast paced setting.

Excellent date night spot and as of this writing you can't beat the Monday night 20$ bottle of wine and 4 brochettes of your choosing. Amazing ambiance at night and the location is in the middle of downtown Gilbert should you feel like walking over to the theaters and what not.
We celebrated our friends birthday and they were awesome.  Adam was an awesome server.

Love this place. My family and I come here when ever we can. My two boys just love the butchers block, and the cheese plank. Their happy hour deal is awesome too $5 pitchers. The outside patio is also fun to hang out and relax.
Great place for lunch or Happy Hour, although a bit pricey. Bruschettas are good & love their salads.  But the best is the salted caramel sundae! Yum!
Postino has great atmosphere and the servers are attentive. I tried the salad here and everything was fresh! I really enjoyed their portion and the dressing.

Excellent bruschetta, with many options , including gluten free, depending on preference. In order to construction a platter you choose of a list of options. I ordered and loved 1) Brie, Granny Smith apples, and fig jam 2) kippered salmon, capers, onions, cream cheese 3) caprese 4)pepper jam and goat cheese. I was seated en plein air. My lack of a Star specifically addresses the fact I was literally seated between cushions which was awkward and uncomfortable. I mean I caught the eye of the hostess who sat me there and the waiter noticed as well because I looked contorted...seems like a glaring thing to overlook when you place a table adjacent to a good half foot split of cushion. I can't be the first, there's definitely others with the same harrowing tale to tell. There are probably literally dozens of us.

This place is so cute and they have amazing food! Get the bruschetta it's delicious and you can't go wrong. The cucumber lemonade is also very tasty and refreshing on a hot day. Service is great, they really go above and beyond to make you feel at home- thanks Jenny! :)

I don't have much new to say, because others have done such a good job describing and taking pictures of the beautiful food and beverage, except this is my new favorite place to day drink.  $5 glasses of wine 11-5?  An interesting and varied wine selection?  I'm there.  

Mr. M and I visited last Monday and the weather was beautiful and perfect for enjoying the open air atmosphere at Postino East.  We were taken care of by two friendly servers who I could see helped each other out all over the restaurant.  

We shared some bruschetta, a sandwich, and a bottle of riesling.  It could not have been a more perfect visit.  The only thing of note is that just south of this block, Gilbert Road is torn up and blocked off and really annoying.  I hope they are doing something good with that mess.  You have to come at Postino from the north (Guadalupe/Gilbert intersection).  I tried to weave around thru residential areas and that doesn't work.  

I can't wait to go back and this will definitely be a place we'll take out of town guests.  Thank you thank you thank you.

*We drove by on 2/11/13 and the construction was cleared out!

I finally was able to try Postino's last night and I was happy with my experience. We had to wait 45 minutes, but they were very attentive in bringing us drinks as we sat outside. My friend and I ordered a bruschetta board each and shared. I especially loved the prosciutto and fig, warm artichoke, ricotta with pistachios, brie and apple, and the tomato jam with goat cheese. While they were all flavorful and delicious, I was disappointed that some of the bread wasn't toasted enough, so they ended up being soggy instead of crisp. But, overall I enjoyed my food and will be back!

If you want a nice friendly place to have a meal and of course a cocktail.....this is the one.
Warm and friendly makes you want to go back too.  The food is awesome

Girlfriends & I shared a bruschetta appetizer. AMAZING!! Food and service were both most excellent.   our server helped us choose a bottle of wine and was very helpful with every decision we needed to make. 
Can't wait to return.
We made a reservation for a large group one week in advance. Two days before they called and said they were "overbooked" and could not seat our party. Disappointing.

Wonderful atmosphere! Great service! Awesome food! Friendly guests! Beautiful day!  What more can you ask for!!!  We had the bruschetta board and the chicken salad and tuna panini. Everything was wonderful we will definitely be back!
Love, Love, Love Postinos! My husband and I go here a lot just to relax with good food and wine. The atmosphere is fun and exciting as well. A must go!
Great food and great atmosphere. One of the more relaxing places to grab a drink in downtown Gilbert.

Always the Pinot Noir, Always the 9 Iron Sandwich.  However, I only go when the wine is $5 per glass, because I am such a value person.  

Unless it is Monday or Tuesday, then I go with the $20 bottle and Bruscetta board.  Another exceptional value.
Great place really Loke you can you use no wait app. Also dog friendly  are is a plus
We went to Postinos and had the best food. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.
Nice place... menu limited but what we had was yummy..Great service.. Great area..clean great tea

Loooooooooooooooooooooooooooove Postino. I'm sure all East Valley peeps cheered with joy just like I did when I realized I wouldn't have to drive all the way to Arcadia or the downtown locations anymore! This Gilbert location has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating but my favorite spot to hang out in the restaurant is the couch. My friends and I will come here during our lunch break and have a lovely time here. Check out how many people that couch can hold:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wZukjLaf1V2dLRQap_Zriw?select=gimSJe3YmkuGiAAig6VTNQ#w2hgu8IC0jvkAuGM9JdCrQ


Service is awesome, I even saw my dog trainer Jess servin' it up so I know they have a good crew there. 
Food is AMAZING-if you're into salads at all you HAVE to try the
----------------------------Raspberry Chicken 9.75------------------------------------
Organic chicken salad with pecans, apples, gorgonzola and mayo with raspberry vinaigrette over a bed of fresh greens

 -it's irresistible, just like the location. ;)

First off, I have always enjoyed Postino, and have experienced nothing but great service at both locations I have frequented until now. 

My fiancee and I enjoy Postino's so much we wanted to host our rehearsal dinner there, so we could introduce friends, and family from out of the state, to the establishment we enjoyed so much. 

This is where the problem began - 

My Fiancee has been in to the location and has requested information on doing this - She has never been contacted back

I have been to the location requesting information on doing this and hoping to set it up by booking it in advance to make sure there is not a hiccup - No response

I have called and left multiple messages - I have never been called back 

We have both emailed through the website - No Response

We figured that trying to get this arranged four months before the date we needed would be enough, as to avoid any issues, but of course the establishment would have to:

A. Have a staff that is capable of responding to a simple request for information

&

B. Have a staff that cared about those who frequent their establishment enough to respond in any way with some sort of answer, even if it was a simple "we don't give a SH!T enough to bother with this" and have a great day. 

Losing our business won't mean much in the scheme of things, but perhaps this review, and the word of mouth may present enough of a catalyst to at the very least respond to request, whether they are in person, writing, or by phone.

Make it a great day
The food is great, the wine choice is very good and I love the special that they have on Tuesday night.  Wonderful!  I'll go back again and again and take all my family and friends!

Great, great, great. Fabulous location [in my work 'hood], wonderful building, capable and friendly staff and the usual ahmazing food. 

Was so glad to know that this very fine sibling is close to work and just as good as the Arcadia location. I went for lunch and was not disappointed. A wait for tables but we saddled up to the bar and were served there. A busy hum to the place but service was tight and the bar tender attentive. For the record, I had the Mozzarella Chicken on ciabatta. Delish. More bread than I usually eat but totally worth the carbs. 

I could continue the rant but like so many others, I was blown away in the best possible way. And will return.

My husband and I thought we would try something new for our 40th anniversary breakfast (brunch). As long as the restaurant has something close to a traditional breakfast I can get him to try new restaurants. We frequent the Hale theater but always eat at Liberty Market so today we ventured across the street to Postinos. He had the ciabatta French toast and I had the Morning Staple (eggs, bacon, walnut toast and roasted potatoes). The French toast was excellent but the Morning Staple could have used more than 3 small cubed potatoes. Not that I wanted to eat a lot of carbs this morning, but really,  if you're going to list roasted potatoes as part of the meal, at least put a 1/2 cup worth. It seemed the presentation was more important. I should have taken a picture of my plate. I found the 3 cubes under my bacon. I will say the walnut toast was very good as well as their fresh berry jelly. 
Our next adventure here is to try the bruschetta. We saw several plates go by and it looked absolutely delicious. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is great. We will be back but not for breakfast.

Really liked this place a lot! Now that my wife and I have a dog, we've been in search of dog-friendly patios. This location has a great outdoor area for dogs. Dining guests also hang out there and it's so wide open, you don't feel on top of each other. Wife and I ordered some white wine, a variety of bruschetta and split a raspberry chicken salad. All of it was excellent. The bruschettas were all very inventive - I think our favorite was the one with pistachios and dates. Who knew?! The salad had a perfect combo of palate goodness. It came to an acidic high note with the vinaigrette but the raspberry dressing on the side was both sweet and savory to offset that. Our dog loved the people watching, the interaction with little kids throwing the bocce balls for him, and the freedom to roam around. We'll definitely be back!

This location was a little bit hard for me to find, as I didn't have the GPS on at the time. I was so glad that I could finally find the place. There was long wait line, but the hosts were attentive enough to come by and check every 5mins with drink offers. During the wait time, I tried a glass of Bianca Vigna, and I surely couldn't get enough of it. 

We ordered Mozzarella and Tomatoes to start with, following by the Bruschetta. There were a lot of options in the menu, but we chose: 

1. Brie & Apples with Fig Spread
2. Ricotta with Dates & Pistachios
3. Smoked Salmon with Pesto
4. Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato

I would say the Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato was my favorite of all 4. I have never tried Postino on the West side, but so far I have had such a good experience dining here. 

Decoration is pretty nice, and there were only 2 co-ed bathrooms. Parking may be hard to find sometimes, but it doesn't stop me from coming back another time.

I was introduced to this place by some new friends. As a newbie I went with the bruschetta boards with gluten free bread and they were really good. My favorite was the salmon with pesto. The waitstaff was attentive and I enjoyed the kind of elegant hipster vibe. When my friends come to visit we'll make a point to have dinner there.

Gilbert, if you like a wine list of literally ten wines, a menu consisting of bread and bread byproducts, 40 year old Gilbert moms trying to look cool, and whiffing the smell of a far greater restaurant next door i.e. Liberty Market or Joe's, then Postino East is the way to go.

I heard of Postino while reading another great issue of Phoenix Magazine while getting my hair trimmed at Great Clips. Hmm I said. This restaurant sounds intriguing.

Making my way to the Gotham City of the desert, Gilbert, i maneuvered my Mini Cooper through the thriving metropolis, and parked in one of Postino's well graveled parking spots.

It was then I entered Gilbert's version of a wine cafe. When I drink wine at a wine bar I expect it to taste like the nectar of the gods, unfortunately at Postino's this isn't the case. Their wine list is less insignificant then Tim Meadows's career. With so little to choose from I ended up ordering a wine I've never tasted before; a risky proposition to be sure. My wine ended up tasting like the liquid equivalent of Journey without Steve Perry.

After emptying the reminder of my wine in one of Postino's urinals, I decided to eat some food. I ordered the bruschetta sampler in which i get to pick out four different kinds of flour based goodness. The pesto salami was definitely my favorite; sort of like Michael Winslow being my favorite in the Police Academy films.

The atmosphere is interesting the say the least; if you enjoy looking at women with sun spots and 8 year old twins and the creepy men checking them out from across the room then this is your spot.

I'll pass and stick with Joe's across the street.

I'm in L-O-V-E with this place...no joke, such a great spot to spend the evening. Great staff, beautiful decor, excellent food and adult Jenga. What more can a person ask for, when wanting to spend a fun evening out with friends. Will definitely be back.

We went here on a Wednesday afternoon for a quick lunch and glass of wine and were very happy with the experience. 

We shared a bruschetta board which was very good. I was a big fan of the bread as I miss our bakeries back east. The wine selection is good enough without being overwhelming. The selections aren't the every day generic choices you get in a lot of places also. 

Only downside is we sat outside in the sun and it was a bit warmer than we anticipated, but this was our own fault. The hostess asked if we wanted another seat as it might be a bit sunny. 

I can see how if this were a Friday night how the place could be overwhelmingly crowded and noisy as others have pointed out. So I would shy away from hitting the place up at peak times. It was fairly crowded for an early Wednesday afternoon.

So why 4 of 5? I will and want to go back, but can wait on it. I thought the menu was a bit limited, so not much else was screaming to me "Come back ASAP!". The appetizers I remember being on the pricey side as well.

Happy to say Postino Gilbert has the same quality of food as the Arcadia and Central locations. The HH deals are the same, the wines are the same and the bruschetta taste just as tasty over here too.  The benefit of Gilbert's location is their super large patio seating (which seems to get bigger and bigger every time) with the comfy chimney outside.

The only value-added comment I can contribute to such an extensively reviewed location, is my suggestion to always try the seasonal bruschettas. They are not on the menu nor are mentioned in any way (in written form), but they always have one and they are always part of HH or whatever deal the other bruschettas are currently on. The one I had most recently had pickled beats and arugula with lime juice- super refreshing and delicious. Good to know that at a place where everyone is so happy and comfortable with the things they rely on (Monday/Tuesday night deals, HH, and the taste of their static menu) that at least there is one tiny component that can surprise you. And what is life, really, without tiny little surprises?
Jason gave great wine recommendations while we sat at the bar! Very genuine and personable with great conversation. We will always come back to see Jason and his smiling face!

Without question, the best bruschetta, and the most creative bruschetta I have ever had. It's my new favorite dinner with a glass of red.  It should be called " Italian Sushi".  It's unbelievable. You have to try it!
I love this place! The food is always fabulous, 5 dollar pitchers and glasses of wine until 5, and the service is always great. Jason is my favorite server, but honestly the entire staff is stellar.
Great food even though a limited menu.  Be sure to try the red pepper soup.
Postino is my favorite restaurant in Arizona.  Their cucumber honey lemonade and bruschetta is incredible.  It's not the most inexpensive spot, but it's definitely worth it.

Every Monday night a few buddies and I go out for board and bottle, we have been doing this for a few months now, each time we have had a great time. There are multiple members of the staff, not only our server that night, that take the opportunity to ensure we are having a good time. The servers are sociable and our water glasses are always filled. The food is excellent. We have been doing this for many Mondays, and will continue to do so.

Good food....horrible service....worse management. I can't grasp the whole "we don't have servers assinged" bit. "We want everyone to feel welcomed so we have everyone waiting on you" bs! That's the worst way to run a restaraunt. Every time I've been they've forgotten part of our order and/or just ignorred us. Id rather eat at Liberty Market across the street. I've spoken to managment about the bad service and all the gal has done is make excuses. That's not how you run a place. I believe in word of mouth...and the words out of my mouth to everyone I know is not to patron this location.

Great way to spend happy hour! Love doing the two for one deal.... Their soups if the moment changes daily and during the day as it runs out but all the ones I've had have been delightful! Great place to sit outside too! $5 pitcher or $5 wine from 11-5 awesome!!!

Good food and drinks as is normal for Postino. However, we consistently had to wait to place orders for new drinks when our glasses we're empty and we're not acknowledged when we wanted food. We were given our check without being asked if we wanted it, well before closing hours. Ultimately disappointed, especially knowing what they are capable of.

Postino never disappoints. I'm thrilled with their new downtown Gilbert location but more over their delicious bruschettas and excellent service. I went here for the opening party on St. Patrick's Day and had a fabulous time. The wine selection is, as always, superb.

Love Postinos. The only thing I diidnt like were the small size (very limited seating at peak hours) of the restaurant. Otherwise, the appetizers are excellent, the wine is probably good (I don't drink wine) and the beer is cold and tasty with a good selection.

The seating is very casual and they also have outside seating. the bar is much too small honestly and they would be wise to expand the bar seating area and size because there are many of us who want a place to sit down that are not with our significant other or are single.

~Stew Keene, Local Area Realtor

Here's the thing you need to know - if you come for sandwiches and salad, they're good and you'll enjoy them but this is not what you come to Postiono's for. 

You come here for amazing bruschetta platters, awesome wine and mimosas for $5 (or a pitcher of beer but I'm not a beer girl) before 5pm during the week. You come for cheese boards and butcher blocks. You come with a friend and enjoy great service outside in the sun. It's not a meal, but a place to gather with your friends and enjoy an afternoon together. This. This is why we love Postino's

His retail space has been the location for several eating establishments. Postino's  has made a success of this corner in downtown Gilbert. The restaurant is open and airy, with both indoor and outdoor seating. The main attraction is the wine selection.  The food is somewhat upscale but not classy. The panini sandwiches are great and they have a wide selection of appetizers to go with the wine selections. This is a great place to just sit and unwind and meet friends. The prices are not overly expensive, but, are more than you would expect in a typical bar. If you go, the outside area near the Main Street can get loud with the local traffic. Sitting in the inside or on the side street location may be a little quieter.  Check the menu before you go.

Nice chill but upscale atmosphere to drink a glass (or bottle) of wine. Love the outdoor seating! The bruschetta is amazing (every single kind I've tried I've absolutely loved) More often than not the servers are accommodating & educated with wine pairings (a couple of times I've felt rushed -when they weren't busy- & the server didn't know or maybe just didn't care to impart their knowledge about the wine I was inquiring about) Still a great place!

Omg! I have literally been in here 3 days in a row now. Not only is the bruschetta and daily soup fricken super amazing but if you ever get JASON as a bartender just know you're in great hands. I'm honestly starting to think I come in for him! Great vibes from the General manager JEFF as well! Thanks again so much you guys seriously made me a forever Postinos East regular!!

Awesome bruschetta. It's a meal unless you choose to split it with a few table. Very good salads. Very good wine selection. I did the half and half: half sandwich and small salad. I highly recommend it for a nice get together with friends, family, or date night.
Great ambiance!   I highly recommend the bruschetta and Nebbiolo!

We went to this place without checking if they have gluten free selection and to our surprise, they had amazing bruschettas! For someone who has gluten allergy, this was absolute heaven! This place offers cozy atmosphere with great fireplace outside. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and understanding.
Super yummy place!!! The bruschetta is amazing, as well as the butcher board! Great wine selection, laid back but classy atmosphere!

My husband and I were visiting the area with some friends and we came to Postino's for the Tuesday night special. The atmosphere, bruchetta and wine was great! The apple and fig bruchetta was our favorite. We will definitely go back next time we are in the area.

I decided to check out this place with my wife. As we all know Gilbert is more of a quite place but this place got it all. I ordered Tomato Mozzarella as an app, and Mozzarella Chicken sandwich on Focaccia bread. Impressive presentation with balanced flavors and fresh ingredients. The servers all worked together to insure outstanding service. 
Well done Guys this is a 4G restaurant and way ahead of the game.Hands down, well done place.

Postino's, my family used to come in at least once a week, but now, we will never return to this location that is only miles from our home. Our food is consistently cold, the service is laughable and it really makes me wonder what in the world the management is doing. Today was the last straw, after waiting an hour for cold food, not getting all of the kid's food so he could even eat, we left hungry and vowing not to return. As we watched other angry patrons leave before being served too. Maybe you got too comfortable being among the first restaurants to make downtown Gilbert, I'm not sure, but I think the owners really need to rethink their staffing plan since there are now an abundance of options downtown. So disappointed!!!

This place is great. it's busy, but the atmosphere, while more modern, has a similar feel to the Arcadia location. Tonight we had quite slow service to start and the apologetic server comped our first round of drinks even though we weren't angry about it. I really appreciate that level of customer  service...it's a lost art. the food was wonderful and the beer prices were extremely reasonable.

I loved it here! My brother took my fiance and I here while we were in town for a visit. We had a short wait for a table, but it was during prime happy hour/after work time. We were seated outside and while we walked through the restaurant I couldn't help but admire how cozy it all is. 

We ordered a bottle of wine and two orders of bruschetta. Our server was super helpful with choosing a wine, and all night I felt like she was very attentive! The bruschetta boards were out of control good. Since we tried eight different bruschettas, it's hard to pick a favorite as they were all delicious! Ones that stood out to our group were the smoked salmon with pesto, brie and apples with fig, the BLT (bacon, arugula, tomato with burrata), and the ricotta with dates and pistachios. But honestly, you can't go wrong with anything! We had other plans for the night so we didn't get to stick around for too long, but next time we're in town I definitely want to go back!
This is one of our new favorite places. Awesome happy hour and the best bartenders "Suzy " that we've ever had.

Usually we have a really good experience here but this time was awful. It took over an hour and a half to receive our food and we noticed that multiple people who had come in after us were getting theres before us. My boyfriend had to leave before the food even came because he was gonna be late to work even though we got there more that two hours before his shift. It was also not as busy as it could have been. I don't suggest coming here for brunch.

Great food, we had the bottle and bruschetta $20 deal. The Olives appetizer was good. Sandwiches were good. Our service was terrible. Our waiter was inattentive, scatterbrained, and impatient. It literally took 3 people and 53 minutes to figure out how to split a $125 check 5 ways. We had to explain 3 times with letters and a corresponding key for each credit card.

Two thumbs way up for everything Postinos has to offer. This is a great place to go for a relaxing evening. Lovely ambiance, great food, and amazing service. Everyone is willing to help your table with whatever you need. The food is fresh and light. If you are a fan of bruschetta then you will really enjoy the selection here.
Best food and wine around! Perfect place for a chill girls night or happy hour!  Love the wine selection. Plan to come back and try more stuff on the menu...haven't had anything bad!!!

Love their bruschetta platters! We've tried brie/apples w/fig, warm artichoke, burrata/bacon/arugala/tomato, and smoked salmon w/pesto, all excellent. I'd recommend getting the panninis for the most bang for your buck, but everything is well made and delicious! THey're always very busy though, so be prepared for a wait.

For brunch, I'd get the Postino Mimosa over the White Peach Bellini because it's stronger, but both are tasty. The smoked salmon is quite good, but all of the brunch items are very small servings, so not the best deal unfortunately.

They have some fun outdoor activities while you wait (for a while) which is nice like bocci ball, giant jenga, it's a different experience with well made food, long waits, and smaller portions.
I've been wanting to try this place.  Had a party of six - gave them my number - they sAid they would text me and it would be about 35 minutes. NEVER texted me.

Love the food here.  The bruschetta boards are amazing (try the apple and brie!) as are the butcher boards.  I am also a big fan of the sandwich and salad combinations you can get.  Happy Hour is 11-5 every day.  We have also had weekend brunch there and it was quite good.  The soups are innovative and always good.  Service is always great. Staff knows the menu and after a few visits, make a point of saying hello to us when we walk in.  It is dog friendly so you can bring your dog in the back area where they have a great sitting area.  Love that.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the music.  Sometimes it is so loud (and sometimes a little wild) it is difficult to hold a conversation. One time we were in there and asked if they could turn down the music a little.  The answer I got was that the management was really opposed to turning down the music as "they try to set a certain mood with the music" but she did offer to go talk to to someone.  The music did not get turned down.  The lady next to me leaned over said she agreed about the music. It obviously doesn't bother me enough to stay away.  Highly recommend this place.

Wow! Came here on a Sunday for lunch. It was busy but not packed, which was nice. The wait staff was awesome. Friendly and attentive. We ordered the cheese platter and split a panini. It was pretty big! The cheese platter was wonderful - but I love cheese - and the nuts and dried fruit complimented it perfectly. We didn't order any wine, a mistake that, I'm sure, will be remedied on the next visit.

This place is my husband and I's very favorite place. Great atmosphere,food, and wine. Was pretty sad they took away the Red Pepper Gouda soup they had everyday. Please bring it back!!  Our waiter Scott made up for it with his sparkling personality!

I went only once with a friends for a birthday dinner. It was good, but nothing exceptional. The server was great. 

The atmosphere was a bit loud, but it was Friday, so I had no expectations of it being quiet. The seating was a bit tight in the dining room and this made it difficult for the servers to freely move. Considering the beautiful weather in our valley this time of year, it would probably be a nice place to go sit outside and enjoy a glass of wine and an appetizer.

I ordered the Tuna Nicoise and it was as expected.
This was a solid meh. It's not a place I would choose on purpose, but I would not say no if someone else wanted to go.

Great happy hour and bruschetta! 

Service is always good and I have never had to wait since I am wiling to sit at the bar or patio.

Service is always very good. Postino's is our family go to with out of town guests right from the airport. Charcuterie and cheese boards, Bruschetta, Faro Salad, good selection of beer and wine. Seasonal beers $5 a pitcher. Occasionally I find the music too loud but today how whose would you play Stones, Jimi H, Led Zepplin?
Always great food!  There Bruchetta is delicious and I love their raspberry chicken salad.  Can't go wrong here with anything on the menu.

I loved Postinos! 

My friend Lauren was here last night and dragged me here today. She was so giddy with excitement and kept chanting "Postino, Postino, Postino!" It was kinda annoying actually. I was kind of off put because of the limited menu so I just let her order for me. 

Just say yes to Bruscetta. We had all the Bruscetta options. Apples and brie, artichoke spread, pesto and salmon - each bite was better than the last. 
It's the kind of food that makes you wonder when you can have it again...and would it be weird to order another order of everything I just ate to go? But then again, I didn't want to seem like a fatty...So the problem was: do I want to be seen as a fatty or do I want to have amazing Bruscetta at home? The struggle was real. 

Last note:
I must advise whoever owns this place to PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE invest a bug zapper. The patio is beautiful, the food is beautiful, the experience is kinda off put when we have killer flies attacking us from all angles trying to suck our blood and eat our Bruscetta.

That's all. 

Postino postino postino!

Amazing is the only way to describe this place! Atmosphere is low key, trendy, & fun and their bruschetta is the best around. 

Go for happy hour, sit on the patio and enjoy a $5 glass or wine or pitcher of beer and a board of bruschetta. Or go on Monday & Tuesday after 8pm get a bottle of wine and a board of bruschetta for only $20. You won't be disappointed!

Great costumer service! Our waiter Derek was fantastic! The food was cooked amazing. I had one of the paninis and I was a bit scared the bread was going to be weird but got to my surprise it was the softest bread perfect for my sandwich.  The environment inside the place was smooth and the music was perfect for us to talk to each other without having to yelled one to another across tables. I really had a great time here tonight. Highly recommended.

I love bread and I love Wine and this place has both in spades. Even my meat and potatoes husband was happy. This place will make me gain a few inches around the waist and I'm going to enjoy every bruschetta filled bite of it.
Happenin place on a Friday night, so lots of people watching opps, plus awesome food and great wines!

It is too kid friendly!  I was cautious about going here for dinner, because it's a wine bar, and yelp says it's not good for kids in it's little details of the bar.  We're only here for a short time so I'm not ok with using a babysitter because we know nobody, so the kids had to come with on our "date night".  So we brought our 2 boys, armed with an iPhone and Nintendo DS and we said a little prayer that they wouldn't kick us out.  Anyways, the details need to be revised, it has a kids menu for Pete's sake, it was totally kid friendly.  And the kids meals for my little rugrats came with cute toys, little gumbie bendable alien toys and these weird little wax sticks so they could build wax creations at the table.  And there's a lawn with outdoor games, think I saw lawn bowling.  There were misters everywhere and plenty of outdoor seating, some couches, and fab 90's music that reminded me of being in college.  They didn't take reservations for small parties, but they took my number when we got there and sent me a text when the table was available, so I could wander around to the antique shop across the street during the wait.  Oh and the food and wine were great too.

We had a great time at Postino's. I'd never been to a wine bar before, but we'll definitely be coming back. Went on a Friday night with another couple and were seated in about 45 mins, which wasn't bad, considering how busy they were. We were able to socialize on the patio with drinks while waiting. Food was great and the service was quick.

$36 dollars later and I threw most of my to go order away. I used to love the food quality of Postino, but I would like to know how this constitutes as a NYC Grilled Cheese? I mean there's bread and butter, it's not grilled, and there's no cheese. what a waste of my money.
Love the service and food here!  Bruchetta is awesome.  Went here with old friends and they loved it as well..the patio has a great atmosphere.

Amazing food and service! A large party called to make a reservation so the manager asked if we wouldn't mind moving one table down which we had no problem doing and they gave us amazing creme br√ªl√©e on the house. The party never even showed up, which we felt bad about as they lost money and had given us dessert. Really appreciate the great service!!

I will say this is probably the best wine bar I've been to in the valley so far (although there's many more left to visit for me). Great service, great food, great atmosphere and a good bottle selection. Prices aren't outrageous as you may find in other wine bars. I've looked over their brunch menu but have not been able to visit during those ours yet. Seeing the brunch menu, I can't wait to try that too! 

Food: bruschetta was amazing. My favorite is the salmon. 

Wish I could remember more. Will update when I try more!

Gotta love Postinos, especially this location.  Nestled in the growing nightlife of downtown Gilbert, this place really gives people a relaxing place to enjoy especially when the weather is nice out.  Upscale, but not overly pricey.  

If you're a wino this place has a great selection of wines at a pretty reasonable price.  Their $20 bottle and bruschetta deal is killer.
I just came home from postino and had a bad case of diarrhea, not only did I find hair in my appetizer The Bounty, I had to come home and suffer.  I AM NEVER GOING TO EAT AT POSTINO again.
Good Happy Hour. Great place to celebrate or reunion with friends, the bruschetta is so good!

We came in for date night last Friday night and sat at the bar. We were greeted quickly by the bartender who was eager to tell us about their Sauv Blanc options by the bottle. He was knowledgeable and super friendly. 

We ordered a bottle and shared bruchetta. We both ordered the classic with tomatoes, mozzerella and basil. My date ordered one with salmon, i don't know what it was but he loved it and I ordered the warm artichoke. Mine was fantastic, it tasted better than I had expected from the description. 

The whole time we sat there our wine glass was never empty (until the bottle was gone), rather it was the bartender who waited on us or a passer by in the bar area, someone was always topping it off. 

We will defintely be back again...hopefully soon!

I love coming here. I feel like I'm some fancy rich person drinking wine and cheese, but if I feel like it I can still order a pitcher of beer.  For some reason all of the waiters are men with tattoos and hipster beards and haircuts.  The service is good, but our waiter seemed a bit pretentious. The food is delicious, but don't come here expecting to eat a steak or cheeseburger. The fair is lighter and more sophisticated, except they play Notorious B.I.G. in the background. On Monday and Tuesday nights you can get a bottle of wine and an order of bruschetta for $20, not a bad deal. It's a great place to come with your girlfriends or on a date, I really wouldn't bring the kids here.

I like their wine and food. That's why I give it 2 stars.  If you go there be prepared to wait for 1.5-2 hours on a weekend.  I went on a Tuesday night once and waited for an hour after they told me the wait would be about 35-45 minutes. Their website says they take reservations of 8 or more but when we called they said it had to be 10 or more and didn't seem to care what their website said. (This must have literally just changed because we were there with a group of 8 last week and had no problems getting a reservation)  I certainly don't mind waiting but with a large group I'd rather not.  I agree with another reviewer... They are getting the "we're so awesome we don't need customer service"  attitude and that has definitely turned this girl OFF!!!
Love the fact they do offer a glutton free options. Normally I get the prosciutto and Brie sandwich.

This is the beginning of our Sunday Funday bike rides. Great beer selection, great out door patio. i love the small pitchers of Four Peaks Hop Knot.......nothing like a cool beer buzz to get the Sunday started!!

I love Postino but service today was really bad. Waited about 25 mins to order a Bellini,  then another 30 mins to order food, they brought wrong order....at the end the comped the order. thank you!
Delicious food, amazing chocolate bouchon...and good music. Next time I will come for brunch.

I loved it here I loved the ambience of this place. They have a good selection of wine and beer options and they have delicious bruschetta that were fresh and appetizing! I recommend this place to anyone that like to drink wine.

Update: they went off the no wait app - that was a nice feature, given how long the waits can be. So now it's not only super loud, but also a long wait pretty much all the time.  I guess the noise is to drive out customers faster so they can rotate more?


Great wines, best bruschetta anywhere, and God prices.  Good service as well.  Minus 1.5 stars for being WAY too loud, especially for a wine place.

What an awesome place for great food and a fun atmosphere. 

We had a party of 16, took up the four couches up front, but the staff was great, very accommodating and prompt with food and drinks. 

Loved the music, as it felt like they were playing straight from my Pandora stations (Foo Fighters, The Black Keys, Cake, Beck). 

Had the nine iron panini and hefeweisen. Great deal on the mini pitchers. $7.5, which got you a little more than two beers. 

We went out of our way to go here and I would recommend anyone else to do the same!

Can't beat the board and bottle special on Monday & Tuesday nights. For $20 you get a board of their infamous bruschetta and a bottle of wine from an extensive list to choose from. I will occasionally meet up with my girlfriends every other month or so here to catch up on life. 

There are so many types of bruschetta toppings to choose from, but I always, always have to get at least one of the fig ones. I adore figs and they have two varieties of it at Postinos. My second favorite is the one with tomato jam. Yum! I am no wine expert but I do prefer white, sweet wines so I tend to steer towards moscato. Their house moscato is delicious and definitely one of my favorites!

We used to always have to wait every time we come here but on the last couple of occasions, there was no wait. I guess the "new hype" factor has died down a bit. But hey, I'm not complaining.

Be prepared to wait (more than an hour wait for us at 6pm on a Thursday night), but it was well worth it, especially since we got to order wine while we waited. Wine is great, food is great, and service is great...not to mention, it's a mile away from my house. I'm in love! :D
the brunch is wonderful, the bellini's are a treat and the atmosphere is so fun. love coming to postino east!! i've been many times and i am never disappointed!!

Urban Chic in downtown Gilbert?  

Got a group of girls to check this place out...heck yah!  The wait that night was like Disneyland, without the VIP pass.  Some of us were too excited to even care about the wait and the others...well, a little annoyed.

I can't believe this was the same place that housed Mahogany Run, Gonzo's and Grain Belt.   The transformation of the building from matronly stuffy to modern simplification of form is a welcoming addition to downtown Gilbert.  It's not so out of place with the hip Liberty Market across the way.  

The fireside patio is full of comfortable contemporary furniture.  It was "nipply" outside, hubby likes to say, so we opted to sit inside the warm coziness.  My friends and I were so giddy, we forgot the name of our wonderful server!  We all shared the bruschettas:  prosciutto with fig and mascarpone, smoked salmon and pesto, burrata/bacon/arugula and tomatoes, roasted peppers and goat cheese.  I always suffer the next day from the hidden sodium and gluten overload...but it was all good!  I always have a glass of wine which neutralizes a lot of the symptoms...no, not really.

Gotta leave room for dessert, right?  Creme. Bru. Le.  The classic vanilla with Italian wedding cookie one and coffee, the swan song to every delightful nosh.  

We enjoyed the food and ambiance so much, we're already planning to come back soon!  It's so close, I could ride my bike...nah.  Better book a taxi for the wine bottle/bruschetta specials.

Postino, you deserve all 5 stars!
I love the bruschetta and wine deal on mondays! Gets busy so get there early or make a reservation.

Had lunch here for the first time. Chose a half panini/half salad combo. The food was delicious! I had a vegetable panini on ciabatta bread and their mixed green salad. My lunch date had the chicken and mozzarella panini and loved it. We saw a lot of mixed bruschetta boards coming out which I will definitely go back and try. I only gave 4 stars bc the music was really loud and our server kind of forgot about us. I don't know if that's the norm but it wouldn't prevent me from going again

Always have a great time, and a perfect hang out spot. It's a perfect place for trying new wine. The food is pretty much salads, sandwiches, meat/cheese block, and bruschetta for dinner, and a very limited brunch menu. It's good, but I wish there was more variety. They also don't take reservations under 8 people. Their happy hour is $5 wine which is a great deal.

What a wonderful place. Had a craving for bruschetta  and this came in to my search and I'm so glad we went. Their food is really good, and fresh. We came before 5pm in the afternoon and all wines are 5 dollars. A $12 or $13 glass of wine for five bucks is a very nice perk. They have a great pilsner beer on tap as well. Great location in super up-and-coming Main Street Gilbert with lots of restaurants around. Very Lively atmosphere, super nice staff that works there. A must go to if you're in this part of town.

Great spot in old town!! The food and wine are top notch!!  We enjoyed the outdoor seating, felt like we were in our own backyard, very comfortable!! Staff and service is outstanding!! Two thumbs up!!

YUMMMM!! Every time I come here, the staff are great and the food is always consistent and great! I am so happy we have a place like this closer to my home in Gilbert. I love wine bars, and this one by far exceeds my expectations.

$5 for a pitcher of beer? Cannot ever beat that at a restaurant. The food selection is small, but the items are very good if you are health-conscious & do not want overly greasy or rich food. This is definitely one of my favorite weekend spots.

This is my favorite wine bar for 2 reasons: you get to try wines that you can't find at any other restaurant in the state...and...the location in downtown Gilbert is awesome! I take friends, family and business associates here and I have never once received a complaint about going to a more "happening" part of town...I've closed down Postino Gilbert more than once. Service is always great too

We recently had my sister and her finances wedding shower at Postinos and it could not have gone any better! There was a bit of confusion at the beginning of the evening but it was quickly taken care of. All of the staff was extremely attentive and helpful. As expected, the bruschetta and Panini's were superb and they had a ton of wine and beer choices for the guests. The only drawback was a live acoustic band playing the whole time that we were not made aware of until the day before our event. It was rather hard to hear everyone as we played shower games but at least they weren't terrible sounding. I would definitely recommend for anyone to hold a special event there!

This place was amazing! Great outdoor seating area, fantastic service, very chill ambience, live music... So many great things to say about it! 

We tried the bruschetta platter & each kind was fabulous! Then we got a few different paninis & those were to die for as well... They call themselves a wine bar, but also have a great selection of beers & you can't beat the prices! 

If I lived nearby, I'd for sure be a regular!

Such great food and atmosphere! I would like to see more vegan options. :] I usually get the veggie sandwhich without artichoke spread, since it has dairy, and the side salad without cheese. Tasty and filling! I love the bruschetta, obviously, but again I would like to see more veggie options. You can have them make substitutions, but I would love to see them get creative with it. :]

My FAVORITE Arizona restaurant - hands down.  My fave is the weekend brunch - haven't had a bad dish yet.  Bellini and smoked salmon with capers - perfect way to start a Sunday!  The servers are so great - every one of them makes the experience what it is.  The only less than perfect experience happened int he dining room during Sunday brunch - sat us in the worst two top in the place.  But we made the best of it.  So happy this locale is so close to home.  Keep it up Postino's!!!!

I love all the Postino locations, but Postino East may be my favorite. Conveniently located in Downtown Gilbert, this Postino never disappoints with delicious bruschetta, amazing sandwiches, and great happy hour deals. Not to mention the staff and service is phenomenal. Postino is a must-go for locals and out of towners alike.

Happy hour and bruschetta what more can You ask for?! I always come here whenever I visit arizona. They have happy hour for 20 that comes with a bottle of wine and a plate of bruschetta. My favorite is the salmon and apples. If you're looking for a good place with food and drinks this is the place to come on a nice summer day. $5 wine glasses till 5pm!

I usually would rate Postino East with 5 stars.  We love their food and the fun , cool atmosphere, however last night our service was terrible.  Our server came to our table and hastily took our drink and food order, as we were only ordering appetizers.   She brought our drinks back a few minutes later and then we didn't see her for about 35 minutes.  I finally flagged her down and asked for another glass of wine.  She finally came back about 10 minutes later....With our check. No wine, no question about dessert, no "take your time".  We wanted coffee, another drink and dessert, but were so off - put by her lack of service that we left to get a drink elsewhere.   We've had good experiences here in the past, so we will likely go back, but if this had been our first time, it also would have been our last.

I had no wait at lunch today and the servers and bus-people were always right on top of things. I had a half panini (prosciutto with brie) and a half chicken raspberry salad. These are 2 of the best things I have eaten in a really long time. We had to order the chocolate cake for dessert just because we didn't want to leave! Decent prices, great service and fantastic food! I'll be back for sure!

Great place to relax and enjoy a great glass of wine and delicious food. We went during happy hour on a Saturday, busy, but not a long wait. We ordered wine and beer and a cheese platters. Cheese was so good. It was enough to share with 4 of us. Service was great.  I will returning soon.

Went there for Mother Day dinner with my kids!!! Not busy not slow had to wait a little for hostess to seat other tables . Also plan on being here for but the food takes a bit to come out. That was the only complaint and not even really a complaint more just a statement and opinion. The food was good I feel it's a little pricey for what your getting but still come so.

I'm updating my review because as much as I really love coming here, I have to say the bruschetta has really been lacking lately.  The bread has been hard (like stale hard) and the bruschetta toppings have been skimpy. It's been 2 or 3 times now so I had to review again. Hoping they'll read this and make improvements.

This newest location is absolutely beautiful and fits in perfect with their urban style building.  Looks like they reworked another old brick building and made it amazing. Open and airy yet warm and inviting.

The Select Two for $10 lunch is so reasonable and tasty! The wide selection of panini & salads is perfect for the picky eater.  My guest got a bowl of soup that was delicious as well.

Thanks Postino's!
Love this place!!  Very nice place to relax, enjoy food, drinks and family & friends!

I'm so happy this is in Gilbert!  I've only been once, but I want to be here every day!  The decor is upscale casual, very pleasing to the eye, swanky, and the place is family friendly.  Plus, they play great music.

11am - 5pm everyday wine by the glass or a pitcher of beer is $5.  

Mondays and Tuesdays after 8pm $20 for any house bottle of wine and bruschetta.

This is a wine bar, but the food is what draws me in.  There's an OK selection of wines and beers, but go for the food and atmosphere.

Favorites:
- Bruschetta (choose 4 from 11).  I liked the Smoked salmon with pesto and Tomato jam & fresh sheeps milk cheese.
- Olives (expensive, but soooo good)
- Chicken & Mozzarella Panini
Love postinos! The Monday and Tuesday wine and bruschetta special is awesome! The food is delicious and I love the atmosphere!

My husband and I had a very nice meal here. We started with the bruschetta board, which was delicious as everyone else has said. I got a glass of wine which was very good. We both had sandwiches and soup as well. All was superb. I loved the atmosphere out on the patio. Service was amazing. We ended with a chocolate dessert with a side of salted caramel sauce that the waitress suggested... AMAZING! Next time I'll just order a glass of the caramel sauce to drink, it's seriously THAT good. Don't miss out on the caramel sauce!

We love this place. Such a fun date night place. There is a playful and even romantic feeling in sharing  a savory Board of bruschetta with your date while sipping a glass of wine. Sitting on the patio is my favorite. Highly recommend.

We decided to do a girls day at Postino's and we started out with a server who was very knowledgeable about his wine but seemed rushed. He was at the end of his shift and we were lucky enough to get Jason who was very friendly from the beginning and he was even kind enough to save us from a bee! He was very thorough with helping us choose the right wine when others would probably would have given up. We thank you so much for the extended amazing service we really appreciate it! We aren't always blessed with such great service so we are truly grateful for your service and we will only request you from now on! We will be back

Love love love Postino!!!! This location is great, good places to eat inside and outside. He bruschetta board is incredible. My favorites are the salami and pesto and hummus and tomatoes. Service was great and they were accommodating to out 14 person party.

It is weird seeing this location here, given my years spent in Gilbert. Never thought that they would ever build up the area, after so many years of promise. If I had had the capital that the owners have, I'd have done the exact same thing they are doing, because this is the perfect location for a trendy hipster joint like Postinos.

Everyone knows Postinos from their other locations, I have reviewed the others, so lets cut to the chase: Great location, you can walk around to Joyride or Zinburger (both Fox Concepts) and enjoy their different flair if its not a $20 bruschetta night and you just came in for wine. The area is continuously getting built up further and its going to turn into a powerhouse. Once again, really wish I had the capital to get rights to work with these guys, they are an amazing company and they have hit the ball out of the park on literally every location they have placed down. Also, the staff here are great. Our waiter offerred to exchange one of the listed pour bottles for a vintage that was not selling well due to price ($70 for a bottle of vino!?!), at $12 a glass. 

The only issue I have which loses a star is their usage of space outside. They have a "waiting area" it seems that is made up of 6 or so very small high-top tables where you can place your wine glass. They could easily go the Culinary Dropout route and use the space for more cornhole area (which they do have in a trunk mind you), or other games. Otherwise, take out the putting green-like carpeting , put more tables out there and you will have even more space for us Spring-loving weather seekers to enjoy the outdoors. 

Otherwise, this place is a homerun as always, consistent as you'd expect with Postinos. 
4 stars for consistency, location, wine quality and offerings, and great staff. Amazing first or second date spot, and is usually #1 in my rotation for just that. ENJOY!

My nephew and I stopped in here for lunch. The Gouda red pepper soup was delicious as was the chicken salad. The roast beef panini could have been a bit more rare, kind of dry. The service by Dalton was very good!
We love to order a board and a bottle of wine for a romantic evening.

Low stars based on service and food (wine selection and ambiance are not bad) 

If you want to go here on date, this is a great spot- it's romantic with the dark lighting and intimate seating. 

If you want to take a group, maybe try another place- It seems very difficult for them to bring out food for large groups in a timely manner. Also, splitting the check must be rocket science because on various occasions they were not able to.
Awesome place to sit, relax and enjoy a glass of wine. The Bottle and Board special on Tuesday night is GREAT....

There's nothing not to like here except the wait on wine & bruschetta nights. The food is wonderfully prepared and very fresh. Can't complain about the wine list or beer selection. It's great to be able to have a drink on their "front porch" while waiting for a table.

I am giving Postino only 3 stars not because of any things I do not like, but because of what I feel it is lacking.  Let me start by saying that Postino East is nicely decorated and comfortable.  The wine selection is nice.  I do wish, however, that there were spirit options.  Now I understand that this is a wine bar but sometimes you want a cocktail.  The food is a tad bit frou-frou for my particular taste buds.  I'd like to see some other options as well.  The other reason is that this is not my favorite is going through downtown Gilbert can be a real hassle between the lack of parking, construction and police and speed zones.  Postino has an air about it....the staff can be a tad bit up-itty.  I will give Postino another and will amend my review if I feel differently.

Postino
Always good food and service....can't beat the Bruschetta.  If you have not been here before you are missing some of the best food the valley has to offer.  I was at the original Resturant many years ago on opening day and have been coming back ever since.  Thanks Craig!

The bruschetta is amazing! They also have an awesome summertime wine that's super delicious and only $5 a glass for happy hour!

The only negative thing, it's typically packed, which leaves you to sit outside. Not so bad since they have misters... but the misters were dripping onto our table. Assuming you can shift around or find a shaded or inside seat, you can't wrong! :)
Cannot find anything to complain about. Great food, good service and good wine list. Can get busy, but they have always found a seat for us and if we had to wait outside they brought wine!

This place is great. We have small children and they are always accommodating. Their kids menu is great. Healthy choices and my son loves it.  I wasn't a big bruschetta guy before trying this place. I love the variety.  It's a must try.

This place is great.The butchers block and bruschetta are my favorites. You can mix and match the bruschetta so everyone can get what they want. I would suggest the BLT, smoked salmon, and fig with goat cheese. This place also has a great atmosphere so it would be perfect for a date night.

Stopped around 1 for a glass of wine & bruschetta with the boyfriend.  I've heard so much about Postino & it definitely lived up to the hype.  Luckily, we were able to just walk in without the crazy wait & choose a comfy pair of chairs with a great view of the patio.

The waitstaff is amazing.  They seem to really enjoy being there & it shows in the service.  I enjoyed a $5 glass of wine & the boyfriend chose a $5 pitcher of beer... the bruschetta ended up being a little pricey but it went above and beyond what I expected from bruschetta.  Delicious.  

It was worth the drive to downtown Gilbert.  All in all, a very cute date spot.  I love the lawn in the back!  The overall style is so modern without being stuffy-- it's definitely a place you'll want to stay.  I wish more places were like Postino.

So the way I do my ratings is that I assign 1 star to each of the following 5 categories:  Location, Service, Food, Atmosphere, Value. 

This place definitely has all 5! It is located in a quaint little historic are of Gilbert alongside some cool old buildings with old neon signage. 

The service was very good with incredibly friendly people who seem to care about your experience (and trust me, this is becoming rare). Even though the waiter forgot one of our orders, we were enjoying our first course so much that it didn't even matter and he corrected it right away. 

The food is amazing! It's kind of a unique menu, most of it dedicated to charcuterie and bruschetta. But the varieties are creative and VERY tasty! you can choose any combination of 4 bruschettas served on a wood board. Each bruschetta is served on a nicely grilled bread slice that is cut in 4 for easy sharing (the goat cheese and roasted pepper was soooo good!). We also ordered the Butcher's Block which is an assortment of meats, olives, cheese, hummus and crostinis. Every bite was delicious. Oh yeah, and from 11am-5pm EVERY DAY they have a $5 happy hour drink special. We had peach bellinis which were excellent.

The atmosphere is also very cool, nice wood tables with a huge wine rack on one wall, very lively and they even have an outdoor patio with a bocci ball court you can play on. The music was loud enough to hear, but not too loud and any place that plays The Smiths while you eat has to be COOL!

Finally, the price was surprisingly reasonable. The cost to value ratio is very good. My wife and I got out of there for under $45 and more than satisfied with our meal.

They have 3 locations, but if you are anywhere near Gilbert, make it a point to stop on by for a board of tastiness!

If you're ever in the area please please please try this place out! You will not regret it. I came here for dinner once while I was visiting a friend who was in Gilbert for med school. I'm so sad that it's so far away from home because I constantly crave the meal we had here!! Everything is good so it's no wonder there's always a long wait. But the wait is worth it!

I like the place and at least we have one in the east valley.  However, it's marginal compared to the Arcadia location.  The obvious reason is the overall vibe and the crowd.  I live in Gilbert but it would be nice to go to a bar or lounge and it actually feel like a bar or lounge.  Not people bringing kids or going there to order an ice tea and salad.  Yes I know, it's you're right to go order your salad and non-alcoholic beverage anywhere you choose.  It's always busy and the service is relatively consistent.  The magic has always been the concept and $5 happy hour.  Brilliant!  We've been here at least 5 times and have been to the Arcadia and Central locations a number of times.  Truly, of all their restaurants/bars they own I would say that Windsor is the best place.  We will continue to go here once in a while.

This is my favorite Postino's!  They have a really awesome and unique set up.  The inside opens up into the outside patio.  It stays really cool outside even when it's 100 degrees outside.  They play fun music at a good volume level.  The greens salad was really really good!  Also a really good selection of bruschetta.  There is a fire place for when it's cold too.

We've been meaning to come here for a while now.  Finally had sufficient motivation to do so!

First impression:  Loud. The music is loud (even outside), and so the guests have to be loud to be heard.  They should probably turn it down a notch or two.  Staff was friendly and helpful upon arrival.

Despite the label here in Yelp, this is not an Italian restaurant.  Even the staff emphasized that, despite the Italian-sounding names of some of the food.  it is a bruschetta and wine bar.  They do have a good number of wines to choose from.  Seems they are trying to be like Vintage 95 was (alas, they closed!). 

Service was friendly and appropriately attentive. Variety of salads and sandwiches (panini). Happy hour from 11-5. Prices are a bit high.

We ordered chicken and mozzarella panini, raspberry chicken salad, bruschetta board, and autostrada sandwich.  The bruschetta board was disappointing.  Again, we couldn't help but compare to Vintage 95 and this wasn't even close.  The chicken panini was pretty good.  Nothing to rave, but pretty good.  The one who ordered the raspberry chicken salad really liked it, and that's probably the only thing saving me from going to two stars.  Everything else was underwhelming.  Not bad, but not good enough to rave about (and pay $18 per person with tip).  If this had been dinner I would have been very upset.  This menu is not appropriate for dinner, in my opinion.

Definitely not a replacement of Vintage 95, and not someplace I plan to frequent.  For the price it just didn't "wow" us at all.

Was a nice end to our evening in downtown Gilbert we had dessert shared amongst us. We had their delicious Creme Br√ªl√©e and Chocolate Bouchon with some French press coffee   Great atmosphere great staff and yummy dessert. With the rain pouring outside we had a great view of the storm passing through out the expanse of windows.  First time we went there for dessert. Good choice on our part !
Scottsdale in Gilbert! Great everything, just need a bigger place and larger bar area to accommodate walk ins that don't require a fancy table.

I have been to Postinos a couple of times and the place is good. However, I ordered takeout today and was disappointed with the food. Their salads are usually delicious though this time it was missing ingredients and smaller. I had the same salad a few weeks ago at the restaurant and there was a lot of substance to it, but this time it only had kale and two slices of apples.

Is a great place to take your significant other out for a nice meal and some wine.  You cannot beat the atmosphere with an open modern building in downtown Gilbert.  When you go there you have to get the Bruschetta.  Their Bruschetta is the best I have ever had.  They have a wide variety of Bruschetta which comes in 4's on a wood cutting block.  They also have panini's which are amazing.  I am a fan of the Prosciutto and Brie.  That sandwich is amazing.  Oh, and get the baked chips cant go wrong.  If you come here be sure its on a high carb day because you will be pounding down some carbs, but it is well worth it!

BrandonFitFoodie

I come here all the time and I never have a bad experience. The wait time is usually long because this place is so busy but tonight my family and I were seated immediately.
I ordered the Pub Board as and appetizer and the bruschetta as an entr√©e. They were both delicious.
The service here is great and I love the atmosphere but my favorite thing here is the music.
I highly recommend going to Postino.

I have been here a few times since they opened.  The wine is terrific, the food delicious but boy was it crowded! I have gone with large groups and the wait is always at least 2 hrs. One time we sat on the grass area and were still served, which was like a picnic, very nice. The second time we all chose to eat somewhere else but came back for drinks after dinner when it was much less crowded.  It would be nice to be able to make reservations so next time we can all stay and get the full experience.  It delights me to see a place in Gilbert as happening as this place is! I will be back to try with a large group again at the end of the month BUT I might just have to treat myself to lunch there before then, it's not possible to go there too often is it?

I'm new to the area and this was/is one place that has been overwhelmingly recommended. My friend and I gave it a try on 7/27 and we loved the ambiance and our servers were lovely and informative. We shared the bruschetta plate and it was to die for! I plan on bringing my hubby next time for Tuesday date night as they have a sweet deal of bruschetta and a bottle of wine for $20! I'm so glad to have found this local gem!!

Restaurant was absolutely packed on a Thursday night.  We found our way to the hostess station and was informed the wait was 90 minutes.  Normally this would make me crazy and would never consider waiting that long but fortunately the bar was the perfect place to hang out, drink and socialize while waiting.  At the 35 minute mark we were offered our table.  I guess the idea is to under promise and over deliver.  Every employee we encountered was friendly and made us feel welcome despite what a madhouse the place was.  The remodel is spot on as most of the original building has been transformed.  

On an unrelated note, beware of the speed trap along Gilbert road.  We were seated at a street side patio table and watched a motorcycle cop pulling people over, one after the other.  The speed limit is 25mph and it seems the Gilbert PD takes the speed limit very seriously.

Only reason for four stars instead of five is the NOISE LEVEL. The food is always consistently good and the extensive wine list is superb. I seem to always get the Butcher Block as an appetizer and it fills me up, which is too bad because their paninis and incredible bruschettas are worth driving across town for. All the wait staff are wonderful, helpful, adorable and extremely accommodating.
The Smoked Salmon  brochetta is off the hook. I suggest trying all of them though they are delicious.
Lots of empty tables ... 25-30 minute wait for brunch for two ... Must not be cool enough for this place.  Joyride ...  operated by the same company ... next door rocks.  Can't figure that out.

Seriously, this is the best place in the universe!!! My little sister had a court house wedding on NYE 2015! At the last minute (that's how my family does things) we decided to try and find a spot for a celebratory meal and called Postinos to try and see if we had a chance to  get in last second. We talked to the manager Justice, and he was so accommodating and made the night so amazing and special. Our server, Felix, was awesome and so attentive. We had 5 star service with extra personality. Our server at one point, had the New Year's Eve crown on! The whole atmosphere was amazing and made their special day even better. Thank you so much!

Every time I come to Postino East, or Central, or Arcadia, I become convinced Postino is the love of my life!!! It's pretty patios are perfect for Fundays with my girls or nights with a fellow. Great wine (their $5 before 5 will be my undoing for sure), yummy carb-based food (but it's okay, because the portions aren't Texas sized, right?!?! Alas, still yummy, yummy, carbs - carbs make me happy though), fun music, incredibly friendly service..... 

OH! The piece de resistance!!! They are Edie Approved. Which means, this pup becomes the most fervent beggar when the bruschetta lands on the table as she waits and waits for some of the perfectly crispy bacon and crumbs of the crust! It's Pawsivitely perfect for day dates with my mini mutt!

Love this place! My boyfriend and I shared the bruschetta(you pick four different ones for the plate) and were in heaven. My favorite was the burrata, bacon, arugula and tomato his was the Brie, Apple and fig spread. We also got the roasted red pepper and goat cheese and artichoke spread ones. They were delicious as well. We also shared the butchers block which was really good. I got a cup of broccoli cheddar soup which tasted fine, but nothing special.
Best bruschetta is the whole world. Such amazing ideas and taste. Beautiful location and set up. Weekends add up a long wait but so worth it!

Fantastic service.  They take a team approach that leaves no one waiting too long.  The only wait is to get in.  The bruschetta is worth it.  Try one, try three, try them all.  They're all amazing!  If you are a wine lover, you can drink to content and have all the best snacks to go along with it...olives, cheese, bruschetta.
