The best food and wine the service is amazing the atmosphere is great the seeding is beautiful I'm so glad this place came to Gilbert my family and I love to go here at least once a month if not more. Very retro great people that work there with great attitudes quick service and good food

My wife loves this place, she likes to stop by for some feeding when we are in the area. I find the food to be good tasting but maybe a bit small in serving sizes for someone as hearty of an eater as I am. I still give them 4 stars though. 

It's a pretty what you would expect little step up from Olive Garden type of restaurant.

Good spot for dates or dining with friends.

Worth a taste

My husband and I love coming here for HH to download from the day. Postino's has great food, wine and atmosphere. We always sit at the bar and are very well taken care of by Patrick and Dan.  We stick to the bruschetta board but have tried the roast beef, turkey and chicken sandwiches and they are pretty tasty as well.  The salads are good also but I prefer a sandwich or board.

This is a great spot and I hear it has an even better happy hour which I am excited to try.  My folks were in town so we made a reservation here for dinner and sat on the patio.  The ambiance was beautiful and to my surprise we didn't notice much road noise.  

The wine selection is immense and is something I'm interested in delving more into.  The menu is a little abbreviated but what we had was delicious.  With that said, I respect a place that has a great small menu instead of a mediocre large one.  Postino is absolutely the former.  We had a bruschetta board and a variety of paninis and everything was incredibly good tasting and fresh.

I will absolutely be back.  Try this place for a quick and upscale bite with easy access to the rest of downtown Gilbert.

LOVE...Food was excellent and the wine list was to die for. We met a group of friends to have a glass of wine and we had plans to go to another restaurant. We never left. It was a beautiful night and sitting on the patio was sheer delight !

Wonderful place I cannot say enough  good about Postinos! Great food love the chicken salad:) Happy hour 11-5  (seven days a week) who doesn't  like that!  Service is always perfect! You will not regret your visit its a must :)

This was my first time at Postino's East and I had s good experience. I went on a Tuesday and it was crowded so make sure to get there early 

Once we were finally seated the servers were very attentive and friendly. The food was great and the wine selection was nice.

This place is ugh-mazing. I come here often and love the service, the wine, the people and especially the bruschetta. Not to mention the brunch is incredible too!

Yes, sometimes the wait is a little long, but I promise you, IT'S WORTH THE WAIT. I've been to a couple of other imitation locations and they don't even come close. 

Postinos East is a MUST-GO if you're looking for a girls night out, romantic dinner setting, double date night, sexy brunch time :-) ...whatever the occassion. We've had several small group bday celebrations here. Anything over 8 people is tough for them but they usually make it work. 

The outside grassy area is perfect for a picnic lunch or dinner. You bring the blanket and they bring the service. You can also arrange large parties out there but I think you pay/order all the tables and chairs. Not sure but I've seen it done and it seemes like a quaint space for the large group.

Postinos East delivers phenomenal service and food 100% of the time.

Love this spot.  One of the top 4 to make the Gilbert Historic district a hot spot.  Love the food and the bruschetta platters are a hit to carry out for any party.  Hint to park for downtown Gilbert is behind the water fountains and the large marble, where it says GO, because it's covered parking most people do not know it's public parking. Another spot is behind the main corner...... turn east on the main corner and the lot on the south.

So I came here when I was visiting my little sister at college and it was really good! 20 dollar bottle and board is all you need for two people. The portions are big and it's just such a fun place to be! Can't wait to come back for more! Definitely a must for whenever I come back to Phoenix to visit! Wish they had one in Philly!

Long wait for two people. Should have looked at the menu before we were sat. Pretty much just soups, salads, and sandwiches.  I really didn't know what this place was about but I don't think I will be back. The food was good, service was mediocre, beer and wine was good too. Almost felt more like an appetizer and drinks happy hour place than a restaurant.

Love everything I've tried there. Servers are always friendly. The atmosphere is great there day and night. Only downfall, i wish there was more room to stand by the bar. With servers and people going to the bathroom, that area gets packed.
Love love love this place. The environment, food, drinks, and customer service is amazing. The Monday night special is amazing.

Superb wine selection. (try the ones on tap - Yum!)  Great deals on good beer during happy hour. ($5 mini pitchers!)
Very friendly staff, comfortable seating, clean restrooms.
Enjoyed most of the bruschetta.  The 'Butcher Board' was amazing.  Try it.
Looking forward to going back.  
Welcome to the neighborhood.  (:

Another trendy Gilbert restaurant.  The clientele is mostly made up of people eager to be hip,  picking  such a trendy place to dine.  So the vibe is a bit off putting and the music they play makes it hard to speak with your server.  Which is odd and makes the place feel more like a club rather than a relaxed restaurant trying to center itself around wine...kind of an identity crisis going on.  That aside the staff is very friendly and attentive.  Also, the food was good.  I ordered probably one of the best tuna sandwiches I've ever had.  I would go back, but maybe on a week day, not on a weekend night.

i really dig this bar/restaurant, the environment is the best and the bruschetta is off the chain... 








also a lot of hot chicks

Went here for my best friends birthday brunch. Nice atmosphere. Very limited and small brunch portions. But for 30 dollar you get a whole bottle of champagne for all you can drink mimosas!! So delicious!! I would definitely go back

One word: Bruschetta. Literally amazing. The environment is extremely comfortable. I could literally spend hours here. Great service, great food. We will be back as often as our checking accounts allow.
Yummy!  I just love this place, its been dubbed my " first date spot" comfortable, relaxed and great atmosphere especially for the east valley. I am a fan!
Great spot! Fun atmosphere with $5 glass til 5pm everyday! Bruschetta is amazing! Great bartender!

This is a really cool place, but you definitely go for the wine, and not the food.  I was pregnant the first two times I went (and I don't drink wine anyway, but still), and the food is pretty good, but the selection is so slim.  It is a super fun place to hang out, any time of the year though.

Nice place to relax and have a late Saturday afternoon lunch. We started with the Bruschetta plate, my fav is the prosciutto, figs and mascarpone. Then came the Italian Picnic Salad with chicken. A great experience and a nice ambience.

I love coming to Postinos.  The food is always good and I like the ambiance of the restaurant. We got the hummus & artichoke platter and a plate of the Bruschetta. The only thing I did not like about our visit tonight was that the hostess forgot to put us on the list and all these people who came in after us were getting seated before us. We were sitting right in front of her and she still forgot to put us on the list. when I finally asked why everyone was getting seated before us she said she thought she put us on the list. So that part was irritating and it made us almost walk out. Beside that , the food tasted delicious.

Great ambiance, great drinks, and great food. My friend and I shared the brushetta (gluten-free costs an additional $2) and selected 4 different flavors. I absolutely loved the goat cheese and pepper since the two go perfectly together. Pair a bellini with the plate, and voila! BLISS!!!

Glasses of wine are only $5 during happy hour :)
Amazing wine bar to relax with friends. You must try out their food. Very positive experience every time.

Finally decided to check this place out since it's got such a huge following and always seems to be packed full of people. Usually Liberty is our go to in Downtown Gilbert(we cheated this time). 
The Bestie and I stopped in for a little day drinking on a Friday afternoon. Glad we came shortly before 4 PM because after it got PACKED. I've had the hankering for a sparkling rose lately so I was happy to see one on the cute wine list clip board. Oh might I mention, $5 ANY glass of wine before 5 PM. Um, yes please. Since we both went with the rose, the server recommended we buy the bottle for the happy hour price of $20. Good deal. We also got a bruschetta board which was just incredible. Four good sized selections that are very easy to split(though you may end up fighting over your favorites). I also noticed that they have a large beer selection as well, something that is lacking at most wine bars. This is a huge plus since the husband is more of a beer drinker. I see a Postino date night in our future.

The atmosphere was fun, the groupings of tables and couches made the space crowded but welcoming, and even with open walls in 90 degree heat it was comfortable and airy. The service was just incredible. Our server was attentive and we had other servers checking on us, refilling water glasses, bringing out food, and just making sure we were having a good time. Both of us have worked in the service industry, a little attention goes a long way. They must have an amazing team over there for everyone to work together so well. 
The entire time it was just a shock that there could be somewhere this fun and trendy, on this side of town. I've lived in Gilbert all my life, it's about time downtown gets a little spark back. Plus it's nice to see a new business doing great on this "cursed" corner.

We will definitely be back, with friends to help split a bottle. Looking forward to many warm summer nights on the patio at Postino.

I've been driving by this place for months waiting for it to open.  I'm so happy it's finally here.  

It's just as awesome as all the other Postino's.  Bruschetta boards, awesome.  Wine, awesome. Ambiance, awesome.  

Liberty Market and the Farmhouse are both hot spots across the street so parking will be tricky around there.  I'm not looking forward to fighting the crowds - which are inevitable but worth it!

I have been wanting to try Postinos for some time now and I am so happy I finally did! We had a short wait to get a table so we went to the bar. My sister and both ordered beer which mine came in a can hers in a bottle and they were poured into glasses. Both beers were not very cold and the glasses as well were not chilled or frozen enough. We did bring this to our servers attention later with hopes it would get passed on that maybe there fridge is on its last leg. Other than that everything else was amazing! Now, I have fallen in love with eating bruschettas and cheese and meat boards with that said BOY did theirs not disappoint. There literally was not one thing I tried that was not delicious. We ordered two bruschetta boards that each had four selections of our choice. Each one of them was amazing! I cannot wait to go back!

It's tough to be impartial after all the hype this place got, but alas, I wasn't that impressed.  I think part of the problem with the ambiance is the squawk factor.  It felt like the majority of the patrons there thought they were filming an episode of Sex & The City.  That said, it's only a minor drawback.  

We got the olives, as an appetizer, and they delivered.  The prices on their wine / beer selection were reasonable and also spot on.  The bruschetta is their specialty - and two of the four we chose were really good.  I will say, that quite possibly, the best thing they serve is their BLT bruschetta - way good and something I will crave.  The classic (mozzarella / basil / tomato) needed a little more balsamic & a little less salt.  The brie / apple just needed more brie and it would have been amazing.  The prosciutto / fig one was just forgettable.

We got the roast beef sandwich on ciabatta to share, and here lies the bulk of the trouble.  The bread had good flavor, but it felt like it had fallen in a tub of dust prior to being served (too much excess flour).  The sauce was cloyingly sweet, and their chips were soggy and tasted like they had been cooked ten hours prior.

The service was just fine - and if we had stumbled upon this place, without all the hype / build up, it probably would have deserved a four.  So, IF we go back, it will be for their Monday / Tuesday night special - which is four of their bruschettas + one bottle of wine for $20 - tough to beat.
Good selection of wine. I like $5 special before 5pm for trying new drinks. We like the Gilbert location as it has access to lot of different restaurants.

Breakfast at Postino's is just as good as their dinner. Also means the personal French Press they give you gets put to good use :) 

Great alternative to Liberty Cafe on a weekend which is right across the street and always 10x more crowded during breakfast. Not as much variety on the breakfast menu but their options are tasty and always very well made. 

Only complaint is that the indoor seating area seems very dark - even during morning hours. Sitting outside is always nice but given the summer heat encroaching as early as 9am it's difficult to be completely comfortable outside for a full meal.

First off!  This is breakfast review of this place.  The location and seating is very nice
The menu is ala carte and server in little plates. 
The food was good but under portion and over price keep in mind its ala carte. 
Service /Server was very slow and it was not busy the meal did not come out together and server miss portion of the order

Sample prices
Side of toast $ 2.00 ea Side of potatoes $ 3.00 ea 
Large  OJ $ 4.50 ea  One Egg & Bacon $ 4.50 ea

The total for two $ 27.50 w/o tip.

If Postino East is going to charge these prices for breakfast they should delivery AAA service, but I do not think I will be back. The breakfast across the street is easy 20% lower and just as good.

Wow! The Bruschettas were amazing. So much flavor. And they were good sized too. The tomato jam one was amazing, and the salmon one. We also got a couple paninis which were also great. We had four people and we got 2 orders of the bruschetta and 2 paninis to share and it was plenty. I definitely will be back.

Postinos on the East side!?

Whoa, you like to think that you're immune to Postinos, oh yeah
It's closer to the truth to say I can't get enough 
You know I'm gonna have to face it, I'm addicted to Postinos 

Thanks Robert Palmer and let's just say I wouldn't be surprised to see the fashion models around here.  Very attractive crowd!  I am honor just to be here!  

Another bottle of wine and you'll be mine, a one track mind 
I can't be saved 
4 flavors of Bruschetta is all I crave 
If there's some left for you 
and don't mind if I do 

I might as well face it I'm addicted to Postinos

I've always enjoyed attending Postinos on the West side of town, but the East side adds a new flavor.  The place still has a great deal on Monday and Tuesday nights.  Bottle of wine plus a large plate of bruschetta's for $20!  The ambience is always chill and low lighting.  Quite romantic and add some pretty ladies and I'm golden here!  Service is always great at Postinos.  The staff is definitely well train in the knowledge of wine and their service is spectacular! - Enjoy!

The food is definitely a 5 for me.  I adore their bruschetta and pub board. But the service is a 2 for me.  Man alive this last visit a few days ago was ROUGH.  Hardly any refills, terrible customer service and it took forever to be brought our checks and even longer for our to go boxes. I adore the food so much, so I'll be back but hope for less arrogant service next time!

Maybe it was the night and the setting and our chaotic week, but my friend and I needed to wind down, and Postino's wasn't the place to do that.  I'm giving the place four stars based on food, but definitely not setting. 

Like all the other restaurants in this area, it was busy. There was a 45 minute wait (but several empty tables inside).  We opted to sit at the bar.  However, before we even ordered drinks we knew we couldn't take the pounding music.  The bartender suggested we try "the grassy area out back".   This consisted of a curved, winding concrete seating strip with low tables. The other choice was a tall table that you stood at.  Neither was comfortable.  

I was super hungry and ready for a hefty meal, but Postino's menu only consisted of interesting appetizers, artisan bruschetta, soups/salads, and paninis.  My friend ordered a few different types of bruschetta, which turned out to be a medium sized meal.  I had a very delicious half and half:  Brussels sprouts salad with bacon and dried cherries, and a prosciutto and brie panini.  I spread the generous-sized cloth napkin over my lap and then either held the salad bowl with one hand and ate with the other. Switching off between the two, I balanced the sandwich plate on my knees.  

I will go back to try more of the menu, but at lunchtime.  Not enough on the menu to make me consider it for dinner.
The bruschetta boards are my favorite meal ever!! They also have a delicious moscato not listed on the menu!

Love the Monday wine and bruschetta special! The bruschetta is by far my favorite menu item at this establishment, I've had them all and they're all very good! I prefer to ask for the bruschetta on toasted thin sliced bread so it doesn't get as soggy of fill me up as fast! Wine selection is good, as is the best selection. I mostly continue to go back here for the bruschetta and atmosphere. You may want to call and make a reservation if going Friday-Sunday, it gets really busy (1.5+ hour waits) and even with the reservation you may end up waiting 30 minutes. They accommodated my birthday gathering of 17 people on their front patio...wish they'd rearranged the sofas for better socialization, but it worked out.

Ok lets make this review fast and easy. In a nut shell 1. Its noisy, 2. it can get really crowded, 3. you can wait a while to get a table. That said, I would come here just for the Bruschetta!!!!!! 8 or 9 different Bruschetta's, we had four different, and wow, it was great!!! Such a nice new punch of flavors right in your mouth!! Me and my wife were almost full so we shared the roast beef paninii and it was GREAT! We will be back, for sure. Woo Hoo!! Would have gave them 5 stars if the music wasn't so loud.
Fun and relaxing place to hang out and have a nice bottle of wine. Their $20 wine and bruschetta board special is the best!
Just another five star review with everyone else. I typically get great service here. Bruschetta and wine selections are amazing.

Raspberry Chicken Salad and the different bruschetta's are amazing. I absolutely love their food. I have never had a bad experience with their food! 
The only thing I dislike is the wait times are often very long. I would plan on the wait time being 10 minutes longer than what they tell you. 
The service is great once you are seated. I went last week and my card was over charged by 30 dollars. They were great and worked with me and the bank to get it all sorted out.
I would recommend Postinos to anyone and everyone!
The environment is open air and relaxing. Service was perfect and food was exactly as described. My first experience was enjoyed by myself and my friends.
We have been here 4 times and it never disappoints.  The bruschetta is the way to go.  Do not expect full meals and ENJOY.  The beer selection is great for a Wine Bar
I love Postino! Great Bruschetta, wine and awesome patio!!! Staff is always helpful & attentive. Fun, mellow atmosphere...

Postino's is probably the most amazing restaurant wine bar I've ever eaten in my entire life the ambience itself makes it an absolutely perfect restaurant their food is incredible and their service is also. On Tuesdays they have an amazing special a bottle of wine and a bruschetta for $20 you cannot beat that anywhere. We are from California and we drive to Arizona to visit our friends and we always make it a point to stop by Postinos at least once while we're there their bruschetta is out of this world!!
Good stuff. Good wine. Great staff. Only wish they had small bites of every meal....except salad cause that's  dumb. Just paninis and snacks. But seriously, always such a nice experience

Wow this place! Once the wife and I figured this place out we have now gone 3 times in the last 2 weeks. Amazing food and service. Great wine selection, sandwiches and you can beat the special they have going on on Monday and Tuesday!

Cant say anything bad about this place. I think it was awesome and we didnt go when there were any specials or anything so I would like to try happy hour here but when I went here I was very impressed and would recommend it to anyone!

My boss invited the whole team here several months ago for happy hour. I have to say this is the best happy hour place I have ever been to. The price for food and wine is friendly. They have diversity choices for the BRUSCHETTA, which can perfectly go with different wines. The only complain I might have is that it is not a place for a single person, cause the size of their dishes are too much to finish.
The house (made) pinot nior "Stage Dive" - is spicy and delicious- the atmosphere is hip  as is the music - a fabulous wine bar with tasty food as well!

My boss told me about this cool place to eat in Downtown Gilbert and it was indeed fantastic! Great food and impeccable service. Had a small wait at 3pm on a Sunday but they put us in some low padded arm chairs and a small table. Food order was taken quickly, and arrived just as fast. Anti pasto plate and some bruschetta fueled us up but thankfully we saved room for dessert. Don't leave without trying the creme br√ªl√©e!

BRUSCHETTA! Whatever you do here, get the bruschetta. In fact, that's all we got! 

Stopped in around 3 after our flight, being slightly hungry but not wanting to spoil our dinner. We also ordered cucumber lemonade ... Soooo good and refreshing. The outside area is fabulous. The waitstaff is pleasant and attentive. Huge fan of this place. If I lived in the area I would visit frequently.
Great hang out spot! They're food is good, I just wish there was a bit more offered on their menu but other than that it is great! And the staff is always friendly
Best bruschetta and wine! Love this place! Food is delicious and the service is always friendly!
The food was good, ambiance was good but it was so incredibly loud on a Sunday afternoon that it was hard to talk and took away from what should have been an enjoyable experience.

Love love love the bruschetta. It's definitely one of a kind and very filling. My only compliant is the noise level and wait for a table. But that's expected on a Friday night. The food was quick and drinks very refilled very quickly. Overall fabulous experience.

My wife and another couple decided to go to Postinos at 7:00.   We were advised that it was going to be an hour wait. No problem  we will hang out in the front couch and have a few glasses of wine while we wait.  About 10 minutes later the hostess shows up and tells us we can't be sitting there, we say ok....   She moves us to a dining table by the bar, and proceeds to state we can sit here for dinner. After sitting for 30 seconds at the table we started getting soaked by the misters.  One of us went back to the hostess to be moved to a different table. She stated it would take a few minutes.  So we hung out at rear patio area, another 30 minutes went by with no call.  We went up front to the hostess and our name was dropped from the list.  Then they gave us another table up front and it too was soaked with water from the misters.   Now an hour and 20 minutes have gone by with no seating in sight.    Very disappointed at Postinos The wait staff with the drinks and water were great, but we will never  go there again. 

We walked across the street to Liberty Market and had our meal there within 20 minutes. It was excellent too.

Are you Gluten Free?  Are you jonesing for some great bread?  IT'S HERE!  AND POSTINO'S IS ALL OVER THE VALLEY!!!!  Dog friendly too!  Oh yeah, my husband is a vegetarian...This means that me (the GF chick) and he (the no-meat guy) are difficult to please.  Not at Postino's though.  

Extra points for having craft beers and a good wine list!  

I love you Postino's  xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo

This is one of my favorite restaurants! The bruschetta is amazing. My favs are the brie & apples with fig, and the prosciutto with figs & marscapone (so good!!). And we really like the butcher block, so many yummy things to eat!

This is defiantly a frequented spot for my friends and I, we have never had a bad experience here. We come a lot for the bottle and board special they have on Mondays and Tuesdays and there's usually a wait, but well worth it. I took my grandmother out for her birthday a few nights ago and it was her first time there, she absolutely loved it. Our server Nathan was just lovely, efficient and friendly and not just a robot taking an order. Kudos to you Postinos, keep up the great service!

This is one of my favorite places to eat in Gilbert and it's great for socializing with friends or family. If you like wine, appetizers, comfortable seating, and a great ambiance then this is your place. Their cucumber lemonade is both yummy and refreshing. Their bruschettas are delicious! It's important to note that I this is more of a wine and tapas kind of place and it gets pretty packed on the weekends. I usually only come here when friends and family come to visit. Great mimosas and bellinis for brunch time drinks!
Ok... coincidence or planned..... i happen to be sitting down right now at Postino east!!!

We have been here before and found the experience delightful. Not this time.

On entering, we noted that the sound system was blasting music at an obnoxious volume--overpowering, even oppressive. Since it was clear that we'd be seated immediately, we said nothing to the hostess, instead waiting for our server, who arrived quickly. We asked if the music could be turned down. The response stunned us. We were informed in no uncertain terms that the loud music is "part of who we (Postino) are."

The server's arrogance was palpable. On telling this person that we'd leave if the music were left at its mind-killing level, he replied that he could ask the bartender to "turn the music down a notch or two," but that if "someone complains, we'll have to turn it back up."

No apologies, just smugness.

We left, planning never to return.

We're not overly critical people. Bye-bye Postino East.

Love it! The bruschetta is amazing! Ambience is nice although it is quite loud. This is not the place to go if you want to have an in depth conversation unless you want to yell back and forth. But who cares if there is wine involved! So grateful they decided to expand to Gilbert. Downtown Gilbert needed a face lift and Postino has certainly added character to this sleepy suburb.

An ALL time Phoenix favorite of mine for lunch is Postino Arcadia, so I was excited to try their newest location. 

They are able to take something so simple (Brushetta, A Cheese Plate, Soups) and turn them into "works of art," just as the original does. 

Their Brushetta, in addition to being beautiful to look at is absolutely FABULOUS Haven't had one I didn't like, in spite of the fact I am NOT all that fond of Smoked Salmon or Tuna, but loved their preparation!

Lots of fun to have many for a great selection with several people sharing. Probably ALL but the soups should be shared and even the soups can be, if you are with someone you really care about or ask for an additional empty bowl!

Very nice location and now with better weather, wide open.
If I had one complaint, the recorded music has been far too loud on both occasions I was there. Still a great place for lunch with a wide variety of wonderful things on the menu!

Came here with my husband and we had an amazing time. We sat outside and it's gorgeous in their courtyard. Food was good. My favorite was the red pepper with goat cheese. We also had a date and pistachio bruschetta (I think that's what it was if I remember correctly) and it kinda didn't taste like anything. We also had a pub board and the chorizo was delish! Their food isn't super heavy so I was nice not feeling super stuffed when we left ;)

My sister took me here for my first time today and oh my goodness did I fall in love! The bruschetta is just freaking amazing! I haven't tried their other food yet but I sure will. Our waitress and just the staff in general was excellent also! I just had a great experience and can't wait to go back and bring people with me that can enjoy this delicious food too!

What can you say about this place that hasn't already been said.  I was nervous about them building one in the east valley because I just can't stay away...it's that good!

The bruschetta is some of the best you will ever have.  They just make an investment in good quality ingredients and you can tell in your first bite.  I am so messed up now because I see bruschetta on menus at other restaurants and I just laugh.  No one does this better that Postino.

The wine section is over the top and you have to get there before five so you can get multiple libations for give bucks. There's always the mainstays of mimosas or bellinis for five bucks at any time if cash is tight.  Room at the bar is always tight so get there early.  

If there's a wait (which will happen on Friday and Saturday night), walk around because downtown Gilbert has lots to do.  They will text you when your table is ready.  

This place is one of my mainstays and is always good.

First time having bruschetta, yum, Got the one that comes with 4 and some wine (moscato). Absolutely delicious. Service was kinda slow and the lights are dimed to low at night time, could barely see our friends haha. Other than that, good atmosphere and great good. The only thing that really bothered us is they brought our appetizers the same time as food!

I am giving them a 4 Star as no one is perfect. I read some of the previous reviews both positive and negative. I decided to give them a 3 visit review and see what's going on.

First off, the weekend evenings are packed and be prepared for a wait, but for me it was worth it.

I started with an assortment of the BRUSCHETTA'S.

Brie & Apples with Fig Spread
Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone
Tomato Jam & Fresh Sheeps Milk Cheese
Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese

The selections were excellent but I settled on these 4 and I was not disappointed. The Fig spread was a wonderful surprise that offers a versatility beyond its pairing with Brie and Apples, which was spectacular.

The Tomato Jam and Sheeps Milk Cheese? Wonderful pretty much sums it up.

Visit 2 was lunch. I ordered the Autostrada Panini sandwich, the Italian meats were all top shelf quality, but it was the house pepper relish that brought it all together. They should bottle and sell that relish.

Visit 3 was Brunch. I brought a friend and went a little overboard on ordering. We started with the Butcher Block which is a wonderful assortment of Italian meats, cheeses, olives,breads, hummus's,and nuts. There were only two of us, but it could easily be the perfect warm up appetizer for 4.

Next up was the Farm Scramble, the Ciabatta French Toast and berries with a side of their Applewood Smoked Bacon.

I could go on and on describing how good it all was, but I would run out of room. Fabulous!!!!

Regarding the service, everybody was nice, seemed to back each other up for water glasses, bussing empty dishes, etc. No complaints here.
Great food and wine but Jason was the worst!!! He was so rude on so many occasions, he put his hand in my face to wave me off while I was ordering. I've never been so unimpressed with a server.
Had an amazing Sunday brunch at Postino in Gilbert. French toast was awesome! Mimosas were great of course and the staff were fabulous. Great place to go with friends and family!!

I'm a fan of Upward Projects, they know what they are doing when it comes to restaurants! On the flip side, I'm not a fan of wine, call me crazy, so Postinos is not my favorite but their prices for some of the wines are great so I will give one or two a try. The food is good, especially the Bruschetta. All in all, its a great place to hang and chat with friends.

Yes, we've lived here for 5 1/2 years and just finally tried Postino.  We went on a sunny, somewhat warm December afternoon and sat in a couple of comfy lounge chairs by the open doors.  The ambiance was great, service was great....almost too great.  A different server literally stopped and asked us if we were doing ok every 5 minutes.  I like it though.  We'll definitely be going back.

Get here early on a Friday night or you may have to wait a couple of hours for a table. Great service. As always my favorite bruschettas in town and great wine by the glass for only $5 before 5pm. You can't beat that! It's nice that now there's a Postino in Arcadia, Central Phx, Tempe, Gilbert AND Scottsdale, so there is one bound to be close to you no matter where in the valley you live. :)

Everything has ALWAYS been great here. Unfortunately when we came tonight, we were blatantly accused of pouring liquor into Sprite glasses- even though we had two bottles of wine. I placed my WATER between my legs because it was so dang hot (in AZ!) and within moments the manager was here asking if I had pour something in the drink. Um, no? Furthermore, from that point on, our server completely neglected us. The manager came over to apologize, but after coming here weekly for over a year and spending hundreds, if not thousands here, it was a. Incredibly rude and accusatory way to PRESUME something so erroneously. Also, even when offered to try or smell the liquid, they refused, still adamant we were being devious. The manager then proceeded to tell us multiple servers say witnessed this, yet, no one has EVER mentioned it? Except this little manager for the first time? And not even ask, but to accuse? Dude, it was water. If you have such problems with us, why allow us to come back? Why serve us every time and serve us WINE, yet you come at us in an accusatory manner? Completely RUDE, unprofessional, disrespectful, and inflammatory. We even sent the drink back and asked him to taste/smell it, but no, they wouldn't. And yet they still hold the accusatory tone. Search our purses and our persons! We have nothing to hide. That was an extremely terrible way to leave an establishment after being a loyal customer for nearly two years. Our bill is consistently $100+  and yet they still come at us with disrespectful accusations and false assumptions. 


We won't be coming back. 


-Update* I received a call from the regional manager, Brad, in relation to my above experience at Postino's. Initially, I was hopeful that someone of management took notice and concern of the incident. Brad apologized for my experience and stated he would investigate the complaint and get back with me. I received a follow-up call today from him and he communicated that at this time, they were going to leave everything "as-is" and supports the management actions last Friday. 
Pathetic. Negative word of mouth carries a lot of weight, and please know that no one from my group will be praising Postino's. Furthermore, this post alone as already prompted numerous users to message me and inquire about this incident. Please know that while this business may not care how it treats loyal customers of two years, potential patrons will be steered away. 

So as Brad put it, yes, we will "leave as is," and not be returning to this establishment.

The cucumber lemonade should get 5 stars on their own. I love lemonade and I love cucumbers. Amazingness in my mouth! 
We had come for breakfast and now there wasn't much on their breakfast menu it's more of a place to come for obviously wine and bruschetta which is fine but good god I love the cucumber lemonade so much more than any other lemonade I've tried elsewhere next to hot dog on a stick(I know definitely now what you expected me to say right? Lol) anyhow i have yet to try the rest of the stuff here so we will add more next time we go!
First time here and let me say this place is AWESOME! great food, great atmosphere, seriously in love! Everyone in Gilbert needs to give this place a shot.
The bruschetta is amazingggg! Havent had any like it before! Great service too . Go on a Mon or Tuesday after 8pm. They have bruschetta and excellent wine for 20 bucks! Great deal.

I love Postino's east!  Summer is hot but Postino found a way to keep us cool with optional indoor/outdoor seating. I love having shady areas to eat outside in the summer. When I heard they were offering yoga on Sunday's I was ecstatic! Who doesn't love yoga, wine and Sunday brunch with friends!?  The best part is the value $5 all day wine!!!   Alex did an awesome job serving our large group. Thank you Alex!

So if you want to be a shot caller big baller you take your  friends here. Because those of us who hail from big cities... The LA's the San Francisco's, Chicago and east coasters know that this place consistently has great food, engaging polite staff and a wine list that can compete with a  bistro in Napa Valley. We winos who appreciate a good glass of wine with the food fixin's to go with, now have a place to go. Because where the heck do you go to impress your out of town friends in Gilbert. It's Postinos!

I knew I would like this place when they were hiring they had a huge sign threat said, "HIRING RAD PEOPLE!" This place is full of awesome culture and amazing food.  A very hip and cool place to eat.  The food is fresh and delicious! Love the beat salad and the bruschetta.  Im eating a soup right now that is phenomenal.

Amazing! Our oldest son has eaten here before. He took us here with our two younger children to try something new for a change. We were definitely not disappointed. Servers were on point! Great job Madison and  co-workers. The food we ordered was AMAZING!!!!! We had the Mix and Match for our 7yr old little boy, 2 of the Nine Irons for our oldest son and his 17yr old sister, I had the Prosciutto with Brie and Fig jelly and my husband had a roast beef sandwich. We recommend to everyone that when you want to try something new and delicious, this is the place to go! Love Love Love and most definitely will be back again!
I really enjoyed the food here today! I have been here before & it was just as good. I have found my favorites so I'll be back to order them. try the passion tea its darn good!

So, my best friend and I went here at 5:45 on a Friday night and had to wait an hour for a table. And I get it, it's Friday night, so we were mostly okay with that. Once we finally got a table, we ordered the bruschetta boards and tried about six of the options between us. Our favorites were the prosciutto, fig, and mascarpone; the artichoke spread; and the burrata, bacon, and arugula one. But they were all quite good, it was a lot of food (no need for dessert), and the service was pretty fast. So, all-in-all, a good place for dinner. And the price seemed reasonable. 

But I can't give this place five stars for one reason: the music. It was terrible--the song selections were grating and jarring and the volume was much too loud. We could hardly hear each other or the waiter, and I left with a headache. And we're only in our thirties, so it's not like we hate music. But it was just lousy music and far too loud. In the brief, peaceful interludes between songs, when you could actually hear yourself think, I thought, what a pleasant restaurant experience. And then the music started again, and I thought, we should've gotten the food to go. Sigh. Advice for the restaurant: lose the techno and punk rock music. Some of us go out to dinner so we can enjoy people's conversation. Being able to hear it helps.

I never thought I would see the day that I would be giving Postinos anything but a 5-star review because I've been going to Postinos in arcadia/phx for years and have been going to the new Gilbert location for the last 8 months, but ....and let me scream so you can hear me....,

 "THE MUSIC IN GILBERT IS SOOOOO LOUD YOU CANNOT CARRY ON ANY KIND OF CONVERSATION!!!!!" 

There.  I feel better.  Two other couples at tables next to us screamed "Wow this is loud music" as well....  It is not like this at the other two locations.

Management at Gilbert.... turn it down a notch or two.   A wine bar should be classy, relaxing and have an atmosphere condusive for great conversation, and all of those are impossible with the extremely LOUD music!  I would probably have ordered another bottle of wine, but I literally could not wait to leave!

Also, for the very first time EVER, when I ordered the butcher block there were items on the block missing!!  WTH???!!!  

Other than those two things, everything was spectacular...food tasted amazing (after bringing the missing items), service, people friendly...but I want to be able to carry on a conversation!  

Thank you!

Great place to hang out on the patio and enjoy delicious food. We came here for date night on Monday and it was surprisingly busy but we got a table right away outside. The background music was the best (fun but not too loud). Our server was really sweet and gave us good recommendations. We loved the wine and the food we ordered. Had the board full of veggies which is AMAZING and not as boring as it sounds. Also, the bruschetta was sooo good. There was not one that I didn't like. Good place to come and relax especially with this perfect weather we have!!

We love this place and have for many years. We've been to the phoenix locations countless times and tempe as well. Across the board the food is consistently good. We always get the garden salad, which they sweetly split in the kitchen, & a bruschetta board. Throw in some wine for me & a beer for my husband & it's a nice night! It's good for date night or group lunch with the girls. Splurge on the sundae with salted caramel & corn nuts. You'll want to drink the caramel right out of the shot glass.

I've been to this place 4 times now and I still cant put my finger on why its just average. It could be the Very Average service we recieve, or the mediocre food I seem to gravitate to. 

Pro's: Great location, beautiful decor, tons of people watching. (my favorite) Happy hour menu is ok, however it stops at 6, so hopefully you get off work prior to 5pm because if not, you'll need to be double fisted to get your buzz. If you do arrive before 5pm the menu has tons of good options to drink and eat. The brunch menu on Sunday is nice also. 

Con's: Service always seems to be a little off. Not sure why but every server I've ever had has been MIA most of the time. Always looking for another refill of water, where's my drink alot and can we get the check since we've been sitting here with empty plates and glasses for the pass 30 minutes. 

In the end I always leave a little dissapointed and enter anxious that this time it will be different.

Tried this wine bar for the first time last night...here's the scoop:

Liked
- great design...very hip
- good selection of wines
- excellent, friendly service

Not so much
- food was good but not as interesting as other wine bars we frequent
- too many kids...I know it's Gilbert and clientele is beyond the bar's control, but I don't want to hang out with kids and babies during my happy hour at a bar...can't imagine why people would think its ok to take kids to a bar.

Their bruschetta is the best I've ever had. Awesome patio, great food and drinks, super inviting atmosphere & friendly staff. Have been coming here for years and will continue to do so! Oh and order their pretzel, caramel, ice cream dessert. It's amazing!

This is my favorite place to eat in all of Arizona. I don't live there anymore, but this is my go-to spot for catching up with my old high school friends. The ambiance is cool and relaxed. 
They have a deal on Mondays and Tuesdays at 8pm where you get a bruschetta board and a bottle of wine for $20. Normally, a bruschetta board alone is $20, so this is a great bargain!
Even when i don't come for this deal, I always get a bruschetta board where you get to choose 4 different types of their bruschetta which are cut into four slices each; great for sharing. My "must-haves" are the fig/prosciutto/mascarpone and brie/apple/fig spread. Other ones that I like include smoked salmon/pesto and roasted peppers with goat cheese. 
There is usually a wait, and they do not take reservations except for larger parties. So I suggest getting there early or putting your name in and having a walk around the lovely downtown Gilbert area. I find that the wait does not usually die down the later in the evening.

It's so nice to have a Postino closer to home.  

I'm not a "wine guy" but I still love Postino.  We had the pretzel board, Nine Iron Panini, bruchetta, cheese board, etc.  All excellent.  

Postino East was packed and rockin when we were there last week.  We saw lots of people we knew, how cool.

Experience was not my favorite. Been here once before and had a better experience.  We walked in and was sat down quickly. It was myself and my two girls.  They didn't offer or ask if we needed a kids menu and my daughter was very upset because we didn't know if they did.  The only reason we knew was because my little one went and saw one.   So we asked if we could have one. We ordered food and they came back to let us know they were out of GF bread. Ordered a drink and had to request it twice before it came and when it did we were done with our meals.  Place has great food just the visit was lack great service.

One thing that is great about this particular wine bar and restaurant is that it is consistent! The food is fresh, pretty and delicious! Service is great - you're never left waiting or wanting for anything, and the atmosphere is very inviting. Happy Hour wine prices are more than reasonable, and their wine selection is amazing. If you like fresh and delicious food in a friendly and comfortable atmosphere, you will love Postinos!
love the monday and tuesday night special but always spend more than planned but always so good, especially the salads.

Wonderful trays of food. Here's the deal, you  want to plan to share. Great group go to!  It is LOUD, so don't plan the DTR talk for this place. Quite a wait too. But fun different and great taste. Wine selection great as well as adventurous for some!
A great place for a girl's night out. Fantastic outdoor area.  Usually pretty crowded during peak times, so go early or for some day drinking. Nice wine selection, bruchettas, and salads.

Soo delicious and great service too. All their bruschetta is amazing especially the salmon with pesto. There's not a single visit that wasn't outstanding. Their waiters are very kind and attentive. Also, their prices are soo affordable it's amazing. I'm proud that Arizona has something to boast about when it comes to wine bars :)

Wine, wine, wine....cheers!  I couldn't wait to go here.  Our 1st visit unfortunately was a Saturday at 5ish so we just missed HH.  It was packed.  Luck would have it we did get a seat at the bar (party of 4)...BUT, it took quite awhile before we got served.  So bar seating we were not impressed.  We put our name down for a table and the wait was over an hour.  We finally got our table 1.5hrs later. When we finally got our table and order our bottle of wine and food.  The food and wine was great!  Just getting to this point was aggravating.....plus we already spent 75+ bucks before we got seated. 

I will go back, because I love, love, love the Arcadia location.  I hope it was an off night.

Food/wine = 5 stars
Service that night =2.5/3starts

We love this place, the food is always fabulous and the wine is absolutely the best especially when you have a waitress like McKenna, she is very knowledgeable in the wines and has always assisted us in the perfect wine selections. My favorite night is bottle and board night, they have the absolute best bruschetta!

We sat at a nice table by a heater but we were brought three separate orders that were not ours before we even got our drinks buy separate waitstaff so we decided to get up and go to a place who would actually bring us our order
Any bottle of wine and a board of cheese and meat for $20 on Monday and Tuesday nights.  Can't beat that! Great atmosphere, friendly attentive servers.  Get there early it fills up fast!!
Wasn't that great! Kicked us out for another party. Bruschetta as ok and wine overpriced. I would not recommend for any future diners.

It's been almost 2 years since my last review and I've been a frequent flyer here. I love it. I actually have overwhelming cravings for the bruschetta sometimes. 

They've added a bocce court in the back and everytime I've gone recently there has been live music. And Gilbert being Gilbert, I love how this business has adapted to the community. It's pretty family friendly - as long as your kids are well behaved like mine :p (the kids menu is spot on).

Customer service has had it's ups and downs here for me (except for Scott who usually works at the bar. He is amazing and is always super friendly and very knowledgable about the wines and beers), but the quality of the food and the wine and beer selection are always top notch.

I love it here. And keep coming back over and over, my diet be damned.

Went here for a Sunday brunch while visiting friends. 

Ample parking across the street. Weather was a pleasant 80F with a nice breeze.

We had a wait time of about 5 mins to get a table for 4. We sat down and started with a mimosa, Bellini, beer and cucumber honey lemonade between the 4 of us. We all agreed the lemonade was very refreshing and smooth.

I ordered the B.E.L.T (basically BLT sandwich with eggs) which came with a small cup of fruit and she got the farm scramble. Both are delicious and perfect sized - not too much, just perfect. We shared the French toast. The friends got the Nine Iron panini and his wife got the French toast. 

Definitely love the ambience which is a combination of casual, modernistic and hippy.

It is quite seldom that I love a place. This may be one of the few. Went there during lunch hour on Sunday. The weather was perfect (maybe this added to my dining enjoyment- who knows), so we sat outside in the patio area. This establishment has a nice outside seating area with fireplaces and also a area for dogs to go potty. 
I also like that (even though this is a winebar), it is very family and kid friendly. They even got a kid's menu and some waxy stuff to play with. 

Anyways, on to the food. The bruschettas are a much here. If you com here and don't even try the Bruschetta planks, then don't even bother coming again. You are committing a crime. And don't be fooled by the portions of these. One person will definitely get full off of one order and it is plenty to share. Also got the rasberry chicken salad which was phenomenal. I'm not much of a wino, but seriously, this place rocks for the food!

I had brunch here with a few friends. The service was a bit slow but we were there at a really busy time. The food was good, the atmosphere was great and the prices were reasonable. We all had a great time!

5 Stars for the $20 bottle and bruschetta deal. It really doesn't get any better than that. However, my favorite meals here are lunch and the weekend brunch. The soups and sandwiches are delicious and the farm scramble is tasty. Great alternative for the two restaurants across the streets. Oh, and the mimosas aren't bad either.

The bruschetta is awesome. $12 for 4 different types. It was very filling we didn't have any room for our sandwiches. Will sit outside when the weather gets cooler. We went for lunch and it has a very nice atmosphere. Great place.
Just had a GREAT ladies night at this location! Nathan took great care of us. Sweet, attentive, and great advice on wine. Of course we'll be back for more, thanks!

Terrible service, very slow. Waited almost an hour to be served once seated. Food was not worth the price. Roast Beef sandwich had two slices of meat, bread which was Focca, fell apart. Expensive for a sandwich. Would never go back. Limited menu. We went out to eat after we left.

One of my favorite restaurants in downtown Gilbert simply because their bruschetta board is to die for. There are about 12 different options to choose from and I've tried every single one and have not once been disappointed. The service is great but the wine choices are more expensive ($10-15/glass). I also wasn't a huge fan of the cheese board but any of their desserts will make up for it. The service is always very friendly. Great place for a girls night out!
Came out here for a girls night and had a fantastic time. they have great seating inside or out. The bruschetta board was excellent and the wine selection was great!

Why can't this be within walking distance from my house? Awesome specials, food, staff, vibe, everything! A great spot to hold a conversation, with good company. 

Made it in time for the daily special, $5 wine by the glass. I was able to indulge in a $12 glass, multiple times without concern of massive bill. - I don't usually drink on the week night, but if I ever have a rough Monday, I'll be here. $20 for bruschetta, and a bottle, on Mondays and Tuesdays.

The food was just wonderful. A girlfriend, and I split the Butchers Block and a bruschetta board. For our bruschetta choices, we went with: Fresh Mozzarella with Tomato & Basil, Smoked Salmon with Pesto, Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato, and Salami with Pesto. All were great, but we agreed that Smoked Salmon with Pesto was our favorite. 10/10 recommend it. I honestly cannot complain about the food at all. Everything was perfect!

There is a portion of the staff who is dedicated to topping off drinks, so your water glass will never hit empty. Our waitress was wonderful, and was very informative in selecting the right wine, for our taste. About halfway through our visit, our waitress was relieved by a waiter who was equally delightful, and considerate enough to do "last call" for the wine special.

The Restaurant has a very earthy/fresh vibe. Nothing felt generic. It's a place you can dress up or down for, and you will fit right in. 

There were a couple minor things that I felt could've improved my visit. One being, it was very warm in the restaurant. There are a lot of windows, and people walking in and out. I felt like I was sweating the entire time. The ladies, who we befriended, at the table beside us agreed. Maybe crank the AC a little lower. 
The other is that there's a bunch of stuff on the tables, for such small tables. Hadn't we been sharing, I don't think I would have noticed; but, the food here is meant to be shared, so it's awkward having to dodge and weave through wine glasses and salt shakers for a bite.

All in all, I will definitely be back soon! It's only been three days, and I'm craving some bruschetta! I want to try them all!

Great food but the service can be a little spotty, especially when the restaurant is busy. The bruschetta board is the best thing to order, as well as the butchers block, an appetizer w various meats and cheeses.

My girls and I come here for happy hour all of the time.  I love the variety in bruchetta and in wine.  We've  been for brunch and the French toast with a mimosa starts the day off right. The staff is friendly and consistent. Never have a bad time at postinos.

I just LOVE having this place in downtown Gilbert! After seeing a show at Hale, it is great to have a place to get a nosh and a nice glass of wine...none of the other places stay open that late! I LOVE their artichoke dip and Hummus plate and their bruschetta is excellent also. Service can be a little slow sometimes....I don't think they always have enough servers in the later hours. But every server I have had has been pleasant and accomodating.

Very cute, trendy place with great service and tasty food. Portions are on the smaller side and prices a bit high, but that seems pretty typical in downtown Gilbert. Menu options were unique, beautifully presented and delicious. A great place to go with girlfriends.  Although I don't drink wine, they appeared to have a very nice selection.

I am taking away some stars from my first review.... the food here is still fabulous... but the service is lacking.   I have been here 5-6 times since they have opened and for some reason the last time the service was not that great.   The music was also WAY TOO LOUD!   We asked if it could be turned down just one notch and the response " ha! I can ask, but i seriously doubt it".   My profession is ears and hearing... this place was way too loud to enjoy a conversation and our order was even messed up because the server most likely could not hear due to the loudness!  Yikes!    When all the doors and windows are closed due to the summer heat--- TURN DOWN THE MUSIC  let people enjoy each other.    
The food is great... but I fear this business is getting the "people love us so we don't have to care attitude".     

I am done with Postino East for a while....

Congratulations on opening the Gilbert location. Glad to see you guys making the shift to the far East Valley. As to be expected, the bruschetta was great. We really enjoyed the Syrah and the Sangiovese. It's really hard to beat the $5 glass/pitcher deal before 5pm, and the board + bottle ($20) on Monday and Tuesday night make for the perfect date night, though it can prove to create a long wait.

It was nice to see staff from the other locations making the move out here. Small mishaps and things that get confused in the midst of opening a new restaurant are bound to happen. No worries though, we've been 5 times in the first 10 days, showing that you guys are right on target. Looking forward to getting to know the staff and becoming weekly regulars.

After hearing so much about Postion's I gave it a try and thoroughly enjoyed my experience.  The outside dining experience was one of the best with a fire in a fireplace, comfortable seating, expertly placed heat lamps and attentive service.  The wines were enjoyable and the food above average.

Light menu, especially if you don't drink haha. We had a bruschetta board (pick 4). It was so yummy! Full of flavor and good combinations. We tried the salami and pesto, apple and fig (my sweet favorite), mozzarella and tomato, and warm artichoke (my savory favorite).
This place is great on Tuesday nite 4 bruschetta and a bottle of wine for $20!! Awesome food!!!

At first I was hoping for a more robust and complete menu for dinner. After sharing a grilled cheese sandwich, chicken and mozzarella sandwich, bruchetta, a cup of their tomato and smoked Gouda soup, as well as their Chocolate Bouchon, we were good. Everything paired very well with their wine selection. The wife and I will be back!

So in love with this place. The food was to die for, as I can't get over their bruschetta options. Great presentation, and even better food combinations. The atmosphere is also nice, and the staff really knows their stuff. I ordered a wine I didn't love- and they had someone come out and find a wine that fit me best, and they didn't stop until I was pleased. Very cool place!

While I have absolutely no complaints about the food, this review is for the service received.

The first time I received disrespectful service when I went with my best friend, I spoke to the manager about it and let it go. Now that this has happened again, I'm letting fellow Yelpers know. 

I went in with my boyfriend on a Monday around 2pm, it was not busy, yet there was no one there to greet us nor sit us down at a table. After standing there and seeing the other servers look at us, my boyfriend had to walk up to the bar and ask for help. It was only then that a guy came out from behind the bar to sit us down at a table. As he returned to the bar it took another few minutes before a girl came around to bring us two glasses of water and walk away. That was it, no greeting whatsoever! 

When we finally were able to order our food, the girl asked my boyfriend what kind of bread he wanted. As it was his first time there he didn't know what the options were and what the difference was between the breads. Instead of explaining it to him when he asked, the girl simply stared at him like he was stupid and asked again if he wanted chiabata or focaccia. So I had to explain it to him instead. TALK ABOUT BEING RUDE & DISRESPECTFUL! 

The rest of the time we were there, the only time we had any "help" from the servers was when they brought our food or refilled our water glasses. Not once did anyone say anything to us or ask if we needed anything. I wanted to ordered a drink but decided not to if they didn't even care to ask!

Note: I've never had an issue with the male staff/servers but the females are (excuse my language) b****es. They seriously need to hire female servers who are friendly and provide good customer service to EVERYONE!

Loved it. Came here on a date with my wife after some friends suggested it. We were a little bit limited by my wife's pregnancy on what we were dining on, but our server was very informative and accommodating. The salad, soup and of course bruschetta were divine. We will definitely be back

The bruschetta here is top notch, but I actually enjoyed Postino Central more, and the reason had more to do with the overall experience than the food. The one thing my husband and I really didn't enjoy about our trip to Postino East is that the restaurant itself is a little crammed, and where we were seated, we kept getting bumped into by servers and other guests going to the bathroom or the bar. It really kind of ruined the romantic vibe of the restaurant and made our date night feel a lot less intimate.

Cool patio and great bruschetta! Very tasty and great atmosphere. Come early for the $5 wine before 5pm to save some cash. Really enjoyed their patio and they even have some outdoor games. This area in Gilbert is booming and this location is a great addition to the culinary options available.

Everything is fantastic!! We love how all of the employees work as a team, they are all so helpful! Bruschetta is a MUST! The Butcher Block is also amazing! Who am I kidding everything they have is great, so fresh, delicious and obviously made to order!
Yay! so glad to have one of these in the east valley.  Great open air set up. Good specials and super yummy eats. The wait gets very long but its worth the wait.

Love this place! The service is wonderful, and the pricing is affordable.

The food has yet to disappoint, and I have been there  multiple times.  As mentioned in another review from someone else, the music is spot on for the customers, @ the time of day

This place is phenomenal! A quaint little spot that stays pretty busy. Prices are fair and the food is amazing!! I did a sandwich and salad duo and it was delicious. The service was great as well! A bit of a wait, but most definitely worth it. The atmosphere is wonderful :)
The bottle and board deal is perfect for a night out. The service is always very good here. No downside. Wait can get long sometimes so be strategic.

I love Postino's! It's a great place to hang with my girlfriends! My hubby won't go with me to eat there unless I beg him but I LOVE it. I love wine, I love bruschetta, I love all the food they have there. It's totally my thing. Definitely a fun place to eat!

I eat at Postino's for lunch occasionally and really enjoy it.  It definitely has a bit of counter culture flavor - a few tattoo's showing on staff and a wine bar in a heavily Morman area.  that said, the food is awesome.  The only criticism is the menu's a little short compared to a similar wine bar in Mesa.  The wine is very competitively priced and they have their wine by the glass "happy hour" which lasts all afternoon.  The staff is very professional - I haven't had a poor waiting experience.  Everyone chips in so water's always full and empty dishes quickly cleared away.
Love the ambience and the food is phenomenal. I've been twice and I'm already itching to return.

Good atmosphere and quite busy on a weds night. Immediately got a table upon arriving and server quickly arrived and took our drink order and brought us water. 
They seated us next to some sort of little station where they store plates and the water pitchers. All the traffic from the  wait staff was highly fking annoying. My girlfriend kept getting her chair bumped as people were going back and forth getting plates and water. Not a good spot for a table or the little water/plate island you had there. 
The other thing I just couldn't get over was the sort of douchey pretentious vibe this place had. I was a tad put off at how our server(clearly some older broad who had hit the wall many years ago) sounded so fking snooty when she told us they don't serve alcohol. Not cool Bitch.
Got the bruschetta which, newsflash people, is glorified toast. Not sure why all the reviews raved about it, perhaps many just don't know better and think fancy toast with thinly sliced salmon is something very unique for some of you. It was decent at best, I've paid $15 for actual food that was much much better and far less hyped. 
Only good thing was the atmosphere. Definitely won't be heading back anytime soon as I wasn't all that impressed. Good for the try hards out there but I was very very unimpressed.
Absolutely love this place. Food is delicious and service is always on point. Great place for celebrating, date night, or going out with the girls.

Phenomenal! Great experience today at Postino. I had been wanting to try the bruschetta here after hearing rave reviews from many of my friends and it did not disappoint. Met my sister and mom here for an antipasti lunch and everything was delicious. We were seated at a table in the middle of the restaurant. Water was served pretty much the moment we sat down which was great. Everyone working here seemed to be very happy and upbeat. We started off with one waitress who took our wine order and gave us some nice suggestions. I think she must have been transitioning shifts because another gentleman (presumably a manager) came out and took our food order. A few minutes later another waitress introduced herself and said she was taking over but even through all of that transition, wine was promptly served, food came out quickly and it all went smoothly. Waitress number three was with us the rest of the time and she was really nice and attentive.

For $14 you get a choice of four bruschetta's. We chose the apple and brie with fig, artichoke spread, fontina with bacon and tomato and salami with pesto. All were very good. The apple and brie with fig is very sweet so I liked saving that one for the end. We also order the soft pretzels with chorizo and white cheddar, it came out served with a variety of pickles, nuts and mustard and was delish! I am a girl who likes a combination of textures so this was very appealing. Everything was great. Atmosphere was relaxing for the lunch hour. Service was great. $5 wine from 11am-5pm. 

I spotted someone noshing on a salted caramel sundae before leaving and I felt quite sad that I did not indulge in one of those. It gives me an excuse to come back. I will be back!

Bruschetta was excellent! Very good wine selection. Nice atmosphere, and not so loud that you cannot hear your company. Waitstaff is attentive and well-versed in their product. Good music, my boyfriend and I had fun playing name the artisit. No complaints!
Although I had seen it as I wandered downtown I didn't think to go in. A friend told me it is a must. The food was perfect and so is the atmosphere. In fact I think I will head back today.

These guys are awesome! If you join their ePosse, you can you call the day before to make reservations even if they have too many reservations, they'll get you in.
Their food is amazing too!

CONSISTENCY. That's what I love most about Postino. Everything you order always has the same taste and freshness that you can count on. Their soup is never 'off' and their bruschetta (especially the gluten free) is always on point regardless of the combination. We always start with the olives, and they have so much diversity and flavor in the bowl. Perfect for snacking while enjoying your glass of wine. The kids meals all come with wikisticks for stimulating their little creative minds and encouraging fine motor skill development. Man! What more could I say about a place THIS thoughtful. Even their bathrooms are a place worth checking out. Lots of eclectic decor and the music is very hip. I shazzam a song at least once every time I dine here.

Over the years I went to this location many times, and I had never try there special Bruschetta & wine on Mondays and Tuesdays I decided to went on a Monday night. After 45min wait we finally got a table for 2, we order a bottle of sparkling to start and the bruschetta. None of the each pieces on the board were good as they were presented. They were all flavorless, and the salt and pepper on the table didn't help much. So we decide to order another round of wine and bruschetta and chose all different ones, and It wasn't better. The service is impersonal as usual, they are 10 servers who come to your table and you have no idea who's your server. The three stars are for the really good deal they propose ($20 a bottle of wine of your choice and bruschetta) and also for the good bread they have!

Great salads & paninis. Nice wine selection and reasonably priced. Not trying to be everything, just excellent, simple food and a great wine and beer selection. Only negative was the music was just a bit loud.

Great food and great service. Wish they had one on every block! Great specials $5 pitchers until 5pm Everyday! The bruschettas are the best in the area by far. This place is one of our favorites. It's hip and plenty of space for groups!
Simple but wonderful and Never disappoints! It's always busy (good sign) but service is always great.
Very nice place to hang out. Lots of choices of wines and beer. Food was also very good. Staff is very friendly

This place is so good! A little bit of a wait for a Friday evening was to be expected, you can enjoy a drink while you wait or walk down to the food truck court across from Barrio Queen and wander on Friday nights. They text you when your table is ready which is awesome! Prosciutto with Brie panini is to die for, great combo of salty and sweet. Our server was great and attentive, he made an effort to engage in conversation and was very helpful with questions about the menu. The wine I selected was a little bitter, maybe just a bad bottle? I can't wait to go back!

First time here and it was truly a great experience that made us want to come back for more! Busy Saturday night, told about 45 min wait. We were seated in 20 mins. Big plus there. Madison was our server and she was great and helpful with menu selection and spirits. Had the Bruschetta board with Warm Artichoke spread, Apple Fig and Brea, Burrata Bacon & Roasted Pepper. All were great and unique in flavor. Got to split between 2 people. Then we had a Roast Beef panini w/ side salad which was very good. For spirits we had Huss Orange Blossom and the Tangerine IPA. Both very good and different from each other as well. We will definitely be back!!!

Love this place! It's the perfect place to grab a glass of wine (or 2!) and share their delicious bruschetta plates with your girlfriends. They have an afternoon happy hour (who doesn't like that?!) and even though I have only tried their bruschettas, all of the different options are so good it's hard to choose! The staff is always very friendly and service is speedy, even when they are super busy. This place would also be a cute date night spot : )

My favorite restaurant in downtown Gilbert. The food is amazing and they serve great wine from all over the country. I love the outdoor patio area, especially at night with all the lights it creates a very Mediterranean feeling.

What I love the most about Postino is the ambiance and decoration, they have a lovely patio. I haven't tried a lot on their menu, however the Butcher's Block is very nice, meat and cheeses for $14.50 is quite a nice deal. Their French Grenache was very good, it went well with the board. Overall, I will be back, either for a date or just with friends.

Since when did a wine place become a kids place. Went with the lady on a sunday at about 10:45. By noon we were surrounded by moms with 2-3 kids all over the place. One even had a bunch of baby food with her, Tacky!!!! Other then that, place is great. Had the butcher block. Def be back. Hopefully this time its not "bring your kid day" at the wine bar.

I really like wine. That said, I was pretty happy that Postino came to Gilbert, and I had another wine bar to frequent. They are almost always on a wait so get there early! The bruchetta boards are delicious- I have yet to try a variety that I don't like. I also came for breakfast once, and that food was good too.

The only downside of Postino for me is the service. It's definitely hit or miss. For instance, on my last visit, my girlfriends and I waited over an hour and 20 minutes for our food. The server who took our order was oblivious to our problem, even after we told her we were still waiting (after 45 minutes). She was either too busy with other tables or just didn't care. I'm confident that if there hadn't been a shift change during our wait, we never would have gotten food. While we were still waiting for our meal, the second server asked us if we would be ordering dessert, and once we told her what was going on, she immediately took care of it. She put our order in again- who knows what happened the first time around- and we had food in 10 minutes. We didn't ask for anything to be comped, but she did it anyway. She was apologetic and gracious, and we appreciated her taking initiative and responsibility for something that was definitely not her fault. Her service turned around our experience. I just wish I had caught her name to ask for her section next time.

I do not understand the high reviews for this place or why it is so popular in the evenings. It might be OK for lunch, but they don't have any dinner food. They just have sandwiches and appetizers. I had to wait 45 minutes for a table on a Thursday night and then it cost me $35 for one glass of wine and some bruschetta. Some of the bruschetta was pretty good, but after I was done, I felt like I still needed to go somewhere to get some real dinner.

I really love their happy hour, which is available 7 days a week until 5pm.  The ambiance is great and the staff is excellent.  I come here reguarly and enjoy the outdoors seating, good wine and food.
Food is always excellent, great service, have visited many times - always a great experience. Comfortable seating, welcoming environment, really a fantastic place to enjoy some food, drink and relax.

Postino is at the top of my spots to day drink list.  Open to 5pm you get $5 pitchers of beer and glasses of wine so if that's not reason enough to go, you're hopeless.  The food is always good and this location is very open and bright.  It's a perfect place for a crowd, a couple or even a solo diner.

The other  Phoenix locations are wonderful; this one not as good. Tried it a 2nd time - it's the servers - arrogant both times & acting too busy to be pleasant .  Food is as good as the other locations. Twenty-year olds love this place!

It's was good. Adam was our server...has a great look that matches the restaurant. Cool vibe. It was windy, but made the temperature perfect. Food was good and fun. Server recommended food was great. We'll be back!

We finally had Brunch at Postino's East and it was amazing! We shard the Farmhouse Scramble and the French Toast. 

The scramble was perfectly cooked - the potatoes flavorful and the gruyere was the perfect cheese. The side salad and tomatoes were the perfect accompaniment.

The french toast was by far the best restaurant french toast I've eaten in a LONG time. I make my own french toast that my husband and I both drool over - but Postino's has definitely mastered their french toast dish. The creme fresh with sliced almonds and the fresh fruit compote....need I say more?

I have no idea of the what/when/who of why the service was bashed here?  Just visited for first time and the service was great!  It's not an extensive menu, but it is not supposed to be, it's a wine bar.  With that being said the bruschetta's are amazing.  Thank you Bryan, our server, for the wonderful service, great job and we will be back.

Thrilled Postino made it to Gilbert, but I prefer the vibe in Arcadia, where they've really managed to capture the spirit of a European wine bar--you know, without kids running all over the place. The "family friendly" atmosphere in Gilbert fits well with the community, but for me it's a bit of a turn-off. Most of the parents are trying to socialize with friends and aren't paying attention to their little ones anyway. Can't we have some grown-up restaurants in Gilbert, too?

The food is predictably solid (though the smoked salmon at brunch could use more smoke--and more salmon) and the wine is consistently delightful, but it's the service, staff, and culture that Craig DeMarco and his team have created that keeps us coming back. Kids or no kids.

Oh, when you go... order the salted caramel sundae.

I love this place, their wine is delicious and the fact that while you wait for your party you can get a glass is even better.  Other best thing are their boards and their brochette!  Love the fig and prociutto but honestly haven't had any bad ones yet.

I am a HUGE fan of Postino East! The food gets five stars. It is fresh, tastes amazing, and there is a good variety of sandwiches, soup, and salads. I eat here once a week. The service gets four stars. The wait staff is very pleasant but is usually slow. They do a team approach and I often think they assume the other has taken care of you, when in fact no one has been over at all. Overall this place rocks and I will continue to be a regular. This is my go to place for a delicious lunch.

Very disappointing experience... we get here at 5pm... party of 3... and you refuse to seat us because there are going to be 2 large parties later!?!?! There were 5 open tables, this is completely unacceptable!!!

As a member of the ePosse, I went to Postino East for the free bruschetta that came as a gift for joining the ePosse and getting their newsletter. I have to agree with the Yelpers of days gone by that the food is terrific. We net for lunch yesterday (Friday) and the place was very busy. A public parking area is behind the restaurant so parking is plentiful. We sat at the bar, that was open to the outside and it was a beautiful sunny day.
