We ordered two wines from the $5 menu that is offered from 11am-5pm. They were light fruity, Chardonnays that worked well with a light lunch. We got the olive appetizer to start and shared the bruschetta. The service was good at the bar. The food was excellent. We did sit by the service end of the bar by the kitchen so it was a bit noisy but that is expected with a lot of wait staff talking to the kitchen staff about upcoming orders. The next time we will look for a seat on the other side of the bar. They have plenty of outdoor areas and a large indoor seating area.
The food was good, the wait was not too bad.  I ordered some freschetta it was tasty.  The ambiance was nice and it seemed like the happening place to go.

Awesome serivce every time! The food is good too:)
I love their Monday Tuesday specials!

The advantage of being in a small and picturesque  downtown area definitely helps.
The ambience and the service is great.
They have ample wine and beer options and I always appreciate the smaller beer glasses($3),which give more opportunities to try more.

The brushettas were fresh and appetizing and turkey panini tasted great!
Love the new no wait app also. We live 5 mins away and now I can check in and don't have to do the long wait.

Oh Postino. My only complaint is that I live in another state and won't be able to come back soon. Great atmosphere (nice but not stuffy) great prices and ridiculously good pub board appetizers! Service was lovely as well. Our server picked one of our bruschetta options since they all sounded yums and he picked a good one with the salmon. Other options were brie and apple, pepper jam and goat cheese and buratta, bacon and arugula. All worth stuffing your face!

Came here for a Sunday brunch with my wife and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The service was spot on! It was a pretty chilly morning and our server basically dropped everything to make sure we were comfortable at our outside table by placing a heater next to us. Now that's what I call customer service!

I ordered the country toast and my wife ordered the salmon. While the portions may appear to be not that large for a brunch meal, they were definitely filling enough. I also highly recommend the mimosas, which are better than many I've tried elsewhere.

Finally, the music choice: superb! Did not expect to hear 90s gangsta rap with my brunch but absolutely loved it! ;D

Needless to say this won't be the last time we visit Postino!

Just had the best breakfast!!! So delicious and fresh. It wasn't just your run of the mill eggs and toast. Very flavourful and I'm definitely coming back. Bob was my adorable server and Sam my hostess...both gave me Awesomeness service. Thank you Postinos!!

I am a business traveler monthly to the Phoenix area and like to explore new restaurants if not too tired. I missed having my husband with me for this gem. Comfortable, casual but upscale. Nice selection of wines by the glass. Perfect if you want to sample a variety of flavors for a meal but not too heavy. I chose a garden salad and half order of bruschetta.  I did the fig & apple and sweet & spicy pepper jam which was excellent. I will be more adventurous next time.  The background music was enjoyable. Inside and patio seating. Definitely worth another visit. Parking was easy, especially compared to Tempe the night before.
Service: Amazing. Food: Amazing. Overall experience: Amazing. We came here for wine and nosh and loved it. First time here too. Our server McKinnley was very helpful.

My wife and I have been making the trek to Arcadia for years now and have always said "if they ever put a Postino in Gilbert, it would be game over."  Diary read - it's happened!  The place has always been known for great wine selection, unbeatable bruschetta, and friendly service, and the new Gilbert location definitely doesn't disappoint.  They have a friendly response to every question and a recommendation for every taste; they simply don't care if you're a wine expert or a first time visitor, they are just happy you're there.

It's so nice to have a chic place like this in downtown Gilbert.  As we drove through on Friday night, the downtown area was bustling with couples and families alike.  Milling around between the "Big 3" of Liberty Market, Joe's BBQ, and Postino, and there was a sense of buzz and community - it was very exciting to see.  

A few recommendations:

1. Don't be afraid of the "Tomato Jam" Bruschetta.  It's delicious and, while it sounds strange, is arguably their best board.
2. Every day (yes, even on the weekends) between 11am and 5pm they offer $5 glasses of wine and pitchers of beer.  We're not talking cheap wine and Bud Light either.  ANY glass of wine and beer is up for grabs, so spoil yourself a little bit!
3. If it's just two of you, take a seat at the bar and strike up a conversation with the bartenders and the fellow wine-goers.  We've done this at each location and have found ourselves enjoying our time better than just getting tucked away by ourselves.
4. The Salted Caramel Sundae is the best dessert in town.  Period.

Have fun and make a night of it - you'll be glad you did!

I had lunch here with an out of town friend who had just arrived for a visit. It was past the normal lunch hour, but the place was packed! We were able to find two seats at the bar, so enjoyed some Chardonnay while waiting for an outside table. The $20 per bottle wine was an excellent deal and the wine was good! We were seated at an outside table before long. We had a tough time deciding what to order, but settled on The Butcher Block and The Bounty. It was a lot of food, but the two choices provided the perfect combination! I would definitely choose the same items again. The service was great, the food was excellent, and the outdoor seating was cozy and comfortable. I have another out of town guest coming soon, and guess where we will be going for lunch? Postino East, of course!

Well, it's Postino. Great wine selections, excellent nosh options (must try the ricotta, dates, pistachio bruschetta), and a fun atmosphere. This is a locally owned "chain" and is the newest spot in downtown Gilbert. It's always busy, with a good crowd. The folks who manage the place have great taste in music as the "playlist" is always filled with juicy hipster indie hits.

Postina is a fun place for friends to gather, enjoy some drinks, and take in a great hip atmosphere. It's affordable (especially during happy hour), and a great way to try new wines or beers. It's also a good date night spot.

The parking is pretty awful. Be prepared to walk some, especially on weekends and happy hour. Postina East is situated in a hot spot of downtown Gilbert favorites- Liberty Market, Oreganos, etc. It's quite the popular area and the lack of parking proves it.

Food was good and wine was good!

We were told it would be a 15 minute wait..that turned into 25 minutes. The host kept us updated which I appreciated. {I'm a server, so I can totally understand when people just chat at their tables an hour AFTER being payed out.}

I wish they had more servers on the floor.

It took 10 minutes until we were greeted. We got our wine right away. Then we waited another 15 minutes until he took our order. I noticed that they have food AND wine runners, so i'm not too sure how they are so busy..

When we were finished eating, I wanted to order dessert. We were sitting there probably another 15 minutes before the host asked to get us a box for our food (obviously he needed our table). I had to give HIM my dessert order because I didn't know when my server would be back, and I felt bad for taking up their table for so long.

tl;dr The service could be quicker..Food/wine was good though and a good price.
We were not impressed .... Long long wait for different things on bread . Hosts might need more training .

So my boyfriend & I went to Postino's East yesterday & it was just as good as all the reviews state, maybe even better. 
We went for dinner & had a 30 minute wait, but we just took that as time to walk around & get to know downtown Gilbert. We got our table right on time. When we were seated we were promptly given water & time to look over the menu. 
Our server was AMAZING! I feel like a jerk because I don't recall his name, but he was very attentive, personable, & helpful. 
My boyfriend & I both got the select two deal, half a sandwich & soup or salad. I got the Prosciutto with Brie with Mixed Greens while he got the Turkey with the soup of the moment (a red pepper tomato soup). We were both happily impressed. My sandwich was the perfect combination of sweet and salty & my salad was a great balance of bitter greens, sweet dressing, & salty cheese. 
I also had the Cucumber Honey Lemonade. I just wanted to try it really bad! It was definitely interesting. Sweet from the honey, salty & sour from the lemonade..the cucumber was refreshing, but also reminded me of pickles. Still not sure how I feel about it haha. 
Lastly, we had the Salted Caramel Sundae for dessert & it was just as it sounds. Yummy. Came with pretzel sticks & nuts. 
Altogether we had a great experience & will definitely be going back.
Finally made it for brunch. Was not disappointed. I had the French toast. Went on a sunny, beautiful Saturday morning. The sliding glass doors were all open. Great food, service, and experience.

LOVE Postino's I love that they have a pitcher special everyday, and on Mondays their bruchetta and wine for 20 is unbeatable. Specially for a girls dinner night. food is awesome! atmosphere AWESOME! needs to be bigger tho its always so crowded!
Great food, service & ambiance!!! I forgot we were in Gilbert... Best bruschetta, bellinis & red pepper & Gouda soup. Our waitress was so helpful. Will be back soon!!!

Super popular wine bar in the heart of Gilbert.  Great wine selections and the bruschetta is to die for.   Be prepared for a wait for a table though.... popular they are!   Monday night special was bottle of wine and bruschetta board for $20.  Definitely a great deal!

The service at Postino  is AMAzIng!!! The food and wine are equally good! We ordered the raspberry chicken salad and the butcher board. If was perfect. The ambiance of the patio is so great. There is nothing better than good company, good food, great service and perfect ambiance! I definitely recommend this place!

This was my first time to Postino after many months of wanting to try it and let me say my family and I were not disappointed. We started off ordering wine from Morgan who we thought was awesome but ended up having to transfer once our table was ready. The wine was amazing as well as the atmosphere and we all loved our food, we will definitely be back. That being said our server Felix was terrible. It was busy when we first arrived, and as a server I understand it takes time to go around to all your tables, but he came by maybe four times while we were there. He had no personality and never tried to make any small talk or connect with us at all. After our food was brought out he came around once to see if we needed anything but didn't refill the empty soda on our table until we asked and we didn't see him again until we were ready to leave. Lindsay ended up bringing the refill back and she is the reason I am giving five stars because next time we come we are requesting her. She was very friendly and helpful, continued to refilled our drinks, checked on us more than Felix, pre-bussed our table and even took and paid out our tab. I look forward to trying something new next time with her as my server.

Had a girl's night out early dinner here. Ordered the bruschetta board with the warm artichoke, prosciutto/fig, apple/Brie, and date/pistachio selection.

Nothing memorable about any of them. The restaurant itself was nice, and would make for a good date.

Such a great way to spend date night with my husband! The waiter recommended the Riesling wine because we asked for a wine on the sweeter side and this wine was amazing! Their assortment of bruschetta is always a good and light food to have paired with wine. Love the concept of this place and definitely love the atmosphere!

Postino East is on of my favorite places to go for lunch. Great staff, great food and outstanding wine list. We used to have to drive to Arcadia until they opened the one out here. Happy Hours are great too!
Love their brunch here, French toast is the best, but absolutely the worst coffee, they could do better by getting it from circle k.  Service is top notch 5 stars if they ever fix the coffee..
Fun atmosphere, great customer service and delicious food. Go with the bruschetta all the way!

Love their Happy hour deals on Monday and Tuesday! 
Can be pricey but worth it.
Atmosphere is cozy in the evening.

This is one of my favorite places. They have the BEST bruschetta (especially the tomato jam one). They also have an awesome happy hour which includes $5 pitchers of beer, and they have a great selection. The staff is great, everyone is always friendly and service is always prompt. The atmosphere is very comfortable and my husband and I go there on a regular basis.
The green apple and smoked salmon bruschetta was amazing and the mozzarella and cheese panini was great!
Great food, great atmosphere. Always a great experience! I love the butcher block appetizer and the bruschetta has so many different varieties, its hard to go wrong.

Service attention varies and sometimes feels rushed. Host also takes orders. Apps and main course arrive together. This annoys me. It is loud. At bar, wine was not poured, it was given to me to pour myself. On another day, it was poured. All this aside....food gets 5 stars. Menu is delicious. The green salad and bruschetta perfect concert of flavors. Have eaten them three days in a row.

Went there for lunch with wifey and our good friends on a Saturday.  Beat the lunch crowd so that was awesome.  This place was already packed but was able to sit right down at a table.  Nice atmosphere with a hip wait staff.  Looks like a kid friendly place as blankets and pillows were laid out and kids running around on the grassy area in the back.  My wife and my buddy ordered the Smoked Salmon, his wife ordered the Raspberry Chicken salad, and I ordered the Bruschetta (Fresh Mozzarella with Tomato & Basil, Smoked Salmon with Pesto, Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese, Salami with Pesto).  According to my wife the Salmon was very good and my buddies plate was clean so that says it all.  The salad looked good but she didn't finish it but really, if you order a salad, you are not trying to finish everything on your plate.  As for me, I liked all my selections for the Bruschetta.  The Mozzarella with Tomato & Basil and the Salami with Pesto was good but my favorite was the Smoked Salmon with Pesto.  Oh, I also had the regular Lemonade.  One of the best I have ever tasted.  My buddy got the Cucumber Honey Lemonade and I don't know if he liked it that much.  I know for sure he didn't like that refills were not free for his drink.  The ladies had the White Peach Bellini and it was alright.  I will be going back for sure.  So much things I saw on other tables that I want to try.  Not a wine drinker but from what I saw they have a lot to offer with drink specials and numerous beers and other spirits.  Go there if you want a light meal that will not weigh you down and a fun time with your friends.
Love the wine/bruschetta nights! Great time to go out with the girls!! We love the staff here, they are both kind and knowledgeable. Highly recommend trying.

As Wine based eateries go, this one is very good. There is an excellant selection of wine. So many to choose from . There are some wonderful dishes to tempt your taste buds. I love the sandwiches and apps.
Honestly, the things that keeps me coming back is the Cucumber Lemonade. I always mention it to friends if the spot comes up for a recommendation.
I love it. I think it would be perfect with a shot of rum. My next request.
It can be hard to get it, but worth the effort.

Had a great post tattoo meal here with my sister. The guys serving at the bar were very attentive and had a great sense of humor which made our wait for food pass smoothly. The food was delicious. We both enjoyed splitting the bruchetta and loved the tomato jam. The noise level was a little intense but all in all a good trip out.

Visited postinos on a warm Saturday night with a few friends and it was packed. We waited a little for a table but you can order while waiting for a table too which is pretty cool. 
The food isn't too shabby. There's sandwiches and bruschetta. The latter was enjoyed by my friends. They mentioned that it was 'pretty good.' I had a sandwich was a reasonably sized and tasty. The wines they had were also flavorful. However I've gotta say that the drinks are pricey! 
Good atmosphere for a warm night but too $$$. I'd like to check it out again during their Monday and Tuesday specials for the $20 deal. That's a bit more reasonable.

Came here with my family for brunch on my birthday, we had a party of 13 and they were very accommodating ( they'll take reservations for parties of 8 or more with a 24 hour notice). The food was delicious, as were the peach Bellini's I had;-) We ordered off the brunch menu, and some bruschetta. Very pleasant, and positive experience!

Loved this place. I live really close and was disappointed in myself I hadn't gone yet. My wife and her girlfriends go frequently for the bottle of wine and platter deal they have there. The food is outstanding - fresh ingredients and tasteful. Staff can be a bit wine restaurant snooty but nonetheless they were on top of their game and we never waited (large group of 12). Look forward to going back frequently.

I've reviewed other Postino locations & I've always said I don't know how to make this review any different than others ones I've written because all there locations are consistently excellent. 

Everything about this location is fantastic as well from the food to the service. I really do love the area this one is located. It's right on the main stretch of Gilbert where there's a lot of options. There's a really patio here to dine at when the weather is nice. 

One thing I can add about this particular location is that it's the only one I ever had brunch at (I'm a bruschetta board & wine guy). It was a while ago, but I remember it being eggscellent.

Every experience at Postino is a great experience! The staff is AMAZING. Every person we've ever encountered has been wonderful. 

If you live in Chandler, Gilbert or Mesa, this is definitely the place to be! You can't beat Postino's happy hour or bruschetta. Go to their website and sign up for their email list. They are great about sending their customers incentives to dine at their restaurants.

This is one of my favorite places to eat when I crave for italian. The bruschetta boards here are amazing. The combination of brie and apple with fig spread, how delicious! Warm artichoke spread and Tomato Jam & Fresh Sheeps Milk Cheese are my favorites here. I love the ambiance of this place, they have couches and tables in the patio. I saw people lay their mats and had a picnic outside but not perfect for this 100' weather. I just want to go back and sink my teeth on those delicious bruschetta.

The atmosphere is very elegant. You are able to sit outside or inside. Outside has a bocce green which is actually pretty fun. The food was very different and the selection is very minimal. It was pretty delicious but since there is only a small selection of food some people may not be able to find something they like. This is a rare 4 star review when the food for one reason or another isn't up to my standard. The scenery was that stunning though so I couldn't give lower than 4 stars. Check the menu before you decide to come here to make sure there is something you like.

Good food  and the waitresses and hostess were great. We bought a bottle of champagne an were told we could cork the rest and take it with us. I guess the waitress was wrong and were not able, so we asked to just be charged for the glasses, but manger was such a jerk. Had a huge attitude and was rude. Super disappointed! I have always loved this place.

Didn't even get a chance to try their food. 

After walking for half an hour down Downtown Gilbert for my father's birthday, we decided to settle at Postino's. 

It was pretty busy and there was a group of two ladies in front of me. The workers didn't greet us and decided to help the two ladies but never came back. We sat there waiting for over 10 minutes and no one updated us to say there were no seats or anything, we were not spoken to even when the employees clearly saw us. We left after a while because of this unprofessional behavior. 

It then occurred to me that it could have been the fact that we were Asian? They decided to help the American ladies who were dressed "nicer" but our family wasn't even dressed inappropriately for the occasion, we were dressed in "going out to dinner" attire. *Not that what you wear should determine whether or not you eat.* I hope they know my mother worked as a waitress (my sister and I as well for a while) and knew the exact struggles of being one so our whole family usually tips very well. Too bad they will never see it from us!

Sucks to see no one decided to help us when we arrived and stayed around. I want to try this restaurant but definitely not this location. Never coming back!
Great meal as usual....Server supporter Kelsi was wonderful, and Lindsey was great !! A must visit !!!

Had the butchers block and two orders of the bruschetta with my wife for our anniversary and it was a bit more than we needed.  Everything was delicious, but we were most impressed by the apple with fig jam, the smoked salmon with pesto, and the BBAT.  The warm artichoke spread was recommended, but that was our least favorite.  Prosciutto with figs and mascarpone also gets a thumbs up.

My boyfriend suggested that him and I try this place after his coworkers said how "great" it was. Customer service is great, sandwich & salad were ok. The chicken and mozzarella sandwich is bland. But the bruschetta was very good. So we definitely will be back for just the bruschetta.

I really enjoyed eating here. We went on a Tuesday and it was packed. We were told they had a 45 minute wait.  We found a couch outside we were told we could sit at, so we went there. I ordered a nice pinot noir and we had a meat and cheese board to start.  The board had 4 meats, cheese, hummus, and plenty  of olives . 
Next we had bruschetta. I had a board that had Apple, brie and fig preserve,  one that had figs and marscapone, one smoked salmon and the last had bacon. I normally pass on bread, but this was worth it.

My first time at Postino's was for brunch with a friend. We both ordered the scrambled eggs with fresh fruit and shared some of the walnut toast with Brie cheese and jam, my oh my was it delicious! 

My second trip was for dinner with a group of girls, I wanted to try the bruschetta but we weren't all agreeable so we each ordered a 1/2 sandwich and salad combo. I ordered a chicken sandwich and it was pretty bland, the bread was super thick and on the almost too hard side and I had a hard time eating it, my mouth was all torn up.

 I think this place is great based on my first experience. I would like to go back for brunch and I will give the bruschetta a try for dinner if we go again. I would hope they add a few more items to their dinner menu.

So, recently Vegan (2 months) and One of the bartenders Scott took the time to suggest the most delicious Vegan bruschetta platter I have ever had! I mean, it was incredible! No doubt this will be our Sunday treat Spot. Great service great food. Thank you!!!

Now THIS is what a wine bar SHOULD be.  Stellar staff.  Excellent selection of wines (we opted for a delicious Albari√±o from Spain).  The food was tapas-sized offerings of very fresh and flavorful offerings.  Facility is super clean and well laid out with tables inside and out, plenty of room at the bar, and nice outdoor places for standing.  Atmosphere is relaxed and unrushed.  Esposa and I give Postino East two thumbs way, way up.
Great wine, food, and atmosphere!  Definitely worth checking out.  Especially if it is nice weather.

We only found this place by accident.  We needed to kill time and figured we might as well do it here.  The place was packed but we were seated in less than 5 minutes on the patio by the misters.  It was warm and we really loved the misters.

The menu was a little different for us and we weren't quite sure what to order.  Our waiter helped a bit with that.  He was great and kept checking back with us until our food arrived. The food was absolutely delicious too.  

So, why the 4 stars?  Well, the water glasses are really small and getting refills wasn't easy.  Trying to get the attention of the girl pouring water was also difficult.  We eventually got up and filled our empty glasses ourselves.   When we mentioned it to her, she just looked at us and walked off.

I've been here twice now and absolutely LOVE it. I don't even care that you have to wait an hour to get a table because the little outside waiting area has a server to bring you a glass or even bottle of wine! I love, love, love the bruschetta. It's so delicious. I moved to Gilbert so I am looking forward to going for happy hour soon. You will not be disappointed when you dine here!

I love this place especially in the fall and spring. It's a great meeting place and the service is friendly and quick. This place is busy on weekends and happy hour which of course means a long wait. I've gone at all times of day and the longest I've waited for a seat was 20 minutes during rush hour. They have yummy appetizers and for the meat and cheese lovers try the Butchers Block.

After visiting the location in Phoenix I couldn't wait to go back to the closer location in Gilbert. I am not sure if I just went on an off afternoon because they were closing early for their holiday party or if the service and food is always this way. We were greeted and sat as soon as we walked in, but our server took quite a long time to get our drink and food order. He seemed very frustrated and busy. We both ordered the bruschetta and it took almost 40 minutes for it to get out to us. The entire inside of the restaurant had cleared out at this point because they were closing early so they did not have a ton of food orders to fill. After we hurry and ate (so we didn't keep the staff long since they were getting ready for their party) i could tell a huge difference in the presentation and taste of the bruscetta from the Phoenix location. It didn't seem as fresh, tasted off and looked like it was thrown together quickly so the toppings were everywhere. It just wasn't right. Big let down! Neither my husband nor I finished our plates and we asked for the check. That took about another 20 minutes. On top of that I had to ask for water 10 times and they kept forgetting. I think throughout the entire visit I had 2 refills, so I kept drinking my husbands water. Good thing he likes to share! After paying the tab by another server we were getting ready to walk out and our server finally came back around and passed us without speaking to us and mumbled "this is fu*&ing bu%%$#it I hate this stupid place." We all have our bad days so I am not going to blame him for the service, at that point we confirmed he was having a bad day. I am more upset about the food quality then I am over our server having a rough day, we have all been there. I am hoping I just visited you guys on a bad day, but will probably drive down to phoenix to get my bruschetta fix.
This is one of my favorite restaurants in Gilbert.  Great place to hang out with friends to drink wine and eat cheese.  Love the bruschettas.  Great atmosphere.

this place! Service is sometimes a bit slow, but the nature of the concept is not a fast paced environment. They are always busy, but friendly and the food is so yummy!

P.s. $5 wine at lunch, can't beat that!
bruschetta is AMAZING! Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, smoked salmon, and Salami with pesto were my favorite. the chicken & mozzarella panini was great...

I wanted to write this review as a contrast to my previous review of Vino de Sonoma a couple of weeks ago where I was complaining that the cheese and charcuterie board was $45.
We went to Postino East for lunch and ordered their butcher's board. Way more food, great tastes and variety and $15!
Also got a glass of San Genevese wine that was excellent and only $5! Service was great too.
None of these prices and items were any kind of special. Those are the prices every day.

I miss living by here. Great food and Wine! Been here a handful of times and have never changed my 5 star review. Great service here for always being extremely crowded. The wine is delicious, so many choices. The food is so fresh and delicious. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu here. I would recommend this place for the food, service, wine and atmosphere.
We had a perfect evening here. The atmosphere, food, and wine were great. I will be coming back here again and bring more people with me.

Postino's is a favorite due to the atmosphere but the $20 wine and bruschetta board is the best deal around.  The only thing that you must do is get there before 8 p.m.  Even if you don't drink like someone in my party, you can enjoy anything from a salad, panini, soup and other munchie items!
Back again for lunch on Sunday. Great service and Great food is all I can say!

Went to Postino East on New Years eve with friend's for dinner. Overall, it's a pretty nice place and has a nice atmosphere. We were greeted immediately and seated outside by the fireplace. Very good wait service from the waiter. The food was good and presented very nicely. I had the tuna sandwich and chips and my wife had the turkey. The menu I felt was kind of limited, but did offer some interesting appetizers. My only complaint is that I thought the alcohol prices were kind of steep. My friend's wife had two half glasses of wine and for both it was $20. This restaurant fits nicely in the downtown Gilbert area which is becoming a go to place for a quick evening out.

Happy hour ends at 5pm???!!!!! Sad!

Wine and beer only.

Dog-friendly patio.

Wifi is DOWN!

Only two one-hole restrooms for a huge place. Prepare to wait!

Good service.

I planned a 50th birthday party for my wife at this location.  I needed catering and I was able to place an order with Catering Manager, Natalie with ease.  She advised me on portion size and with her help, I ordered just the right amount of food with minimal left overs.  I reserved a portion of the back yard area from 7 - 9 PM and we brought in home made desserts and party favors.  The on site staff provided a table and set up for us to decorate.  Our party ended up being about 27 and we stayed an extra hour with no issue.  Felix and the on site staff did a great job helping our party throughout the event.  The location and backyard area is charming and cool enough for a late September event.  I had to deal with many people within Postinos and came away impressed at every level.  They made it easy and the quality of food and service was excellent.  I really appreciated their effort and would recommend them unequivocally.
Lovely place in downtown old Gilbert. Nice menu and friendly staff. Wait times are low and indoor/outdoor options plenty. Main choices are Panini's, salads and bruschetta.

Postino is always a favorite for girls night! The mascato is my absolute favorite here, especially when it's $5. ;)

The gluten free bruschetta is to die for. In my opinion, way better than the regular bruschetta. The Brie/apple is a go to, and the seasonal fig jam is a must. Pesto and salmon too!

Great service and lovely food!

Delicious Bruschettas, Great Wine & Beers and amazing customer service. Everyone here is very nice and helpful. I love the building and the area out back of the restaurant. Although I mostly come here to have drinks after work, I have eaten here a few times. The Bruschettas are all good and you get to pick 4 different ones. I have also been here for brunch. Great coffee and the I got the Yogurt, fruit and granola. It was very good and it's perfect if you're looking for a light breakfast on the weekend. Two thumbs up.

Postino
Overpriced and way overrated. I feel a lot like the American female gymnast Mckayla Maroney at the 2012 Olympic games (not impressed).

My friend and I shared many glasses of wine and two orders of the bruschetta boards. We chose all but two of the toppings they offer so we were both able to have a sampling of mostly everything they offer.

The ingredients sound somewhat expensive and I expected them to be delicious, but sadly they are not of great quality.(Brie, goat cheese, burrata, mascarpone, fig spread, prosciutto, smoked salmon) If the quality of the meats and cheeses was better, the rating would be much higher. Most of the bruschetta lacked flavor. Even the wine at our servers suggestion, who was awesome by the way; was not good quality either for the prices.Off the top of my head, Olive & Ivy at the Scottsdale waterfront has MUCH more flavorful bruschetta and an incredible wine selection. 

They were packed, so the wait was around 40 minutes on a Monday evening. The ambiance was nice for the area. Maybe a little out of place in an older more family oriented, historic part of town. It was a lively, younger professional crowd. 

One thing this place has going for it is the ambiance. There is a nice light chatter in the background and the decor is decent. It would be a perfect date spot if the food was better. When it cools down here in AZ, the large bay doors at the Gilbert location will give this place even greater ambiance when they are opened.

*Mondays and Tuesdays they have bruschetta and a bottle of wine after 8pm. That sounds like a much better deal than when I ate there.

I absolutely LOVE this place! Postino is my favorite wine bar in the East Valley. 

The best nights to go are Monday and Tuesday nights to take advantage of their $20 house bottle of wine and board of bruschetta deal. The deal starts at 8pm but be prepared to wait about an hour for a table...it's definitely worth the wait! My favorite summer wine is the Biutiful Brut Rose which pairs well with the Brie & Apples with fig bruschetta. 

The atmosphere is so classy, the staff is knowledgeable about the wines and the patio is inviting! I will definitely be a regular here!

Ever since I moved to Gilbert 5 years ago, Postino has always been my favorite and go to place for happy hour drinks, food and atmosphere...and now YOGA!! All my favorite worlds in one place on Sundays!! Brilliant!!

Great spot in downtown Gilbert.  Had brunch here after the farmers market.  Great light eats.  They boast a huge variety of drinks, you will love it if you are into wine, tons of options and they typically have specials.  The outdoor seating was superb, by then it was March.  We will be back soon!

I would eat here everyday if I could. The bruschetta boards are fantastic. My favorite is the fig jam with Brie and apples. The atmosphere is really nice. It's upscale without being unapproachable. The service is consistent. Perfect for date night, girls night and all in between.

I just moved here from the San Francisco bay Area and have yet to find the unique eating places like there was at home... Ok I just found it.  Awesome.  I had the cheese plate and mother the meat plate.  Delicious.  They came out on wodden cutting boads and butcher blocks.  Staff was exceptional and I love when serve staff know their menu and can make suggestions.  Our waiter was awesome.  I want to try the Bruschetta next time. I just found my now go to place.

So this is my first time in Arizona and I'm visiting a friend and I have to say this is definitely a must hit spot! The bruschetta board is amazing definitely a must have! And the autostrada panini is amazing!
MgThe only bad thing about Postinos is that everyone knows about them so they ate always buay.  Brunch is amazing.  The wine selection is good and unique. Best place for bruschetta in the valley.
Absolutely Classy! Loved the wine food and outdoor sitting. Wonderful staff as well!

From bruschetta to paninis to wine, everything about Postino's is a good time! I have honestly never ordered anything here that I didn't like. They use the No Wait App and it's usually open for you to get in line before hand, so if you don't have that app, download it ASAP! It definitely comes in handy on Bottle and Board night (Monday & Tuesday after 8pm) and dinner rush.

After I left my first review of my first visit to Postino's I was highly disappointed but want to give an update. The management team of Postino's promptly responded to my negative review with humility and offered an apology with zero excuses. They also went out of their way and offered to have my husband and I back, if we accepted, on the house. I found that very professional because of the many fans they do have, my one negative review was not going to ruin their business, however, none of that seemed relevant to them and they wanted to make it right for all customers. My second visit was great, went with a girl-friend for some of their famous bruschetta, which we loved, and the service was great as well. I'm thankful for the management team of Postino's going out of their way to make it right for their customers, it shows what they really value most and how they want their business to be viewed as. I will definitely be back and appreciate the accommodations I've received from Postino's.
Great bruschettas. Love the tomato jam and their salads. On mon and Tuesday they have $20 bruschetta and wine which is a great deal. Only problem is that they are always busy

We rolled up an hour before closing after attending a concert and they took great care of us.  Couple of beers and some wine.  We ordered the Brushetta board.  We liked that we each got to order one of the options and they cut each one so we could taste test.  I ordered the salmon.  Son-in-law ordered the artichoke, Daughter ordered the jelly and we ordered the tomato and mozzarella as our last option.  Yummy. We sat on the patio.  It was a beautiful night but unfortunately the area they sat us in was super dark.  When you have to hold the tea candle next to the menu to order it is too dark....just sayin.

we love this place.  the food is good. the wait staff is really good. it is a nice place to relax or if you want a quick bite to eat before a play at hale theatre.  the $5 wine special is great before 5 pm. we go there specifically for that on a regular basis.
Love the setting and food. Just wish isn't wasn't so popular (good problem for the owners), because it's very difficult to get a table.

Had the most awesome meal at Postinos today. Of course their food is good always.
From the time we entered till we left, everything was perfect. The service was amazing. Everyone was so nice & kind & looked happy & cheerful. They were always with a smile. Did I Say, The food was the very best as always. 
I love Postinos & it is my favorite place to go to for special occasions. But I had a bad experience 5 months ago & didn't want to go back. Glad I gave them another chance. Today they made up for it all. Will definitely be back to this location again soon.
Attention to detail surprised me. My Husband dropped his fork & I told him to wipe it & use it without worrying the servers. But one of the girls saw it & walked up to him with a fork, before he could even ask for it. 
Bobby our server was so cheerful & made everything so good for us. Jeff & Justice was so nice & spoke to us & asked if everything went well. The service at this place is much, much better than any place I have been to in awhile.
Keep up the good work guys. Good luck. We will be back soon.
It was our Wedding Anniversary & Thank you for making our Day special.
I've been coming to this location since they opened. Before that I would drive to Scottsdale. Try the butcher's block and the different bruschettas split with someone.

I have only been here once and I still cannot stop thinking about how good the Bruschetta was. If you haven't tried the salmon please do! It was amazing. The service was awesome, really laid back place to be to talk over some good drinks and quick bites. I will definitely be going back.

BOMB DOT COM!!!! 

LOVE this place and the atmosphere. Be sure to try the bruschetta!

This is our favorite spot in Gilbert. Brunch, lunch, dinner, HH... Always have enjoyed the food, drinks, and service. 

Has a good (small, but varied) beer selection for a place that's predominantly a wine bar, and the bruschetta's are all amazing. Fig and Green Apple all the way!

This is my absolute favorite place to grab a glass of wine (Holly's way Chardonnay) and some bruschetta. The options are all fabulous. I also enjoy the salads and soup combos. Each day the soups can be different and every one is always so crafty and has top notch taste. Every time I'm in AZ visiting family this is on my MUST list.
There for the 1st time on a Monday evening.  Restaurant looks great and the food was terrific.  It's great to have a Postino location in the East Valley.

We just experienced a small issue with our food- but Justice - the manager on duty- went above and beyond to make it right with us! We enjoyed a lovely time outside with excellent service from Kristen! We love the atmosphere at Postinos and it's a perfect spot after attending a show next door ...Highly recommend

Can you ever go wrong with Postinos??? I've had the pleasure of going to several of their locations and alway enjoy it - especially among friends. 

The Gilbert location is great. There's a lot of places to visit in the area and Dierks Bentley Whisky Row is just across the way! So a great place to end the night!!

Head out on a $20 Bottle and Board night and enjoy among friends or on a date! Have been here several times and really enjoyed it. Pick along four of their many bruschetta boards and enjoy a bottle of wine along side it. We've enjoyed dinner here too and all but the food is great. 

The place is trendy and the staff has always been friendly at all the locations I've been too. It's often, hip and the patio is nice. 

I've had the extreme pleasure to meet Lauren, one of the owners and found she is a fantastic person. Our meeting was brief but really enjoyed the meal we had and taking about her business and background. I remember she told me to find your I can't wait for Monday job, which she definitely has done with this place. 

Love Postinos and everything about it. All the locations are in trendy areas with modern settings. It's perfect for a night out with the friends or a date night with your significant other. You can't go wrong with be $20 bottle and board nights!
I love this place! Everything I've had here is good. The staff is friendly and attentive. The only problem is that there is usually a wait, no matter when you go. But, it is totally worth the wait.
Hip and happening has come to Gilbert. Great wine and interesting dishes. Nice place to hang out on a week night - packed on Friday and Saturday though

Service was ok. Not perfect. Our server Adam was fantastic. Lots of different people coming and going from our table. Not too long of a wait. Sat at the bar and had Bella Postino appetizer!! Yummy:) the half sandwich and salad was the best deal for $10
OMG the bruschetta is to die for the wine is amazing. Ambience is wonderful a absolute must for a girlfriend lunch out. We definitely will be back.

Postino is always great.  The central location catered my wedding three years ago, the 44th Street location is always a good time, so when I moved to the east valley, I of course had to check out "Postino East."

The bruschetta board is ever-raising in price... but that's okay because I get a meal for two out of it - regardless of the cost.  :)

I really would just like to say there is a GORGEOUS bartender there so all you single ladies... get in line at the bar and tip him well.  (Don't know his name, when he works, or a damn thing about him.  He has a beard.)

Service was great from our waiter (time 1) and waitress (time 2) as always.

Looking forward to more brunches with friends and continuing the Postino tradition.

I have to say I've always been a huge postinos fan but this last experience really ruined it for me. Our server McKenna seemed like she really didn't know our table existed, which is strange because we had a big group. We waited forever just to order drinks, even longer to get them which none were brought by her so it was a game of guess who when other people came to the table as they all arrived one at a time.

It took asking THREE people and for a manger if we could order our food for her to finally come over and ask if we were ready, because sitting blankly for over 20 minutes wasn't obvious enough. Upon finishing our food on tiny couch tables our plates sat stacked up and again after a long period of time she then shows up with checks. We were Not only not offered dessert which was really annoying considering we were there for a birthday but once she brought our checks she left the table one at a time to run them, Again with the horrible service. She finally asked if we wanted a birthday dessert but after hitting the 2 hour mark half our party had left.

Very disappointing when we could have chose any restaurant in the area and maybe gotten decent service.

Great spot for drinks and noshing...

Now if the other people in front of me in line would just go away....

I am a big fan of their bruschetta, very unique that they put ingredients other than the boring old tomatoes on top.  They have a lot of different wines and craft beers.  There is also a really good happy hour which is good for celebrations with a group.  It gets pretty crowded at dinner time.  The sandwiches are huge in portion and salads are very tasty.  It was the first place my boyfriend took me to when I was visiting in AZ so I guess it also has some sentimental value.  The atmosphere is really romantic and really good for date night, the noise level is moderate so you don't have to shout across the table trying to talk to each other.  The breakfast food is not too bad either, pretty healthy balanced breakfast.  I just love the decor and feel of the place.  There are huge garage like doors that open up to the outside patio.  The staff are also very attentive and nice.  

What to order:
Bruschetta - my favorites include brie and apple, warm creamy artichoke, prosciutto and figs
Paninis - roast beef

Love the Pub Board cheese and charcuterie board. The MJ soft pretzel with mustard is amazing as well as all the accoutrements. I have had the Butcher's Block as well, but prefer the Pub Board for the pretzel, something about it....Just as amazing are the bruschetta boards where you choose your own 4 flavors.

I don't drink so I cannot comment on the alcoholic beverages but I have never felt out of place dining here without drinking wine or beer.

The wait can be very long here, even if you are eating at the bar. This is not a large restaurant so seating is limited. If you are a new transplant to the Phoenix area, make Postino's one of the restaurants you must try.

Not only was the service impeccable and the atmosphere ideal, but the food was beyond amazing.

I arrived there with three others, and we were immediately greeted by one of their many amazing servers. We wanted a patio table since it was so nice out, but were told we would have to wait until one was available...which was perfectly fine. We were then asked for our drink order, and were served some amazing $5 glasses of wine (for happy hour) right away. We were quite impressed, because everyone was so willing to help us while we were waiting on our table. We were probably asked from 4 different servers if they could get us anything.

We were then seated on the patio, and ordered several orders of bruschetta, which is the best I've ever had. The four of us shared two orders, and were beyond stuffed, yet felt compelled to order the hummus and artichoke dips. To die for as well.

All in all, it was a great experience, and even though I am not a Phoenix area native, I will be back for more. Bravo.

I never am in the Gilbert area but met my son for lunch at his work. He wanted to go to downtown Gilbert and we ended up at Postino. I'm always game for Postino's. It's all about their Bruschetta board. 

We found parking about a block away which was very convenient. Walk in and this place is so airy and open. Love the ambiance very bright. We got a table by the bookshelves and the bar. Very loud. 

We ordered the Bruschetta board with Brie & Apple, Warm Artichoke spread, Smoked Salmon, & Ricotta with Dates and Pistachios. They are all good but my favorite is the Brie and Apple. Second fav was the Ricotta with dates & Pistachios. Loved the sweetness of the dates with the crunchiness of the Pistachios. Only problem is the kitchen was slow and brought out Bruschetta board after our meal. 

For my lunch I ordered the half and half. Got the prosciutto with Brie sandwich and a Brussel sprout salad. Loved the prosciutto sandwich. Really good. I just loved it. The Brussel Sprouts Salad is just so good. I really love Brussel Sprouts and this salad really hit the spot. 

The service was really good. Our server greeted us right away and got us our drinks. He kept on filling our water cups which was really good. He checked on us and even apologize a couple of time to us because the Bruschetta board came after of lunch. He basically said he put the Bruschetta order in first but the kitchen was behind today. It really didn't matter to us as long as our board came. 

I tell you what. Postino's kept its reputation. Good food. Great Bruschetta board. Fresh and delicious. Really good service and do understand the kitchen getting swamped. Everyone wants a board. It's what they're know for. Plus a great ambiance with that open air feeling. Loud but a fun place. Little different vibe than the Tempe one but just as good. 

Enjoy we sure did.

It was just two of us for a nice quite lunch and that's just what we got. 

Service was friendly and very helpful. Several different people stopped by to help decide on what to get, refill drink and bring out food. Loved that they all seemed to work as a team and care about all the tables. 

We ordered a pitcher of beer ($5 if before 5pm and will fill about 2.5 glasses) and bruschetta. Beer was the Four Peaks SunBru Kolsch Style Ale, which was recommended to us by the waitress. Nice light flavor on a hot summer day.

Today we got the Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, which was amazing. Little salty, little sweet with a nice bread to hold it. The Smoked Salmon with Pesto, which was our favorite. Had some capers on the top with a really light cream inside that I'm not totally sure what it was. The fish was fresh and just a great couple bites. Next was the Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomato. I'd never had burrata before but it was so creamy. A perfect match with the acidity of the tomato, salt of the bacon and freshness of the arugula. Very nice combination. Last was Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese. I'm a big goat cheese fan and roasted red peppers. Nothing that's out of this world but still a great combo. 

I think this would be a great place to go if you've got a business meeting or just want to have a quiet meal out. For two people it was $20 and in my book, that's a great deal for some really good food and drink.

I have been to Postinos quiet a few times and I have to say I'm kind of sick of it. The rude staff, the food that always gives me a tummy ache and the annoying 45 minute wait every time even when I see tables. 

My best friend and I went last night and both of us woke up this morning with upset stomachs.

I just don't think I'll be back- I don't get the appeal anymore. Even though I know I'm clearly in the minority.

After hearing good things about this place for years my wife and I finally decided to try Postino's. We went on a Monday evening just after happy hour, and were seated quickly.  

We were asked almost immediately if we were ready to order, but having never been to the restaurant before it took us a while to decide on what we wanted. I have to say, the service bordered on overly-attentive; they seemed to be working as a team, because every few minutes a different young lady came around checking in on us --and sometimes asking the exact same question as the waitperson before her. If they are going to be using this style of service they could communicate with each other better, so diner's aren't left feeling like they are characters in Groundhog's Day.

On to the food -- we ordered: 1 half roast beef panini, 1 Italian picnic salad, and of course, bruschetta.  My wife enjoyed her salad once she was managed to pick out the beets, there was just too many of them. She thought the bruschetta, through beautifully presented, was just not crispy enough. We tried the following four types: Fresh Mozzarella with Tomato & Basil, Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomatoes, Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese, & Salami with Pesto.  My fav was the classic Fresh Mozzarella with Tomato & Basil.  My wife's was the Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese, but we weren't fighting over who got the last slice of any of them. 

They seem to have an awesome happy hour special (Monday & Tuesday nights), $20 for a bottle of wine (though, I am uncertain of their selection for this deal) and a bruschetta platter.  The platter by itself is $13 so that's a good deal.  

I can see why this is a popular 'girls night out' option, and it does seem to be targeted towards a younger crowd (like us), which is refreshing in a family-focused town like Gilbert. We'll be back with wine loving friends but Postino's won't be brought in to our line up of regular dinner options.

This is only of our favorite places to go to enjoy a few bruschetta boards, glasses of wine and pitchers of beer. The service is always great and we haven't had a bad dish yet. The best time to go is around 2 p.m. on the weekends, after the lunch rush and before $5 happy hour ends. The outdoor space is great for bringing our dog with us, which is also a huge plus for places we dine. The only down side to Postino is how loud the inside of the restaurant is. It's really hard to have a conversation inside.
Great place for wine and delicious food. The bruschetta is a must have every time I go. Want to have a nice dinner with a cool ambiance go to this place.

"Meh" is a very good word to describe my experience with Postino East. The wait time we were given was 20 minutes - which turned into 50 minutes. We were given really awkward seating - a couch that was shared with a couple (it could have been detached, I'm not sure why they insisted on pushing everything together). 

There were flies EVERYWHERE. Hang bags of water above doorways - flies won't go under anywhere they can sense water above them. Or let them crawl all over the food, as Postino seems to prefer.

The food was okay. It was very affordable though. The waitstaff is also very nice and polite, and despite the busyness of the morning, prompt.

I'm not sure why they chose to have way more outdoor seating than indoor seating in a city that's unbearably hot for a good part of the year. Seems like a waste of space to me.

Overall I'd like to visit for dinner or lunch. The food is affordable and well-made, but their handling of crowds can definitely be improved.

Great ambiance. Great food and wine selection. Good choice of seasonal options. It is a tavern so the selection is a bit limited to the bruchetta. The WiFi is spot on and free. I would recommend a sweet Spanish Azul or a dry monastrell. For something in the middle the Pecina. The smoked salmon has to be the best bruchetta. I would like to try the sandwich or soups next time. Over all a great place to meet people. There were plenty of couples or first timers here that made the atmosphere slighty different. This is a down-town Gilbert must to try. Second attempt, I'll add the music is between contemporary synth-pop and 80's which I actually enjoyed greatly. 

My only complaint was that the changing lights on the street can be distracting. I also dislike patios that drench you in misters. But I understand that is a Arizona thing.
Great service and great food. It is a place that you can just relax and enjoy the ambiance of the restaurant.  This is some place worth visiting if you have not already.

Postino postino postino. A top contender for my favorite spot in Gilbert. We came here for Sunday Funday (3/30) An awesome time. Killer Bruschetta. Killer Paninis. And killer wine and beer specials. Sunshine. Great live music! A perfect day. Kayla was our girl and she was awesome. She had excellent recommendations for us. We will most definitely be back because of her. 
Do not let her go!

I came here last night for the first time and fell in love!!  Waited a little over an hour for a table but it was so worth it.  I love bruschetta in the first place but Postinos took the word bruschetta to a whole new level!!  I ordered the platter where you could pick 4 different kinds of bruschetta and chose the white bean and tomato, tomato mozzarella and basil, goat cheese and red pepper, and prosciutto fig and mascarpone.  All four of them were to die for!! I also ordered the nine iron panini with chips and it was the most delicious panini I have ever ordered from a restaurant!! I cannot recommend this restaurant enough!! I will definitely return for more :)

Prosciutto with brie on focaccia, a glass of Riesling, with the Foo Fighters playing on the speakers overhead.  


Happy.

Always first class!  The red pepper and goat cheese bruschetta,  fresh chicken salad, pesto turkey panini, artichoke appetizer and the BEST dessert wine Moscato.  Always great food and service.  The atmosphere is perfect for a date night or girls night out.  I brought my baby last night and he was messy and fussy, yet the staff took great care.

Came in here on a random Wednesday afternoon, I am a huge fan of Joyride next door so I checked this place out. The ambiance is great, the staff was friendly to begin with but seemed as if they lost interest once myself and my friend decided against alcohol this particular meal. After we told them we were just having water, the frequency at which our table was visited slowed considerably. We were ordering a few different appetizers and some sandwiches and overall I just wasn't impressed really. The I had a chipotle chicken sandwich on focaccia, and the it was a bit hard. Just overall I didn't have a good experience here. I will be sticking to Joyride.

This is going to be my first Postino Visit not counting Windsor or Churn. I rarely get into Gilbert for work but this downtown area has some good stuff all around like Joe's BBQ, Liberty Market, The Farmhouse Restaurant. Everyone here was pretty cool.

I had the vegetarian white bean hummus with cucumbers, yellow heirloom tomatoes, olives, greens, tomatoes with an artichoke secret sauce.$10. Loved the meal. HH in this wine bar of course brings $5 glasses of vino. I ordered a California Pinot Noir. 

I rarely sit on the patio but this place has a beautiful outside area and open air seating. I absolutely love the towering Gilbert Water Tank, giving up a great rural feeling. Good bye, city life. Something else here is the large grassy area. Plug some fast growing mesquite trees and the yard will be all that.

I am going to have to give the Central Ave Postino's a try, in the old Katz's Deli building and reminisce over the $2. egg plates.

I was skeptical given I pretty much hate food like this, laden with veggies, but we were invited by some good friends, so I played the part of the good sport. Fortunately, our table had the good sense to order nearly everything on the menu and share. It was everyone's first time at the table so it gave everyone a chance to try a little bit of everything.

We started with the Bella Postino. If I'm being honest, I thought the bread was a little disappointing in terms of quality as well as quantity. We had to ask for more in order to finish the dips. The table did not finish the hummus which I took as a sign that everyone thought it was as boring as I did. While I did not try the artichoke dip, it was easily polished off, a clear thumbs up from the table. I normally go for artichoke dip, but this one was extremely chunky. Seemed more like giants pieces of artichoke and nothing like a dip for me. I prefer a nice smooth creamy/cheesy dip with occasional chunks.

Next we blitzed the menu. We ordered all but 3 of the bruschetta's (left off the seasonal, ricotta with dates & pistachios, and white bean with chopped tomato). We ordered the soup of the day (red pepper gouda), and we ordered a few panini's. I had the Nine Iron, but on the recommendation of our server, swapped the dijonnaise for the spicy sun-dried tomato mayo from the chicken & mozzarella panini. Good call by the server because the mayo MADE the panini. It was excellent. Not too spicy, just a mild kick that really gave the panini a flavor worth coming back for more bites when you had a table full of bruschetta. The other panini ordered at the table was the turkey which also had great reviews from the table. Everyone enjoyed the red pepper gouda soup. Hell, I hate red peppers, but the soup was awesome. I could have had a giant bowl of the soup and some soft warm bread and been completely happy with my visit. Here is a list of favorite bruschetta's at our table in no particular order:

-Brie & apples with fig spread
-Tomato jam & fresh sheeps milk cheese
-Burrata, bacon, arugula & tomato
-Roasted red peppers with goat cheese
-Salami & pest

That said, the first one was so sweet, it could have been ordered as a dessert. Seriously. We mentioned that to the server and she told us that some people do order it as a dessert.

Now, I almost never order dessert at a restaurant because I generally feel like I'll get a better dessert at a place that only makes sweets like an ice cream shop or a bakery. However, we ordered 3 of the 4 desserts on their menu. Everything but the affogato. The creme brulee was good, but really lacked the fresh fruit that I think makes a brulee great. The chocolate bouchon was a fancy name for lava cake. I'm not big on these lava cakes in general and this one didn't exceed my expectations. Extreme chocolate flavor, but nothing special here to make it stand out over any other lava cake. The salted caramel sundae was the star of the show. Easily the table favorite. The caramel was amazing. The chocolate covered corn nuts were a sweet & salty stroke of genius and they were subsequently rationed to ensure fair distribution at the table. A few of us agreed that we could see ourselves coming back just to order dessert in the future. I only wished I had a Gene Simmons tongue so I could have licked the sundae completely clean along with the shot glass of salted caramel.

Overall, this place was very good. It had something for everyone at our table. It even pleased my picky palate.

This is only of my favorte places to go in gilbert. really yummy food and a great staff! There is not one bad kind of the bruschetta! My favorite is the prosciutto and fig. mmmmmm so good. They have a great happy hour but it ends at 5 :( but you get mini pitchers (probably 2.5 pints) for 5 dollars and they have a great beer selection. The tomato and moz app is amazing! The only fall back is there is no reservations unless you are in a large party and there is usually a pretty long wait (30 minutes) on the weekend. But if you can handle a little waiting time you will love it.

Amazing bruschetta and "Butcher's block," which is basically Postino's version of a charcuterie board.  Very well done and ample portions, as well as the wine selection which was just enough to make me feel like somewhat of an enthusiast, but not too much so as to intimidate the casual drinker. Very cool place, although they could use a bit more extensive menu as well as turn up the lights just a LITTLE.  We will be back.

One of my fav place to go with my girlfriends! I used to drive to the one in Phoenix as well but of obviously it made more sense to the one that's closer to me! Love all the Bruschetta options, the wine and even their desserts! The staffs are great and love the place itself!!! My girlfriends and I always have a great time!!!
Mon&Tues special keeps us coming back all the time. Bruschetta and a bottle of wine for $20....you can't beat that! I've never been disappointed with the food and service here.

A break from Southwest tradition, Postinos offers an excellent menu full of wonderful salads, sandwiches, and a great wine menu.  If you arrive before five, you get a deal on the drinks, if not you belong with the outdoor dining area under the stars.

This place is great! This place is always busy, but not in a bad way. Its a buzzing, positive vibe and everyone seems to be really enjoying themselves. Oddly enough out of the 5-10 times I have been here I have not once been inside!! I always sit on the patio, which is really comfortable. The food is AMAZING and the drinks are awesome too. I love the happy hour deals and I love how nice the servers are. I have never had a bad experience here. I could eat here every day and never get tired of it.

My favorite restaurant hands down. I go here two to three times a month, for their Monday Tuesday deal. The bruschetta is incredible, at first I was weary of the pairings but I have never been disappointed. I came here on a first date with a very picky eater, now we have been dating for 6 months and it's our go to place since we both love it. The Moscato is perfect, and I always make my boyfriend drive so I can guzzle it down. My only qualm is the fact that servers are not assigned sections, so there has been a time or two and I have been forgotten for over 20 minutes while they attended to someone else, thinking I had already been helped. Overall the atmosphere, staff, food, and wine all make this a wonderful experience. I highly recommend for anyone and everyone. Even my mom loves it, and she is the least adventurous eater ever. Plus they have gluten free options for her!

Ahh...Postino. This place is perfect if you're looking for a light dinner and a glass of wine. I've been here on several occasions and always seem to have the bruschetta...but who doesn't? Great place for a date or girls night. If you live in Gilbert, Mesa, or Chandler, Postino is definitely a place to be.

Overall, head to Postino for the perfect glass of wine and bruschetta.

While Postino is not my favorite food place, their customer service is outstanding. Two friends and I arrived at 4:15 on a Friday night requesting an inside table. The hostess quoted a 30 minute wait. After about 40 minutes, the manager, Justice, approached us apologizing that it was taking longer. He told us he would comp some bruschetta for us. We ended up waiting another 30 minutes and he also covered a bottle of wine for us. While the wait was a bit long, they more than made up for the wait and I will return.

We liked this place.  We went Sunday Morning after church and although busy they seated us quickly and service was friendly and prompt.  Food quality was above average and costs were as expected. Atmosphere was fund and friendly.  Recommend

I love Postino's.  I am slightly biased because my husband proposed to me here, but the reason he did so was because we went on our first real date to Postino's (Arcadia) and had such a wonderful time.  You really can't beat the bottle and board specials.  And their bruschetta is still the best- other wine bars in the valley just can't compete with it! The tomato jam is amazing!  Only downside is it's always paaacked with people and often a long wait.  Very good service- water always full!

We didn't want to stand around and wait like they told us we would have to today which is a Saturday night. So I called ahead and they wouldn't take our reservation. What they want is for you to have drinks and spend more money waiting for your table. I told him no thank you and make sure you tell the boss that we don't really like being manipulated.

I love the wine & bruschetta deal Monday and Tuesday nights. I'm a huge fan of the bruschetta and I think the deal is perfect for one person (haha...but seriously, it's enough food to be satisfying). I adore the goat cheese & red pepper bruschetta, and the pistachio bruschetta is fabulous. I find plenty of yummy vegetarian options easily.

The pitcher of beer for $5 is only about 2.25 pints, so don't get too excited. It's still obviously a good price for good craft draft beers.

This is exactly what Gilbert needs! Love this place. Love everything about it: location, service, food, vibe. It is really cute and has comfortable seating outside and inside. There is a grass area where you can bring a blanket and eat your food there. There is always a wait, but they take such great care of you. They brought us out some tasty olives while we sat around and sipped on bellinis. The bruschetta is amazing. Then I had the roast beef sandwich and Italian salad, which blew my mind. Sitting on a comfy cough, sippin on some beverages, and biting into some crispy bread loaded with salmon, figs, pesto, and sun dried tomatoes. Close to heaven as you can get on Earth.

This place is perfection! The relaxed atmosphere, casual but hip ambiance and delicious food are all just a few reasons to love this location. The staff is always pleasant and entertaining as well, I can't wait to go back.

We got in early on a Monday evening and got seated right away on the patio. Weather was perfect. We had a nice waitress,  Katelyn that was pleasant and attentive. The Bruschetta appetizers were very good as well as our pizza's. My husband had the Quattro Stagioni and I had the Ortolana. We will definitely return to try out some other menu items.

Absolutely love the ambiance and bruschetta!! I came here for a surprise bday dinner with my classmates. My friends recommended eating prior since its a little on the pricier side. I ordered the four of the following bruschetta:

Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone
Smoked Salmon with Pesto
Tomato Jam & Fresh Sheeps Milk Cheese (**FAVE**)
Salami with Pesto

I'm starting a healthier lifestyle by trying to eat organic, more veges, and foods with anti-oxidants. Today was a cheat day and I will have to remind myself that this is a great place to come back to! There were about 20 of us and we sat in nice comfy chairs outside. Waiter was really friendly -- great service! I love the ambiance and its a great place to walk around downtown Gilbert afterwards!

My group of 12 celebrated my birthday at Postino's in downtown gilbert yesterday.  We had an amazing time.  I chose Postino's for my birthday celebration because it has an incredible vibe, great wine and the wait staff is always friendly and excellent.   We ordered some food yesterday which was also amazing.   We had some bruschetta on cucumber and beef steak tomatoes (instead of on bread.) So good.   Highly recommended Postino's...my favorite place!

I LOVE this place. I think it's a great place to meet up with friends and family. The open concept is just the right touch for this type of restaurant. The only down side is that I think the location is to small for the type of success they are having
My favorite part about going there is taste the wine and beer they have on tap and the season bruschetta.
The attention is A+ 
The perfect place for a first date

The hostess is why I'll never come here again. 

The food is good, but we waited two hours.. Granted it was busy because of their board and bottle deal and we were a big party of 7. The app did not properly predict when a table would be ready. And they sat us at a table really meant for 6, which wouldn't have bother me if weren't for party of 5 waiting for their check at a table meant for 8.

Mistakes happen, but I'm writing this review because the hostess tried to play dumb (rather poorly too). She didn't acknowledge her error- when we brought it to her attention. Gladly our waiter and the manager did and gave us A VERY SMALL  discount. 

Warning to future customers: it's  better to wait in the front than in the back at that space, they call the yard. Where the hostess can't see you and is able to give your table away easily.

I love LOVE lOvE Postinos! Its such a great spot to go for any occasion with or without kids.  I like the setup of the restaurant being half indoors and half out but its really a great seat no matter where you sit or no matter the weather.  The food is absolutely delicious and I cant get enough of the cucumber lemonade. I just melt!
One of my fav places in Gilbert. Great food,  good atmosphere and awesome patio. The best is their bruschetta boards!! They also have great brunch on Sat & Sun. Definitely a place worth checking out.

I give it for because they have an amazing wine selection! But they need to work on their portions it's bad when you order pricy food and then go home and cook... It's good food just more for presentation not dining. The wait is pretty long most of the time it's just expected for this place.

Friendly service (except for the hostesses who were snooty).  This is definitely the place for people who want to feel "in" and trendy for no reason at all.  This is not a place you bring a big appetite to.
I just love their food and atmosphere. Hipster, great music and service. One of my favorite go-to places in town.

Thank You!!! Thank You !! 
A beautiful wine cafe finally here in Gilbert.  The space has beautifully contemporary design and the food and wine are fantastic.  If you are anywhere remotely close to Gilbert, It is a must see!!   They have an eclectic wine list and have great bruschetta boards with an array of different bruschettas to chose from, they also serve gourmet sandwiches.  Monday and Tuesday they have a special when you purchase a bottle you receive a free Bruschetta board GRATIS!!!!  Really!!!  
 Nestled in the Old Town (downtown) part of Gilbert, there is a lot going on here with great local owned shops and restaurants!!  Just across the street on Saturdays they have the Gilbert Farmers Market.   So shop around and pop in for a little vino!!!  Spread the Word!!! Postinos in Gilbert!!  Yes!!! It is True!!!

Excellent excellent service!!!   5 star it's not enough for this place, great wines, food was amazing, really nice cozy place. We had such a fantastic time there. Highly recommend this place.  Thanks for the excellent service. Especial thanks to our waitress James!!
I have never liked traditional cold bruscetta but the boards here are AMAZING!! So much so that's Its my all time favorite place. I'm happy living in this desert w Postino's ten min away.

A new resident to Gilbert...particularly across the street from Postino's.  I walk by the spot everyday, and have watched the transformation for the last half year.
Finally, finally got to spend Easter Lunch there with some friends.  Completely worth the wait.
We were seated quickly and the staff pampered us.  They even allowed my little 2 pound dog to join in the festivities.
We chose all of our servers suggestions and he was spot on.
I look forward to growing my relationship with this place.
Would not change a single thing...oh, and btw, the music is perfect and fun.

Brought the family here for Mother's Day and won't make that mistake again.  Our waitress took our order and disappeared for an hour, I had to go chase someone down to find out where our food was. It's now been over an hour and a half and we're still sitting here with no food. Huge disappointment.

The variety of bruschetta was excellent! I also enjoyed the fact that they had some local beers on tap. However, the PRICES... do not align with the quality or quantity of the food and drinks. Our tab consisted of: 1 Bruschetta, 2 beers and 2 glasses of wine. This came out to almost $60 with tip.

I love Postinos and have been a fan for many years and visited all of the locations throughout the valley.  I love the food as much as the vibe was thrilled when they moved into Downtown Gilbert.  They have been supportive and involved in our community and I wanted to thank them for supporting Gilbert Leadership, our Town and providing us an incredible lunch last week. Cheers Gilbert!

After apx. 43 visits to Postino East, I believe I have a handle on their menu and wine list, but... I sure wish there was an app for the Poblano Corn Soup! Its to die for, can I get a bucket of that to go?

We went last night about an hour before closing and enjoyed our night a lot. We ordered several different types of bruschetta and each one was delicious! We were seated outside by a heater and our waiter was so patient with our requests to turn up the heater, turn down the heater, and eventually move us inside. Great food, great atmosphere, great service.
OMGoodness simply beautiful atmosphere. Food is delicious wine selection is great and staff is friendly

The food here is really good.  Service is great.  Love the atmosphere. Dog friendly on the patio. The ONLY reason this gets 4 stars is that when you eat inside, the music is really loud.   We asked the server to turn it down  a little.  She came back and said the manager would not turn down the music as he wanted "to attract a certain demographic", i.e. a younger crowd.  It was Sunday brunch.  Most all of the customers were over 40. We all had to yell across the table to hear each other.  When the people on either side of us heard us asking them to turn down the music, they thanked us. As we were finishing our meal, the table next to us said they would not be back and that there are too many places for breakfast nearby that would appreciate their service and would be quieter.  Apparently his tactics are not working.  I will eat there in the winter when I don't have to eat inside.  The manager's attitude was very arrogant.  He did not even bother to come over to the table to talk to us.  The server was great.  She also said she often gets complaints on the music but there was nothing she could do.  Not her fault.

This is one of our favorite restaurants. However, we just celebrated my birthday there and were very disappointed with the service. We had reserved an indoor space because of a medical issue I have and were assured we would be inside. Instead, they gave our table to someone else and we were seated outside in 100 degree temps. We asked twice for a pitcher of water for the table since it was so hot and we were constantly needing refills. Both times we were told no problem, yet the pitchers were never brought. We asked one more time and were told they weren't allowed to leave pitchers at the table. So they can leave a pitcher of beer, but not a pitcher of water? Did I mention 100 degree temp? It took awhile before anyone took our drink order. Then another while before anyone took our food order. We had a hard time flagging down our server, even when one of the people in our party had an allergic reaction (heads up: their pesto contains walnuts). Thankfully one of the other guests in our party happened to have a Benadryl. It's like we were an invisible table because the smaller tables immediately next to us seemed to have decent service.
