Will I go back? Yes, because the food is delicious, but I will never again use it as a venue for a group setting. Too bad my most disappointing experience had to be for my birthday.

I have never been a wine drinker but i totally am now thanks to this place!! reasonably priced by the glass you can try anything before you bye it. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and friendly this is not a snobby joint. I highly reccomend the bruschetta they have some great combinations. The cucumber lemonade is absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is suprisingly intamate but also great for a group!!!
Great place for date night! Bruschetta is awesome! I wish they had wine flights, but maybe one day....

For many Gilbert residents, Postinos is the local equivalent to Boston's "Cheers"...a friendly pace where everybody knows your name, and the drinks are poured with a smile. The staff has genuine charisma, and the brunch is to die for (you haven't LIVED until you've indulged in mimosas and French toast--if today was my last day, I would eat that French toast three TIMES.) The ambience is sexy enough for an intimate, romantic date night, but it's also cheerful, fun, and open enough for a business lunch or a girls night out. Try Postinos for yourself today, you won't be disappointed.

I've been wanting to try their bruschetta for a while now. Got a chance to go today, yay. Although the food was excellent, the service was subpar, that is why I only gave it 3 stars. From all the reviews, I thought I would be getting great food along with great service. Since it was my first time here, I don't know if it was just a fluke or not. Anyway, I felt like we were being ignored and the server just didn't seem very friendly.

The cucumber honey lemonade was not as tasty as I thought it would be. The lemonade tasted like it was made from concentrated lemon juice. Not good. Just stick to the teas lol. 

We ordered the Bella Postino, which came with artichoke dip and white bean hummus. The hummus was amazing. We also got the roast beef panini which was ok, nothing to brag about. 

My favorite type of bruschetta was the salami and the smoked salmon. Will be back for those! Yum.

Overall:

Food, 5 stars
Service, 2 stars.

Went last night to take my wife out for our first anniversary. We love fine meats, cheeses and a great atmosphere. I don't know if we are not hip enough or we smelled funny but we were ignored and treats as if we were second class. After waiting 30 minutes to even get a drink we had to leave, not because we were hungry but because we were ignored and when they finally came to get out order they started taking it then without cause left and didn't come back for 15 more minutes. It was insulting and a waste 50 minutes of our life. If your not a hipster, and I thought I was, don't waste your time. Plenty of places that care more in D-town Gilbert.
Great place. I was expecting a full Italian dinner selection, but it was Panini's and appetizers. Well worth the visit.

My cousin and I have been talking about coming here for months! She asked me where I wanted to go for a late birthday lunch, we both decided Postinos! 

We orders the bruschetta of course. The salmon, salami, mozzarella and tomato and the pecans?? The last one wasn't my favorite. We also ordered a roast beef sandwich with a side of salad and hummus for an appetizer. It was a lot of food for just us two!  My favorite was the salmon bruschetta, the favor just melted in my mouth. I ordered the "fresh squeezed lemonade" it was not fresh, I could taste the high fructose corn syrup in it! I asked to change it for a cucumber drink. And that didn't hit the spot either! I just stuck with water. 

Overall, I thought the food was good and would come back again for another meal. The customer service definitely needs some work. It was a busy Monday morning when we went and there was only one waitress attending to full tables in the restaurant. It took her about 5-7 minutes to come back to give a what we were waiting for.

Main Points:
-Great Happy Hour for drinks
-Cool trendy restaurant setting

Review:
I am so happy Gilbert has welcomed great places like Postino that we would have otherwise had to go all the way to Scottsdale to visit! It has a fun atmosphere and is a great spot to get together with friends and enjoy some food and drinks.

It's been said in previous reviews, but the $5 wine by the glass or pitchers of beer are a great deal if you stop in between 11am-5pm, 7 days a week.  On my last trip there they had Firestone Walker Pilsner on tap, and I haven't come across too many local places that carry Firestone's beer (I heart their 805!).  Postino's $20 bruschetta and bottle of wine deal is also perfect for any occasion, my favorite bruschetta of the moment is the Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone!

Go eat at Postino...nuff said!

Great Food, great Wine selection, friendly service, fun atmosphere!!   Will return for sure.   My only suggestion would be have a DD or take a taxi as Gilbert police hate "anyone" that drinks any amount and they will invent reasons to pull you over.

I've heard this place get dumped on for being too hipster, but I absolutely love the ambiance. If I'm going out to eat I want great food and atmosphere. The selection of beers and wine is great, and they have delicious mimosas and bellinis! My favorite thing here is the bruschetta. They have really good happy hour type deals. Great place to go with a small group to enjoy drinks and shareable eats.

I come here solely for the bruschettas and nothing else!!

August 20th, my birthday, was the second time i've been to this location I came here for birthday lunch in the middle of my workday.  I went to the Arcadia location on the 18th to celebrate my birthday with friends.  The bread here at the Gilbert location was muchhhhh better  the Arcadia's bread was holey and hard!

did i say how much i love the bruschettas? oh i DO!!  My favorites include: Prosciutto and figs, apple, brie and figs, Tomato Jam and Sheep cheese.. i usually get all three and try a new one for the fourth choice. Ricotta and dates are good, on some days.. 

I prefer beer over wine due to headaches/migraines.  So can't comment on the wine. Beer is good here though..

Just wish the bruschettas were not $13.50! 10 bucks would be a good price for lunch..

I love going to Postinos! They have great $5 wine specials during the day and their bruschetta is amazing! I also really love their roast beef sandwich. It's a great place to sit on the patio when the weather is nice!

Downtown Gilbert has been way too popular so we only go here once or twice a year for the Monday/Tuesday special. If you are signed up for Eposse it guarantees you a reservation and a dessert. 

For $20 we did the bruschetta (ricotta and dates / salmon and pesto / seasonal tomato jam and light cheese / prosciutto and figs) with a bottle of Malbec. We also shared the raspberry chicken salad. It's my favorite salad on the menu. We also shared the salted caramel dessert...tasty caramel with chocolate covered corn nuts and pretzels.

It gets really crowded but the service is spot on.

Great food and wine selection. We were so full with out that gross heavy feeling. 

Even when the wind and rain came in hard they handled it great and had positive attitudes. I was there with my sister, who is pregnant, and they got us sat inside ad quickly as they could. The whole staff seem to work together at covering the floor- and consider the whole restaurant as their "section". As a restaurant manager I can really appreciate that. It ensures that every guest is getting taken care of.

If I lived in the area this would be a new hang out for me. I certainly know my sister and husband will be enjoying future experiences there!!

I've been to Postino Central (in Phoenix) and Postino Annex (in Tempe), so this was the third Postino location I visited.

The quality of the food was the same, but compared with the other Postino locations, I would say that this location was more dimly lit and the servers were younger. It felt more loud. There is more inside seating.

So far, I liked Postino Central the best because it was more quiet, and the patrons were older and thus, more calm. But this location has a lot more spaces to park your car and there are a lot of cool shops nearby that you can explore on foot.

Ten friends and I got a table near the entrance around 7pm on a Wednesday night. The place was completely full, and it was extremely noisy - I could barely hear the person in front of me.

I would probably come here when it's less packed and during the day time and probably with fewer friends.

Phenomenal lunch.  Everything made is fresh and delicious.  I had the red pepper soup, Hannah field salad and roast beef sandwich.  The selection of wines were nice.  It wins the fresh taste list with me and healthy choices are available on the menu.
Postino East is one of my favorite places!!! Had my birthday party there!! The wine and food are always awesome!!

not sure. food is great. but the server who started out with us didn't finish is even though he just started. strange

i asked for ice as i wanted a chilled moscato that the original server told me was sweet & chilled. not sweet or chilled & the ice came once i was done with my wine! not good service.

soooooo my vote is out. i'll wait until my next visit to give my final vote.

This restaurant was AMAZING. I loved everything about it. The food was delicious - had the butchers board and the bruschetta. There was so many bruschetta options! The wine was very good as well. The atmosphere was so much fun. I loved the set up and the music was on point. Song after song that played made the experience that much better. The only downside was we had a long wait but it was a Friday so it was expected. Tried to make a reservation but they don't make them for parties less than 5. On the plus side got to drink our bottle of wine while we waited!

I met up with the divine Aly d. to check out the new postinos east on Saturday 4/14 for a lovely lunch date. This is a great time to go because its not overly crowded early in the afternoon. . 

Imbibe:  we each ordered a glass of vino for five dollars and we both enjoyed very much. i went with a nice cab called bliss and Aly ordered a Zin. Wine is a must here.

I ordered a turkey panini, with smoked turkey, tomatoes, provolone, fresh greens and house made pesto....the sandwich was so delicious and the flavors of the pesto was not overpowering just right.  Aly ordered a soup and half a panini. the soup was an excellent choice since it was a cold & rainy day out.

as far as atmosphere..its not as hipster as the one in arcadia but still nice vibe. a couple next to us had a screaming toddler on their hands & poor mom had to leave to not disturb the other customers. I can tune it out for the most part however the ladies in front of us were clearly irritated and they were covering their ears with their hands...too funny that parents bring their kids to a bar to hangout.

overall I like that concept and the restaurant has a very open feel and its a welcome to gilbert. I probably would pop in during the weekday instead of weekend and will update if it improves to 5 star. By the way big thanks to my girl Aly for paying for my lunch!

great place. got to get their early on their wine and prosciutto special night to get a decent seat. it gets crowded and a bit loud at times but the atmosphere is still nice for hanging out or even a date night. good location to walk old town gilbert while waiting for a table if you show up later.

It's a nice place to go and relax. The wine selection is good and the atmosphere is great.

The menu is very small and basic but the food is great.

We are visiting family in Mesa and were looking for a great place to eat. We are tired of the same big chain restaurants. This was a great experience. The staff was very prompt. The atmosphere is hip urban industrial with a comfortable feel. Happy hour was a great deal and the local beers were excellent. I had a very delicious panini with meats arugula and a little olive tapenade on ciabatta. My wife had the Ni√ßoise salad. We are foodies and this place blows away restaurants from Seattle to San Diego.

One of my favorite places to eat. The atmosphere is great, food is even better. Highly recommend the bruschetta. My favorites are the Brie and fig, salami and pesto, and artichoke! You cannot go wrong!
Very nice place to relax and drink a glass of wine! Staff is kind and very prompt... open atmosphere & trendy!
Great food, service and overall vibe.  Definitely a place to come for a few hours away from kids!

My friend introduced me to this place. Very interesting food and lots of wine selections. We shared a bruschetta board and it was plenty for the two of us. The apple and Brie bruschetta is very sweet so save it till the end for "dessert." Absolutely delicious. I'll definitely return. My only complaint is that the service was a little slow. I felt like we waited quit a while before someone took our food order, and the restaurant wasn't extremely busy.
Very nice sitting out on the patio.  The bruschetta was delicious.  I can't wait to go back and try some more things.
Bruschetta boards, $5 pitchers of beer.. enough said. Oh and their autostrada sandwhich was delicious too.

Great bruschetta and wine.  Very hipster and trendy.  Felt under dressed in my casual clothes at night.  Felt as though I should have worn jeans and heels.  Waiter was sort of high-brow, but nothing to complain about.  Fast service.

EDIT:  Enjoyed brunch at Postinos on Sunday...what a great find!  After being told the wait was over an hour at nearby restaurants, we noticed Postino was open...so we tried it!  VERY reasonable prices, much cheaper than I expected.  We had two kiddos with us, and they loved their food.  My entr√©e, my mimosa and my daughters meal and chocolate milk were $22 with tax!  Super fast service...left feeling like I didn't bust my diet, just right portions.
Great staff and superb food as well as one of the best happy hours in town.

K and I dropped off C for his rehearsal for the AYT production of Dracula. On this particular night Postino has the awesome deal of Bruschetta and a bottle of wine for $20 after 8pm so we headed over. We were sat right away by a very pleasant hostess. Since we had 90 minutes before the Bruschetta/wine deal, we opted  to have a glass of wine and split a sandwich while we waited. K had the Perfekt Riesling ($11) and I had the Fable Sangiovese-Merlot ($10). Both wines were fine and we enjoyed sipping them and people watching. We thoroughly enjoyed the Roast Beef Panini ($10) as well. Super yummy. Before we knew it the 8 o'clock hour was upon us and we ordered our Bruschetta and bottle of wine. A perfect date night. The whole while many different servers came by, kept our water glasses full and basically made sure we were well-taken care off. One of the many great things about Postino is that all the servers are functioning as a team and they all seem to work towards the same goal, customer satisfaction. 
Time flew by and before long it was time to pick up C from rehearsal. Adam recorked our bottle of wine so we could take it home and we wrapped up another awesome time at Postino. Winner winner chicken dinner.
Awesome customer service. Great food. 5 Stars.

Great location for a relaxing evening.

Postino's features bruschetta in many combinations as well as panini's.  The bruschetta bard comes with 4 bruschetta of your choice.The food is great, the wine selection is very good (ask for recommendations from the staff if you need it.)

The happy hour ends at 5:00, but they have $5 wines and $20/bottle.  Several nights a week, they feature a special after 8 for a bottle of wine and a board of bruschetta for $20.

The service is great and friendly.
Nice classy, perfect spot for catching up with the bestie. Bellini's, Mimosa's and Bruschetta Assorted Board was Divine.

Last night we decided to enjoy the amazing weather and eat outside. My friend also wanted to bring her dog who had been cooped up all day while they worked.  We called to confirm that they were dog friendly as they were listed here on Yelp.  We had a great time. Our waiter McKinley was GREAT as was all the waitstaff who stopped by to cuddle with the dog, they even brought out a little cup of sliced chicken for him.  Never disappointed here by the food or the service

My parents and I are such a fan of Postinos East. We have come by on their busy Sunday mornings and they will do their best to try to get you seated quickly. Every time we have come here they have always gotten our order right, the food was delicious, great beer/wine selection. Their meat and cheese board with the artichoke dip on the side is delicious. Now that we have moved to the east valley, we will be coming here more often. Thank you Uptown Projects for expanding.

They had gluten free bread for the bruschetta and paninis.  There was also an outdoor area where the kids could play.  The outside areas don't have full tables.  They are little standing tables or coffee tables.  It was really nice at dinner time.  Perfect weather.  We also had  grilled vegetable appetizer, which was really yummy.  The waitress was great.  We were really worried we would get ignored outside but we weren't.

Great location in downtown Gilbert. Impressive outdoor seating area with nice ambiance. Fair Beer and wine selection. Don't see any hard stuff here. Underwhelmed by the menu. Bruschetta, panini's, and salads. That's about it. 

Olive starter. Panini. These were good, but not my idea of going out for dinner. Would be much more excited if it was lunch time. 

The place has tons of space both indoors and out. Great for large groups.

Amazing food, great wine! The atmosphere is relaxed with both indoor and outdoor seating. The only problem I've had is they don't have dedicated servers for the tables. Because of that if something doesn't get put in for your table it takes quite a while for someone to notice you didn't receive what you ordered.

Ok, so this place has amazing service, even better food, a great wine and beer selection, and has a perfect ambiance. Noisy and upbeat, but not overly-loud. This is a really fun place to go; my better half and I enjoy date nights here very much. :)

So why only 4 stars? Because unless you're going at 2pm on a Tuesday, be prepared to wait. Don't mind a wait? Well, you might mind a FOUR HOUR wait. Postino does not accept reservations - neither location does... Well, unless you have a group of eight hundred. With that in mind, this cannot be your last minute decision for happy hour at 6pm on any given night. This must be strategicailly planned - a mission, if you will. (Won't you please?) If your date or a member of your party can leave work at 3pm during the week to snag a table to hold until the rest of you arrive at 6pm, I'd advise that. 

The Arcadia location has valley which is pretty awesome - this location should take a hint. Parking is crazy!! You'd be better off just walking from home, actually.

We love Postino's haven't been in awhile but they changed up the ciabatta bread & didn't press the sandwich. Wasn't bad but was more like a sandwich then a panini. Please bring back the original ciabatta bread & press our paninis. We still love you though!

The bruschetta is amazing. My favorite is the artichoke one. 
The East location also does an excellent job making gluten free food. The bruschetta can be made on tomatoes or green apples.

I was super excited when Postino East opened. Postino Central is amazing and I had high hopes for the East location. 

My friend and I decided to try them for Sunday Brunch...."Meh", is about as good as I can give it. The service was slow, the food menu limited and the drink menu even worse (no bloody marys on Sunday? WTH?) and there were flies everwhere. Gross! 

I am sure they're better for the evening fare, but brunch left a lot to be desired. :(

Amazing food and wine options. Bruschetta planks or the Mediterranean salad are my go to menu choices, but every time I try something new, I'm always pleasantly surprised. Indoor and outdoor seating options, and even a more lounge like grassy area to the side if you just want to chat and relax. Super dog friendly spot. We love to throw our pup in the backseat and take her with us for lunch. They offer puppy water and the staff always treats your dog like a welcomed guest! It's a team atmosphere (all servers pool tips) so you seem to get very consistent service since everyone is helping everyone. You do have a main server, but if your server isn't readily available and you need something, you don't have to feel bad about asking another walking by employee. One of my favorite date spots, meet up with the girlfriends, or really for any occasion. They have some great specials too! Monday and Tuesday nights are $20 for a bottle of wine and a plank of bruschetta, glasses of wine and pitchers of beer are $5 before 5pm everyday, and all day everyday they offer bellinis and mimosas for $5! Definitely worth checking out :)

After I posted my review on the awful experience we had during our 1st visit together to the Gilbert location I was immediately contacted by a rep from Postino's who was very apologetic and took the time to hear my story , and invited us back on the house. I took my best friend with me for her birthday and from start to finish the service and food was absolutely divine, and exactly what you'd except if you've come to love the Postino's brand here in the valley. I decided to save my gift card for a night out with my husband,  so I should note that the staff had no idea I was coming back for a second try.

Some of the best bruschetta anywhere and on Monday and Tuesdy nights, they have a $20 Bottle & Board special. Any bottle of wine and board of 4 types of bruschetta. Awesome deal but expect it to be busy.

I planned a "Bachelortte Dinner" here and unfortunately they only take reservations for 8+ so I wasn't able to make a reservation. We arrived early, however, as expected there was a wait. The wait took longer than we had anticipated, which wouldn't have been an issue but we had a surprise party starting at 7pm sharp somewhere else. 

I let the hostess and server know and they made every effort to expedite our meal to get us out on time. I very much appreciated their efforts. They didn't have to hurry or help us out, but they did anyway. The food was delicious (as always) and the wine recommendation was great!

After a couple of attempts to come here (too busy...man!) I finally went a couple weeks ago. The food is consistent with the other locations. I had the prosciutto and fig sandwich, it was good, but a bit too much prosciutto for my taste (I like a lighter hand with it, but I can see why they do it that way) and the italian salad, which is fairly good, but not my fave. Would like to get some bruschetta, but will probably frequent the central location now that I am moving out of the East valley. I like their open patio, and the misters help with the heat. I also am a fan of their fresh squeezed 5$ bellinis before 5 pm....very tasty.

We came for dinner, went to the bar while waiting for our table and enjoyed the bar so much we canceled the table.  The vibe at this place is awesome. Great music, fun decor, friendly staff, good food. Started with the butcher block which was very good. I had the tomato soup and it was amazing. Hubs had the potato soup and liked it too. We split the Nine Iron panini and it was just okay. Servers brought us someone else's food three times which became a little tiring.  Overall we really liked this place!

Score! I was skeptical about this place but i was pleasantly surprised! 
Def would go back!

Honestly, it was a fall back dinner choice. 

The decor inside is nice and welcoming. 
The music a little loud making everyone else talk louder (something I noticed enough to remember). 
It was very very busy and I was eating with wife almost instantly. 
They had delicious beer choices on tap which made me happy. 

I had the "nine iron" panini, and I argued with myself about whether it was the best sandwich I ever had (I think it won). The panini paired with the SanTan Amber perfectly. 

The service to get our food was quick albeit a little short when my wife didn't know the difference in ciabatta bread and focaccia bread. Also, we would have stayed and order more beer, but our staff didn't return for 20 minutes, both my wife and I with 0 beer. 

I hate that this sounds negative because my experience wasn't that negative. I'm just trying to point out the little things I noticed that bothered me. Still 4 stars in my book.

rockin brunch?...epic fail. We tried the rockin brunch today and considering the other choices in the area for breakfast I would never come here for breakfast again. The music was way too loud for a breakfast and after asking three times to have the music turned down we figured they just were not going to do it despite the fact that they said they would. The food was average at best. Would recommend Liberty Market or Farmhouse for breakfast instead.
Really love this place! I always have a good time whether it's date night or girls night. I love the bruschetta board and bellini's!

Bruschetta, wine and delicious dessert! 

I have been a couple of times and haven't been disappointed thus far. I will say that it does get busy, because Gilbert, AZ is lacking alternative places to go to for good drink and atmosphere. So plan on waiting for a table at night. Otherwise, hit up the patio! 

I will be back!

One of my favorite restaurants around! Great wine atmosphere, service and food! There is not much more you can ask for in a restaurant! Also, the wine deals on Tuesday nights are fantastic the only problem is you have to get there early or you end up waiting forever because the place is so dang popular. A must visit if you are in the downtown gilbert area!

This place is amazing! Delicious food. Delicious wine. Great atmosphere. Bottle and board night on Monday and Tuesday nights is the best deal hands down. It appears to be busy all the time, therefore the wait time can be a little long, which is the only negative. The service has been great every time I've been...which is many times! Can't go wrong with any of the bruschetta options in my opinion. The paninis are also great, and the salted caramel sundae is so good you'll want to lick the caramel shooter to get every last drop of it.

Delicious food.  If you are opting out of wine, try the cucumber honey lemonade.  It is so crisp and refreshing!  You cannot go wrong with the bruschetta--my favorite is the roasted pepper and goat cheese.  I could have done without the toddlers on either side of us, but hey, when in Gilbert.

Happy hour is a great deal!

Their sandwiches are good, their wine is plentiful, the atmosphere is fun!  Typically a pretty long wait to get a table.  But fun and tasty.  Definitely worth a visit!

Great Service, all employees are very personable. Wine selection is fantastic (Malbec was delicious) and I think my water was refilled 17 times in the span of one hour, Way to go. Can't go wrong with the Brushetta and definitely recommend the butchers board. Go on a nice night and sit on the patio for a wonderful evening.

I love Postinos, and frequently go there on the weekend for brunch. Recently, I made a reservation to have my birthday dinner there with a total of 14 people. They sat us outside, which they warned me about when I made the reservation, but they assured me it would be plenty warm enough in January with the patio heaters. They were certainly right, and everyone I spoke to about it said they were more than comfortable. The waiters were extremely accommodating. With such a big group, I expected to have to have a single tab, but the main waiter said he could split it up by couple, which was very much appreciated with such a large group. The waiters came around often to refill drinks, clear dishes, and generally make sure we had everything we needed. The food and drinks were as great as they always are. Overall, I had such a great time, thanks to the staff at Postinos East.

This by far is one of the best wine bars around....Have been to both the Gilbert and Arcadia locations and both of them are great.  Was there last  night with friends from out of town, they loved it. Do not go there if you want a full bar..this bar only serves beer and wine!

Showed up on Monday evening for the wine & bruschetta board special. I'm impressed! I can't wait to try the rest of the menu. Our server was very attentive. Love the indoor/ outdoor seating! My one complaint would be the volume of the music.. it's hard to have a conversation if you have to shout across the table to be heard.

.....after a personal and very prompt reach out by the general manager I will give a slightly better review. He's tried to make my bad experience right which is what customer service is all about. Will review again at a later date.

Loved this place! First timer that heard others ranting and raving how good this place was and it did hold up to the talk. I am not much of a wine person but this place has way more to offer than a good glass of wine. The atmosphere, open walls and fire places along with comfy, cozy couches to make you feel cozy at home like you are on your own outside patio. The food was delicious. I went with a large group of co-workers, we ordered a little bit of everything. I personally enjoyed the artichoke dip!! Yes we did have a 45min wait but as we waited, chairs were supplied and ice water was given plus you can order wine while you wait....and it does not require a walk to the bar, they come to you! I noticed lots of groups of women, yes it is probably more of a "girly" bar/restaurant, but men if you want to cater to you lady....I think this would make you score some extra points. Service was excellent, very friendly and timely with drinks and food once we were seated.

We headed over to Postino East after a long meeting in Gilbert. We had the bruschetta - four different toppings and the butcher's block. Service was great, food was fabulous and the manager could not have been nicer.
Can't wait to return.
Great atmosphere! I would go back for appetizers and drinks, I was not impressed with the entre options... I would recommend this place for lunch, as it is more of a sandwich/salad type of place....

Was here with a large group last week. Everyone wasn't completely sure it was the right place because they don't have a sign yet, but it is right across the street from Liberty Market and Joe's BBQ on the northwest corner. I don't recommend coming with a large group because you are not able to hear anyone but the person you are yelling at next to you, due to the music being really REALLY loud. I certainly don't mind loud music, but this was loud enough that I was looking for a dance floor. My voice was squeaky and raw by the time I left due to how loudly I had to talk. How can you have a good time and enjoy a meal when you are screaming into the face of the person next to you?

As for the food- EXCELLENT. You get plenty for the price too, totally worth it.  Also love that you can get a "shorty" glass of brew for a reasonable price. I'm happy there is another happenin' place in Downtown Gilbert, but I can't go beyond 3 stars. That's how much the noise turned me off.

Good food but expensive drinks. $13 for a standard wine is ridiculous.
I had the Turkey panini. Pretty and my wife had a combo plate. Nice portions for $11 each...

OMG! This is one of my new favorite places!! Happy Hour every day from 11am to 5pm is fantastic.  Tried the bruschetta board, loved every one I had, each one is fantastic in its one way.  All the flavors are perfectly balanced.  The bread is soft but holds up and doesn't get soggy, it was absolute perfection!

The noun bruschetta comes from the Roman dialect verb, "bruscare," meaning 'to roast over coals.'

Postino's has always been my favorite Upward Projects establishment.  Ever since I stepped foot into their Arcadia 1950's post office location, I was hooked.  While it's been a few years since I've been inside a Postino's, all it took was one bite of bruschetta to make me feel that same old love again.

I. Love. Bread.  Even more than Oprah!  Top it with some good stuff and I'm hooked.  You can get four choices (out of twelve), cut into fourths, for $14.75.  Don't feel like bruschetta? Try the Butcher's Block, a Cheese Board, or The Bounty for you crudit√©s loving fiends.  They also have paninis, soups, salads, and dessert.  To be noted, they also offer gluten-free bread for an upcharge.  Wine, beer, mimosas, and bellinis are served so have a drink while you eat.  If you're not into booze, I hear their Honey Cucumber Lemonade is refreshing.

All in all, I love Postino's.  Take a friend, take a lover, take your mother, or just take your bad ass self. Just get over to your nearest Postino's and eat some bruschetta!

This is my first time in Arizona and we were staying at a hotel in Gilbert. We originally were going to eat at Snooze Eatery but changed our mind at the last minute. We were seating quickly and greeted with nothing but smiles.  The peace bellini was on of the best I have had and I definitely suggest the roast beef panini. All in all I was pleased with my visit.

My friends and I went here last night for dinner... Holy moly it was so great! 
The atmosphere is lovely and has a bit of a posh feel to it, with seating inside and out on the patio. The tables (inside and out) had tea lights on them which added to the relaxed feel. 
Despite how crazy busy it was, we were seated right away and chose to sit out on the patio. The place was also quite open, surprisingly, regardless of how packed it was.

Our waitress was awesome, very knowledgeable about the menu (considering we hadn't been there before) and was really polite and friendly. The manager  made his rounds throughout the night and also stopped by our table to make sure everything was okay... the service was really impressive!

I got the "Nine Iron" panini on focaccia bread (sans tomato and condiments) which came with a side salad and a choice of dressing (I got the herb vinaigrette) and I got an iced tea as well.

SO, first thing's first: the panini. It was HUGE (and delicious). On the sandwich was bacon, chicken, fresh mozzarella, and lettuce. It was seriously glorious, and I couldn't even finish it; I ended up taking half home. 
The side salad was basic, but the herb vinaigrette made it heavenly. I typically eat all my salads dry because I don't enjoy dressing, but this was just so good. It is made in-house from a lemon and mustard base. 
I am also pretty sure they put crack in the iced tea because dear god it was amazing. I don't know how they brew it, but it was the best iced tea I'd ever had. 
My friends shared a panini and a selection of the bruschetta, and were also in food heaven. 

The price was very reasonable, with my meal costing about $17, including tip. I'm sure if you were to get wine or something of that sort, the bill would add up easily, but for what my friends and I got, it was really decently priced.

I am absolutely coming here again!

Close friend and I visited Postino for a late lunch on a Friday afternoon to catch up with each other. I had never been the downtown Gilbert area but I will be coming back for sure to visit this place. It has an urban wine loft feel, they have a beautiful airy patio, bruschetta and appetizers served on wooden chopping boards. I kept mistakenly referring to it as "Positano" after the seaside Italian town, because it looks like a place that could BE in Italy. 
The staff was friendly and fast. We ordered the soup/salad combo for $10: the "soup of the moment" was delicious as well as the mixed greens salad. Tip: 11am - 5pm all week they have $5 glasses of wine and $5 mimosas/bellinis. 
Definitely planning on coming back to try $20 bottle of wine nights on Monday/Tuesday.
Who says you can have enough wine?

It's a little too busy on the weekends for my tastes, but I cannot think of a better place to go for a nice, enjoyable dinner with friends on a weeknight. The last time I was there, we had several waves of food and drinks, and we stayed for a long time and enjoyed every minute. Go when you can sit outside!

My father in law brought us here on our latest trip to Arizona, and we absolutely loved our meal.

The standout - as I'm sure everyone says - is the bruschetta. Both my fianc√© and father in law got a sampling of four each - I tried several and enjoyed all of them. The key is not only the great variety of flavor combinations, but that each one is artfully put together - the tastes and the visual presentation. I was very impressed. Ask for the server's recommendations - ours definitely steered us to what was special on the menu that day.

I got a nicoise salad which was perfectly good. It was filled with lots of fresh ingredients, and I enjoyed it. It just couldn't hold a candle to the bruschetta!

Our servers were nice and waters stayed full. Water was filtered, too, which we had found not every restaurant in the area does. We sat outside on a lovely sunny fall day, and it was nice, although if the heat is too much for you, indoor seating is limited.

Wine selection looked good, though I didn't have any. We will be back again!

Postino East . . . the best effort by the owners of the restaurant group to date! We've been a fan since the original opened in Arcadia, but now we have one in our own "hood!"!! Yippee! Our brunch today (Easter Sunday) was as perfect as any other Sunday. We sat at the bar and the service by Chandler and Daniel was like every other time we'd sat at the bar . . . perfect and professional. Always a delight to dine there!
Enjoyed lunch.  Love the Bruschetta boards! Salads and panini great also.  Pleasant outdoor seating.

Always friendly service. Good suggestions and selections for beer and wine. Tiny but yummy menu. Way too loud. Music is so loud, every table has to yell to be heard. Probably okay for some, too much for me.

I hesitate to write a review, only because I don't want to share my little hidden gem. I'm in love, I wish I knew more people who didn't have to  work during happy hour, $5 glasses of wine are hard to pass up. The peach Bellini is super sweeeet, but a nice change of pace from the usual. The ladies I dined with seemed to enjoy the white blend on the servers suggestion (and when he suggests a bottle, just do it - its worth it's weight in gold on the experience scale.). 

How could I forget the bruschetta? Uh hello!! A may za zing.. I can't get enough, such delicious combinations and choices. The experience is endless, I can't wait to go back.. 








Lastly, my little secret. The Gilbert location has an outdoor bachi (sp?) ball court, they have a few tables set up outside, so bringing the kids is an option. The servers are attentive and must know women day drinking $5 glasses of wine with their children in tow are very generous (always responsibly obviously)...there's something to be said about a place that kids are allowed to play and mommy time is equally valued.

I wanna go back for date night with the hubs or cocktails with friends without kids next time (just  to get the full experience, nothing to do with the aforementioned $5 happy hour glasses of wine) ;)

Well, I'm not sure how I feel about this place. The night didn't start off to well since they didn't honor our reservation (I know they don't usually let you reserve a table but since we were a large group they said they would). We ended up at two small tables pushed together which was not at all enough room for the nine of us. But we made do and once we had ordered a couple of bottles of wine we got a little more comfortable. The $20 for a bottle of wine and board of bruscetta is such a great deal. Two of us had coupons for free bruscetta boards in addition to that so we had ourselves a feast. By the end of the night, we had 6 boards of bruscetta and three bottles of wine and the bill only came out to about a hundred bucks. Not bad for 9 people!!! Plus they even gave us a free dessert for the birthday girls!

I think I prefer the atmosphere at the Central location and to be honest I think the food is a little better there as well (even though its the same menu, I just mean the preparation). However, Postino in Gilbert is a-ok in my book.

Definitely five stars for this place.  What's that, you want to know more?

Let me tell you  - an amazing wine list, with champagnes and all wines $5 per glass during happy hour?  And amazing appetizers and salads?  The most amazing, friendly, and funny staff I have seen in years? A beautiful interior, great location, and absolutely fabulous outdoor patio?  YES.  PLEASE.

I wish I would have found this place sooner during my travels. I would have ate here every single meal.  

Parking is plentiful in Gilbert streets.  Is there a down side?  Well, the menu descriptions (and ingredient choices) are woefully hipster.  That may turn off some.  The food and drink we had, however, was fantastic.
Food was mediocre at best. The bread for the bruschetta was 2 inches thick and the toppings just seemed to be lacking in every way. Not sure what all the fuss is, the hour wait was not worth it.

You got to love the ambiance in this place. Wish they had a sign so I could have found this place faster. Very cool design of the restaurant. The food looks very good. My partner and I just stopped by for some wine. It is a very cool place to hang out especially if you are a 30 something, which I am not.

I will go back to try the food and more of their wines. I am anxious for a very positive result!

You know you've driven by Postino's in downtown Gilbert and have seen ALL those people on the dining patio with a line waiting to get in. You know you've wondered, "Is it really THAT good?" I'm here to confirm yes, it most certainly is. 

I've been here a couple times with friends, and most recently with my sister for brunch. Top notch every time. The menu offers sandwiches, brunch, and the bruschetta for which they are famous (and rightfully so). Sit inside or outside, and enjoy a fantastic glass or bottle of wine from their excellent list. 

When the weather is nice, the huge front glass will be opened and the inside and outside seating areas seem to become one. Outside seating offers a large fireplace in the winter, and misters in the summer. The back even has a seating area on fake grass for the kiddos to play around. The atmosphere cannot be beat. One of my very favorite foodie spots in Gilbert. 

This Postino location has great parking options--look for spots back by the Gilbert water tower where you park for the Gilbert Farmers Market.

They don't take reservations for less than eight people, and it's always slammed for dinner.  So if you'd like to wait an hour for your party of 7 or fewer to eat, go right ahead and eat here.  I'm sure this place is good .. for Gilbert.  But I can get reservations at any restaurant in Kierland on short notice.  Do yourself a favor and make the drive half an hour North for better food and customer service.

I ordered a vegetarian sandwich. It was very disappointing as was the service. The sandwich had a few small pieces of veges. It was like eating a slices of bread with a hint of veges. Overpriced food! Nice location and clean restaurant.

What a wonderful experience we just had at Postino East! Lunch was absolutely delicious and the service was outstanding! We ordered the Nine Iron Sandwich and our server suggested adding avocado, which made it extra delicious! The iced tea kept coming, which made us especially happy on this hot summer day! Thank you, Postino for making our lunch memorable. We will be back!

They seem to ALWAYS be busy, which in itself should say something. Went there for the 4th time last night, and they had their normal special (which I think they said is Sun, Mon & Tues), of spend $20 on a bottle and get a board of brochette. We had another couple with us, so ordered 3 bottles of wine and 3 boards (each board with 4 different kinds of brochette on it). I only give it 4 stars, because they sometimes are very slow. And, their selection of wine is a bit limited. Only carrying one brand of each type of wine.

Scott was our server. We sat at the bar. He was very nice and personable.  The bruchetta dish was amazing. A like party in your mouth. We tried the apple one, the prosciutto, the tomato jam, and the pistachio. The pistachio was my least fav, but the other 3 were ridiculously tasty! Try the bruchetta and the different combinations. A must!

Great place. The service was superb. The bruschetta we started with was fantastic. My favorite had prosciutto figs and cheese. Delicious. I thought the prosciutto brie and fig jam panini was to die for. Although it's a wine bar we drank beer because that's more my style and they had a great selection of craft and local beers and its only 7.50 for a pitcher.

More than the food and drink the ambience was great such a pleasant outdoor seating area with live music. I appreciated the very chill nature of the place and think this is a great place to hang out and have a leisurely meal with friends. Very hip vibes but no too pricey and a diverse crowd.

Wish I was a local because if so this would be my new hang out.

Came here for brunch and the food was fantastic.  My friend was able to bring her dog to the outside patio and we relaxed and enjoyed some delicious food.  My friend goes here quite often for their wine and I can't wait to join them as if breakfast is any indication, it will be amazing.  Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating.

Last Saturday night my wife went over to Postino to check it out. We have lived in Gilbert for several years and have seen this location as a revolving door for restaurant concepts. In my opinion,  Postino pinpointed the right demographic and location and delivered in a big way. From the time we were greeted to the time we left we had a top notch experience. The wait was about 20-25 minutes on a Saturday night around 7:30. We sat outside on a day that it was around 110 and with the misters we were totally comfortable. My wife and I loved the simplicity of the menu - starters, salads, panninis, bruschetta, dessert... EASY. We both ordered salads, I had the Field Greens with Chicken, she had the Mediterranean. Both were artfully presented, fresh and delicious. We loved the atmosphere, music and upbeat vibe flowing through the place. I asked to speak to the GM or Manager to convey our thoughts - 2 energetic guys came out to greet my wife and I. Phil and Cristobal, both managers came out and we let them know that we had found our "new place" - they both were excited and you could tell they were passionate about what they are doing with Postino. We'll definitely be going back and have already made plans to make it over to the Arcadia location.
Postinos is ALWAYS good! Consistently great service, great food, great beer and wine! It's the perfect place to go when the weather is great, their patio is awesome. But really it's great anytime!
